Dialogue.A84F5286480F3CA51C9E8B94FCD52530_AD7A481: (Humming ...) [10]The core, the deep, [14.6]the wires that weep ...[20]the heart, the eye, [25]unbring the sky ... [30]the hearth in flight, [35]the shackled sight ...[40]you keep the lock [44.8]and leave the light ...[54](Humming ...)
Dialogue.C7C3327F46BA9D3712F85697C9402031_AD7A481: (Humming) [10]The vril shall cease, abeyant hope ... [20.0]The deep, the dark ...[24.4]The fence, the moat ... [30]The vril shall cease, abeyant hope ... [39.0]The deep, the dark ... [42.4]The fence, the moat ...
Dialogue.5C47928F4B58CD5C9F5D29A7D7A0BDF3_EF8738C: (Inhales) Time to spend a penny, perhaps.
Dialogue.7DFA275543E15CF59A0F32A5BFA14B8F_F2E10BE: (lipsmacks) A sip of water would suffice.
Dialogue.315C072C4930F6E68DF4CBA2269627E3_F2E10BE: (lipsmacks) I could certainly use a drink.
Dialogue.57F8EF124DEFD6FD03F9DD8550845C91_EF8738C: (lipsmacks) When did I last drink something?
Dialogue.6712527043087C4D22128DACDB8E0934_F5807AE: 139 has been perhaps the most difficult IS to study so far. [5.25]We first thought it was simply refracting light through its crystalline form, [9.77]but now we're not so sure. [11.96]It appears shrouded by some kind of aura that renders it almost entirely transparent to visible light. [18.69]The creature moves at incredible speed, so catching one for study will be... challenging. [25.55]Obviously, I have left Dr. Stern in charge of the investigation.
Dialogue.C27B88C24FA871C3358F09BECC50B196_F2E10BE: A bit nippy in here, wouldn't you say?
Dialogue.E7931BA24FBD82E9B61E3BB9A4373788_F5807AE: A microscopic entity in its home anteverse, IS-121 is a staggering titan in our own. [7.63]How the Gatekeepers managed to secure not one, but two of these behemoths is quite frankly beyond me. [15.37]I suspect it is best not to ask. [18.33]They are a necessary force ... confronting nightmares and returning with them in chains, [25.82]... 121. An incredible specimen. [29.86]Our research continues.
Dialogue.60CB4AE9488C0F1935370F9F68462B41_09B430A: Abe! This isn't the time for tourism.[2.88]Even if the submarine wasn't a complete wreck,[5.48]you have no idea how to drive it![8.4]Or where to go![9.65]And neither does anyone else who's still alive down here![12.5]Can we just focus on getting out of here, please?!
Dialogue.AC4CB7AB437991F7C38A6E9A7B5A2699_09B430A: Abe, don't even think about it.
Dialogue.129643604178318767081A8813F5F1CE_09B430A: Abe, this submarine isn't going anywhere.
Dialogue.03A132B94701A5A91A599CB82F85671D_09B430A: Abe, you've done incredible things.[2.65]Don't talk that way.[4.33]And I wish I'd known this was going to happen.[6.5]Now I'll never get the chance to tell Thule what I think of him.
Dialogue.1605FCA24159D40F6F6B308C46DD237A_F5807AE: Access for Cascade staff to IS One-Three-Four has been severely limited. [5.66]Management at Voussoir, such as it is, have elected to fortify a mountain and lock the creature deep inside, [13.5]seemingly in order to forget about it. [16.3]This is a shame, given the entity's unique place in human history. [20.9]However, as sightings continue, I admit with some indulgence that it may not be the only one of its species. [27.5]I would love to get one here for direct study.
Dialogue.2AEC103C4C59400BD591A6924B47935C_F5807AE: After our first steps in Flathill, and early on-site experiments beneath the Hydroplant, [6.08]Dr. Newman's "Dark Lens" is quite simply revolutionary. [10.97]If anything, it's too powerful. [13.58]The Lens opens up an infinity of worlds to us. [17.07]That said, the name appals me - [20.33]why we gave critical equipment such a melodramatic name is beyond me. [25.07]Are we scientists, or B-grade villians lurking in some covert lair?
Dialogue.BF5B26A94BFA4D568186EA8E882CBF66_1FF8065: Ah, Station Three, what's going on, over? [5.7]Station Three? Station Two. [10.6]I'm getting a lot of chatter. [12.4]Keystone running some kind of shady op again? [15]I didn't see a bulletin, I'm just trying to finish up some work here. [24]Okay, just let me know if it's any GK'ers coming my way [26.8]they creep me the hell out. Over.
Dialogue.E4854A8348DB76CCE9E5F29242FAE43F_AD7A481: Ah, we converge at the cusp, this boundary of dust ...[8.2]Ask yourself, has the moment arrived ... or will it wait?[14.3]This impasse shields you, now, for dark energy lies below ...
Dialogue.F3B818A149125D4C50E436B6D54A5CF2_1FF8065: Ah, what the hell? This damn radio's acting up. [4.5](turns down radio) There we go. Ugh, all morning. [7.8] All right. Where were we? [10.1]They want you to capture a creature. [12.3]Um... the lady who's supposed to do this, she took all the nets downstairs with her. [17]Hmmm, look around, maybe you can make one out of something.
Dialogue.9FAF205C47B18D8755B7D49C224F00B4_0508B95: Ah, you're from the research division.
Dialogue.0FBAA328443B20E73D6656A80246421E_08113E4: Ah, you’re stuck here too, eh. [2.4]I came down from Level 8 for a coffee. Now I’m locked in here for God knows how long. [10.4]It’ll be those fools on Level 3 overreacting again. (Sighs) [17.54]Looks like Jager’s locked out. Typical. [21.15]See if you can let him in. Maybe he knows what’s happened. [24.7]But take your time. He’s insufferable.
Dialogue.415DE54E45A2052C7CF0528C5C1B4642_7E44BA3: Alert, unsanctioned entities detected. Contact containment staff - immediately.
Dialogue.436936CF4B3CE4D25A8D2DA0652887CD_7E44BA3: Alert. The GATE Rise Laboratory is under security threat. [5.5]Secure your work station and evacuate immediately. [10.2]Leave all belongings and samples, and follow Defense Team instructions.
Dialogue.D9E07F3B4E98B2D198A82B8E073D61A1_7E44BA3: Alert. There has been a - complete - containment failure. [5]Please make your way to Defense Sector by any means available. [10.8]Have an efficient and effective day.
Dialogue.E6DD5159441A6F7FD37E68AAFC9E9545_1E8E4DD: All I can say is, they'll be looking for people like you - so keep your head down, and stay away from windows.
Dialogue.726E614E4A14A4A2DFF82DAFD3ED7F4A_7D797E7: All my data's inside ... I have to get it ...
Dialogue.10E3BF334A0318EE1E54918825623C67_587DB37: All my people need to do is follow the pipes, red, yellow, green - [3.5]they'll find their way to the pumps they need to fix. [6]It's been hours since they left, but they'll be back, I'm sure of it.
Dialogue.A660259741471023C2E3EE90B3EE6FCC_7E44BA3: All vacant perforations will be resetting in 3 ... 2 ... 1 ... Reset complete.
Dialogue.4FE02A5942D708DAB097EBB406A0D8CF_3322B20: Anteverse II ... there is so much more to it than we thought ...
Dialogue.BCA1D5D54E6ED71579F715BFA7DF3906_F2E10BE: Any colder and I'll be homeostatic.
Dialogue.BB3AA1004C38D5B6F4C157A858A7E2D2_F2E10BE: Anyone else getting a bit... hungry?
Dialogue.A0EB0C0A43324D9F012F209675FDA6E5_F609D41: Are you GATE?[1.0]How did you get here?
Dialogue.8D991290491C4E4AECC6668F2E0075B5_9EEEEC2: Are you demented? Answer me—why must this forsaken train keep moving?!
Dialogue.4EF5F3B94FE876EBC58C3E8C632D482B_587DB37: Are you going to stand around staring - or do something useful?
Dialogue.99431C6F4E024B6769027FBA89047441_09B430A: Are you sure about this, Abe?
Dialogue.8714968E4A91A3C775B9B5A631737ADA_EF8738C: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?
Dialogue.212308164AE2C4FBC4AC0E9D6BCEA653_98535A7: Are you thirsty? There's this ... soda.
Dialogue.CA5934A94CC99D28965280AEFEDB0095_F5807AE: As we dispatch our TR teams to further regions of Anteverse 2, [4.57]they return with new specimens, most of them variations of a few basic forms. [10.22]When introduced to the GATE facility, these organisms continue to evolve, rapidly acquiring new behaviours. [16.72]It is my theory that the entropy delta is responsible. [20.95]How far this evolution will extend, remains to be seen.
Dialogue.933D4BA5493C33AEE22FAB83F62FC9A6_1E8E4DD: At first ... I thought it was an accident ... [3.6]Those creatures everywhere ... [6]But then ... then ... these terrorists came, hunting us  ... now I don't know what to believe ... [13]What do they WANT? [14.6]If I can just get to the Blacksmith, he'll know how to get out of here. [18.7]He's wired into this whole sector, and his F.O.R.G.E. is a fortress, so he should be safe ... I think ... [27]I'll open the door for you now, but I'm telling you ... they're shooting at anything that moves! [32.5]Be careful!
Dialogue.F85BE45C455C96E3AC35279E2465BF84_D5875C8: At least nothing in the C-Blocks has escaped ... as far as we know.
Dialogue.187444F049D431FC636B34AAEF53B2DF_0508B95: At least there's a view.[1.82]Just don't stick your head up too far.
Dialogue.98D4C50B4F9B759616DBF4AD8AE55C2A_7E44BA3: Attention. This is a High Priority safety broadcast. [5.1]You are currently en route to Residence Level 7. [10.5]Due to an active security situation, advanced safety precautions are in effect. [16.9]This elevator will be redirected to Offices Level 1. [22.7]Please remain in place and wait for Security Team assistance.
Dialogue.DEBF1FEA42CA3A25BBE8D7A87AB8FE8E_7E44BA3: Attention. This sector is under precautionary security measures. [5]Please remain in place and wait for Security assistance.
Dialogue.E1E4846742705B00BDE4FE8417433EE8_7E44BA3: Be advised, unknown facility access detected. Caution advised.
Dialogue.ACBD08E348503BEDD5EAF8A243FB15F3_AD7A481: Beneath is power, and fire ...[4.2]Beneath is life, and fury,[7.4]and all that flows from wars uncounted ...
Dialogue.A636322C46E447B325878D81DFB298B8_9B469B0: Bit of a kerfuffle down there this morning. [3.4]Probably wanna get a move on.
Dialogue.FDE1704342AB2D666033BDABF8270977_98535A7: But Janet, I want to see the neutrino detector![3.29]We should ... go and take a look. I've never seen IS oh-four-two either!
Dialogue.AD7271D949D889FE137FB19324DA688E_09B430A: But wouldn't you know it, they've revoked our security clearance - [3.5]because who needs it during an emergency? [6.4]I suppose we could head back to office sector, down that way, [10.5]and hope Warren's got a plan to save us, [12.9]but that's about as likely as Thule winning a Nobel Prize. [16.5]We've got to find some other way into the Containment Block, or this is the end of the road.
Dialogue.9E04B20F44986A3F0F516C9A4FFBE164_23ED69A: Coal. That's what I must do. Furnance. Fuel this machine! so it continues ... forever.
Dialogue.0F22F9C947DA5506B60EC2AAED2C7633_AF4702B: Come in? Hello? Talk to me.
Dialogue.E5D972A34179886687AC8AB42963F4AC_EF8738C: Could have been worse, I suppose
Dialogue.B4105B55414C3332EB32A5A70ABF6738_28A5EA9: Could you help me, do you think?
Dialogue.C5934CF0451E5EB5165C079BFF12400F_F5807AE: Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.3]We've had an interesting development. [5.6]Some kind of spore has overgrown the entire entrance of the Vacuum Chamber. [10.5]Given the range of material tested in there, it's impossible to know how it happened and it spreads fast, to a point. [19]But we've found a way to remove the growth. [22.1]One of Lenora's crew brought material back from a fungal region in Anteverse 2, [27.7]a gel of sorts that can be combined with basic reagents to create an exceedingly high temperature reaction. [34.5]It dissolves this particular growth almost instantly. [38.5]Harnessing the entropy delta is all well and good, but retrieving it from the anteverse isn't exactly easy. [45.5]The place makes hell look like Club Med.
Dialogue.011D1AB84FF781C2459029B0EF6197A5_EF8738C: Did anyone ever mention this kind of thing in a safety briefing?
Dialogue.E2EE333542A7932AC37C5783DFE728EB_5D63EF4: Did they know what they were doing?
Dialogue.0406AFFB4244A76F261351A6CBD99711_D73DE1F: Did we meet on the tachyon project?
Dialogue.CFCBD5E8401549BDFD54F3ABBF3FA08D_9B469B0: Did ya see the Ireland game last week? ... [2.24]'Spose you eggheads aren't into footie so much, eh?
Dialogue.40DE34844D4D49392E065895AA4C3696_5D63EF4: Did you come through a portal too?!
Dialogue.7C5AFE0C4F715C5679D64183D31C38E2_F2E10BE: Did you ever imagine something like this might happen?
Dialogue.F250B70C41FAD1867DA2929B2FD52890_7D797E7: Did you get those CPUs from the security robots? I can't get my data till you make that hacker.
Dialogue.7F6ADD4C461226D2135473ADE6183581_84DFBE1: Did you happen to find any coffee?
Dialogue.A2484EF749287400595501A4ADEA7416_4D54ED2: Didn't expect a trip down here take this long... even with those goons roaming about.
Dialogue.9ADF99ED49D8ED3AEC649F964D103E66_98535A7: Do ever get lonely down here, Janet?
Dialogue.57178C3F402B7474B56EF9BEDE72079B_500EBB0: Do not shoot! Do NOT SHOOT! We are together in this perdition!
Dialogue.5102396240D0BA3C75B6CBAFAB1906CB_09195BA: Do you have ANY idea what's going on?! [2.9]Oh, have you only got blue clearance, too? [6.2]I've been hiding here since those goons attacked that poor technician down there. [10.2]Is he even still breathing? I can't bear to look. [14]Something has happened to the perforation system - the portals have gone haywire, [18.6]but that shouldn't be able to happen ...  [20.4]I wish I knew what was happening in Labs right now!
Dialogue.71528AC24CAD24D95AF7CFA54D4C2997_EF8738C: Do you have any idea what all of this actually means?
Dialogue.35308FF046CC261AC93735BC475CAB3F_EF8738C: Do you really think this is the best strategy?
Dialogue.AE4AB7F14F9FCD21ED781EAE38CA4B3E_09B430A: Do you remember the pocket dimension? ... I remember the pocket dimension.
Dialogue.5306518F47A1924931DAB580B9AA2FB9_EF8738C: Do you think anyone else has escaped?
Dialogue.ADD1FB614F9C8AEC4996A28B3388AF2F_7D797E7: Do you think we'll get a Nobel Prize for this?
Dialogue.1D0AAB774B7CE70235F691931168BEE8_AF4702B: Does she really know what she's doing?
Dialogue.C095319644311F639D8013B48B48286D_58FA765: Don't worry about me, I seen worse, I think.
Dialogue.AF70EFF44920130FCFAD07BE86733E52_EF8738C: Don't you wish we could stop and study specimens?
Dialogue.6D505ABB4329B96A9E5A779DB3C43224_F5807AE: Dr Derek Manse reporting, Research Director, GATE Cascade Research Facility. [5.79]Though I struggle to accept the implications, the data gives me no choice. [10.74]The train's momentum is tied inextricably to the atomic attractions of the region it appears to be passing through... indefinitely. [18.81]If it were to stop, the limit of the ensuing chaos is at best uncertain, at worst ... immense. [26.69]I'll be drafting up containment procedures in the morning.
Dialogue.DBAF81CD45A9D48A63EBBFB3C2B525CF_F5807AE: Dr Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.2]We now believe I.S. One-Seven-One, [6.4]or the Carbuncle as Peters was calling it, [9.7]is the larval form of IS One-Seven-Three [13]and, almost certainly, One-Seven-Eight. [15.8]Dr. Pendleton speculates there may also be a fourth state [18.8]we have not yet encountered. [20.6]And I believe she may be correct. [22.8]If this is correct, it is an extraordinary shift in our understanding.
Dialogue.4DA18537487BA004D67FA291946BFC94_F5807AE: Dr Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.6]I.S. Oh-Four-Six seems to sing to itself, if you could call it that, [9.8]emitting a series of resonant tones suggestive of communication. [14.6]The cavities that create these sounds appear to be the same cavities [18.8]the creature uses to ingest anyone who comes within reach ...
Dialogue.B5A154B24A221C67A0C2B5960AFF61E4_F5807AE: Dr Derek Manse reporting, [1.9]Research Director, GATE Cascade Research Facility. [5.7]Originating in Anteverse 2, [8]I.S. One-Seven-One is a stationary, sessile entity, [11.7]that traps its food with a retractable tentacle. [14.8]The experience of being caught is rather like being attacked by an angry pizza. [19.7]It presents no real threat, but leaves an enduring, [22.64]not entirely unpleasant smell on anything it touches. [26.7]Suggestions for possible applications include perfume, [29.7]industrial scents, and olfactory-based crowd control weapons.
Dialogue.1F3527494181477B09260FAF3793F722_F5807AE: Dr Derek Manse, Cascade. [2.45]The first instances of I.S. Oh-Six-Four [5.2]appeared barely seconds after our first successful perforation event. [9.7]It appears to exude a fog or mist that has overtaken Flathill entirely. [15.45]The surviving residents have been evacuated, [17.75]and a cordon established around the town, citing a chemical spill. [22.1]The residents, not to mention our counterparts at the EPA, [25.5]are less than impressed, but the knowledge we already gained, [29.6]even in this short time, is beyond value.
Dialogue.ADF827614907703AACE9B792EC9A8421_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director, GATE Cascade Research Facility. [5.6]Anteverse II is an enigma. A world made of worlds. [11.2]Each of them different, yet seeded with similar life. [15]We know a few certain facts. That energy moves more slowly there, [19.7]making growth, evolution and change a more gradual process. [24]We know, too, that materials transplanted from Anteverse B to our own [28.4]are energy-dense. Biochemistry occurs much more rapidly. [33.4]But how did these creatures evolve? [36.3]The presence of life, complex life, [39.5]confounds everything we know about evolution. [42.6]Was an external force involved? Only further study can tell us.
Dialogue.2CBE519E45E4DD6A32C01F94EA78D5D7_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director, GATE Cascade Research Facility. [5.8]After yesterday's fiasco, I've made a formal request [9.15]to extend general Ordo anomaly storage immediately. [12]We requisitioned Ordo 0113, only to discover that some effect from 0221 had turned it permanently blue. [19.8]I've made it clear to Enderson - this is not acceptable. [24]Ordo subects may be deemed low risk, [26.7]but the range of phenomena is too diverse to jam them together like sardines.
Dialogue.62EFC4654C451E5CBF8D46A0B9AB9C70_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director, GATE Cascade Research Facility. [5.9]I've been asked to provide a report on the recent incident involving IS Oh-One-Seven. [11.3]Our protocols around this subject have been extremely cautious since the ... difficult experience of the trans-recon team that recovered it in 1986. [22.5]We have been candid about its psychiatric affects, and the difficulty of predicting their duration. [28.3]The incident in question concerned a staff member who had recently suffered a difficult break up. [34.0]He wished to remove all memory of his paramour. [37.4]While successful - and informative - Oh-One-Seven wiped considerably more memory than he expected. [44.61]We're banning this kind of haphazard practice going forward.
Dialogue.013F2B2041B9B041F34658AA0D71D28D_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director, Gate Cascade Research Facility. [5.5]Our neutrino detector is finally online. [9.26]It's about time. [11.39]The calibration is complete and we're seeing the first, faint suggestions of activity. [16.44]Placing the detector in the depths of the Hydroplant reservoir was a challenge, [20.42]but the ideal location for such a device. [23.54]It should keep the photon detectors safe, too. [27]We've noticed something else - the neutrino detector attracts perforation targets itself, [33.6]possibly due to its shielding. [36]At any rate, it's frustrating. [38]Every time a portal appears in the reservoir tower, we have to recalibrate the entire apparatus.
Dialogue.A42A65454E85B91AF47CAA86432476E8_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.2]Dr. Sukov came to me today and announced she was terminating her investigations into Oh-One-Four. [9.45]The principal obstacle appears to be the object itself. [13.52]Our tools cease to function, or they operate at an impossibly glacial pace, when brought near it. [20.55]Precisely what it is composed of, whether hollow or solid, [23.2]even these simple questions are almost impossible to answer. [29.19]Oh-One-Four is, to all intents and purposes, impervious.
Dialogue.8947B0104C5898E332DF3A9409DC537C_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.45]We discover new data about Anteverse 2 daily. [7.43]The most recent revelation: its ancience. [11.75]This world has existed for far longer than our own, due to its unique conditions of creation. [18.10]But there are forces at play here we barely understand. [21.97]This remains abject speculation, but there are hints of a constructive power at work ... [27.87]I will say no more until we have the data to support this.
Dialogue.44481CE84D4E8F79214647899A909F8B_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.54]This morning Enderson made a remark about IS One-Oh-Three, which has lodged in my mind. [10.5]The IS in question is a cardboard box, notable for moving to a new location when not observed, [17.1]without seeming to pass through intervening space. [20.6]Enderson noted that this embodies quantum behaviour so perfectly, it could serve as an educational aid. [28.2]He was joking, of course, but this is as close to an explanation as we have. [33.6]Could it be this box was created as a literal object lesson?
Dialogue.AD03158348CBB40552CEE9BD4E13CC95_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.6]Recent attempts to coax IS Oh-Four-Two into a new home have been unsuccessful. [9.94]We believe the creature - if indeed that word is appropriate - prefers mannerist art, [16.38]and so provided several potential new pieces for it to inhabit, but to no avail. [22.35]Dr. Tang wishes to determine whether the entity is trapped in its current environment, inactive, [28.05]or simply wishes to remain where it is, but his suggestions risk destroying the work in question. [35.23]I have told him to adjust his methods. [38.37]Antique artworks aside, I've always been a bit of a dog person. [42.93]I have no desire to risk harming Oh-Four-Two.
Dialogue.5BAD678F49B2E580D6477FA806CBB81E_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting, Research Director. [3.73]We've discovered that direct observation from the targeted subject arrests 091's movement. [9.43]It then dematerializes. [11.5]Where it goes, we're uncertain, but it returns 3 or 4 hours later, seeking out the original subject. [18.58]We've dosed Dr. Stern with a CNS to keep him awake, [22.0]but he has to sleep at some point ... and then ... well ... we're not entirely sure.
Dialogue.2183A0654DDFC4BC098D8AB55E57FCF6_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.08]I can summarize IS One-Six-Nine in a single word: [6.5]... nothing. [8.03]Recovered from a nameless hill in Exmoor, England, we have no further information. [13.67]We cannot seem to sample, mark or damage it in any way. [17.82]Incredibly, it appears to be without mass, moving as easily as a mote of dust, with no apparent space time presence of any kind. [27.53]Of the larger object we presume it was once attached to, there is no trace. [32.56]Of its existence, we have only the evidence of our eyes, nothing more, and no theory to attach to it.
Dialogue.3B6D3FFA48EEC0A822CB43AED33792CD_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.0]Although it remains essentially hostile, [4.6]these "Peccary" can be taught to respond to basic commands, [8.0]as Dr Manbanko has demonstrated so performatively. [11.6]As its bio systems work much more swiftly here, it learns extremely rapidly. [17.8]Many on the Executive Committee will want a weapon, I'm sure - [21.5]their imagination reaches no further - [24.8]but if we can just breed the aggression out, [27.5]the Peccary would make an extraordinary workbeast. [31.0]Our world has enough toys of war.
Dialogue.D9606BBC4DF87737EBAE1DAFD29FFA54_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.12]IS-0059 is still far from being understood. [6.18]It appears impervious to all equipment and weapons employed against it thus far, [11.46]and Gatekeeper attempts to capture it have come to nothing. [15.52]Possibly, it betrays a slight sensitivity to light, but how it moves, [20.45]or even whether its garb is flesh or some sort of ... clothing, we have no idea. [26.92]I am reluctant to speculate until we learn more, [29.68]and I'm putting in a transfer request to Keystone for Gatekeeper staff to replace those lost.
Dialogue.A3D3B2064ED60E437CF958A864C48480_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.14]I cannot say whether the reservoir is one of our great successes, or an abject failure. [8.23]When we brought back 0142 from Anteverse 13, we knew it was some kind of living machine. [14.16]A biological engine. [16.16]It was Wakeman who dropped a fragment into the reservoir, accidentally, he claimed. [21.66]The development of the organism since then has been nothing less than extraordinary.[26.09]The logic by which this organism builds itself is almost impossible to discern.[31.85]An interweaving of facets forming what Simmons called 'a citadel'.[37.03]We have reason to believe it performs some kind of processing function,[41.3]but I would be the first to admit, it's operation is currently beyond our understanding.
Dialogue.7589095E4385CA742C38F3A636AC4457_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.28]I.S. Oh-Four-Six - or the Composer, a piece of reluctant poetry from yours truly - [9.60]displays a high degree of synchronised behaviour. [12.29]Dr Pendleton speculates they are interconnected in some fashion. [16.82]A hivemind, perhaps? [19.31]Interestingly, these syncronized behaviours vanish when the large protrusions are ... [24.22]separated from what you would call its shoulders. [27.42]We also cannot rule out the mist as some kind of transference medium.
Dialogue.C5D927224FB624347370BD879968724B_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.46]The staff persist in referring to the IS One-Two-One duo as 'Tarasque' and 'Behemoth'. [9.45]Pet names seem harmless. [11.5]And morale is important, but we must not forget how destructive these specimens can be. [17.45]Observations confirm that they are constantly trying to unite with one another in captivity. [23]It is my hypothesis that this would be ... calamitous. [27.5]Keep them separated, period.
Dialogue.3AD3EE36423573BCEBE9158740FA66D7_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse reporting. [2.5]There is a category of immurement subjects that pile mystery upon mystery, as if their purpose was only to confound us. [11.27]When I look at IS One-Six-Six, I am tempted to suspect the work of a cosmic jester, [16.77]whose sole aim is to sabotage any chance we have of forming a consistent picture of the universe. [22.85]Why does this object weigh three times as much when turned upside down? [28.05]How did it come to be built into the Berlin wall? [31.68]Why does Dr. Tengku insist on sketching it over, and over, and over again? [38.3]Of finding answers to these questions, I have vanishingly little hope.
Dialogue.1FD68798489032FC9764C6A22A0D401B_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse, Cascade. [2.44]As we explore the functionality of temporal portals, we've begun to feel out some of their behaviours. [8.73]It can be frustrating, like using bulldozers to make origami, but I believe Dr. Janek is making progress. [16.53]Some of the temporal perforational behaviour, however, remains an obdurate mystery. [21.4]For instance, why do they persist in localizing in the Residence Sector Gardens?
Dialogue.5C6048E24D43B0BF84F110953070F371_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse, Cascade. [2.79]How or why Anteverse 19 came to exist, we may never know. [8.28]Clearly it is connected to the Red Chair, which we believe was created by Alestair Crowley - yes, THE ... [16.44]but we are sure he did not incept Anteverse 19. [20.64]Like so many things, he was merely a conduit ... and suffice to say, it was to no decent end.
Dialogue.30DF21474661CAA99C459A88621FC363_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse, Cascade. [2.87]If she is correct, Dr Newman's proposed "Dark Lens" should greatly enhance the range and efficiency of our perforation events. [11.14]She has discovered a way to harness the bosonic properties of certain Anteverse materials [16.81]to create a targeting system for our perforation events. [20.68]I must admit, she's excelled herself.
Dialogue.CFC838514577D2EB475EFAA962D0CACB_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse, Cascade. [3]Report on the escape of IS-012. [6.43]It seems 012 talked one of the new security staff into letting it out of high containment. [12.1]Exactly how it did this is unclear, but we found it - the creature - eating in the breakroom an hour later. [21.17]What point it was trying to make is equally uncertain. [24.63]But this cannot be allowed to happen again.
Dialogue.02D5BA014216BBE90894A494701DC1BA_F5807AE: Dr. Derek Manse, reporting. [1.81]I have spent more time with I.S. Oh-One-Two recently, but I've yet to fully fathom this creature. [8.55]It insists it is a known and former member of our staff, [12.85]even though I attended that man's funeral more than two years ago! [17.1]So far, this entity has done nothing to threaten or jeopardize the facility, [22.07]I even find it a bit charming, and... perhaps it is harmless. [27.02]But if I must choose, I'd rather be cruel, than wrong. [31.65]Its containment remains indefinite.
Dialogue.1558305E44182CC79C06C8A30DEF2F36_F5807AE: Dr. Janek has taken another incredible leap forward. [3.69]I confess, some of the mathematics elude me, [6.37]but the fact remains, he appears to have instantiated a temporarily stable perforation, not just in space, but in time. [15.41]There is no ethics committee that could advise us here. [18.7]We are off the map.
Dialogue.BC8F3682483DD62D715BD39D55B72D7A_F5807AE: Dr. Manse reporting. [1.7]IS One-Seven-Eight, the Peccary [4.7]as it was so ineptly-dubbed by one of my puerile co-workers, [8.9]is more intelligent than it first seemed. [11.8]In fact, it grows smarter and more capable over the course of its life cycle, [16.5]before morphing into the later lifecycle phase. [19.8]Dr Manbanko even managed to teach it a few simple tricks, [23.7]with only minor burns, I believe.
Dialogue.12BE0080481C4FD42BEFC18A40690C30_F5807AE: Dr. Manse reporting. [1.7]On the advice of Keystone, GATE has established a facility here in Flathill. [7]We judge it unwise to advertise our activities, [10.17]so for the time being, our presence is, ah, necessarily clandestine... [15.8]If not a bit syrupy. [18.17]The location was selected for the convergence of certain geomagnetic forces, [22.3]that amplify the power of our perforation equipment. [25.7]We stand poised on the brink of an entirely new technology, [29.7]I am convinced of it.
Dialogue.3670860242A08B37696C8E89858C8327_F5807AE: Dr. Manse reporting. [2.0]I am lodging a record of note about Badwell's latest security request. [7.15]How can she expect us to pursue our work if we're censoring ourselves in fear of external monitoring? [13.25]Surely that is her team's concern. [16.0]If there is some risk that outsiders are intruding on our communications, [20.19]the fault is in the GATE defense team, not the work of its researchers.
Dialogue.0487B38B428B8CF6324D2C8F27B222E1_F5807AE: Dr. Manse reporting. [2.32]The tendency of portals to reset to their original point in time continues to challenge understanding. [9.24]Dr. Ross suggested that the expansion of the scalar field is not infinite, [13.6]rather bounded by the null-space in which each of these anteverses resides. [18.92]It's a little simplistic, but... she may have something there.
Dialogue.B2C5FFEC42D0BF8ADB3074BBB553ED7A_F5807AE: Dr. Manse, Cascade Facility. [2.16]When people ask where we found IS Oh-one-seven-two, I tell them the truth. [7.81]It was recovered from a kebab restaurant in rural Turkey, where it was being used as a doorstop. [14.05]The fact that it is, by a factor of tens, the oldest known manufactured object on Earth, [20.58]forged from alloys not to be invented for another 1.7 million years, was irrelevant [27]to the owner, who accepted, in exchange, 50 lira and a small rock. [32.95]We are no closer to identifying its creators.
Dialogue.BE39DAF4466295AAF60A5EB5C73854A0_F5807AE: Dr. Manse, Cascade Facility. [2.36]Immured Subject One-Eight-Four - these X-ers, or "the Exor", as Lenora - [9.13]ah, Dr Riggs - insists on calling it - [13.09]is a highly aggressive, bipedal... uh, humanoid originating - we believe - in Anteverse II. [22.15]We've now tracked One-Eight-Four through the four known stages in its life cycle, [26.19]and intriguingly, several divergent adult forms. [30.27]How or why it attains these forms, we are yet to determine.
Dialogue.975A21FA4F576FEDBF66F59C8D7E0BCC_F5807AE: Dr. Manse, Cascade Facility. [2.46]The tub ... of blood ... [4.82]Dramatic, I know, but this entity gives me -- in scientific terms -- [11.15]the heeby jeebies, and it's uniquely dangerous. [15.22]We've locked it in a cell and that seems to work well enough. [18.79]It doesn't liquify or slip through drains, as Tang feared. [22.67]It's solid enough, and prefers to stay near its point of origin. [26.48]We send cleaners through every morning to spray down the walls. [30.29]IS-0013 tends to touch everything in sight when it crawls out of its metallic cocoon. [36.34]We found the tub - more of a metal trough - in[40]REDACTED after reports of a blood-covered night time boogeyman. [45]The Gatekeepers performed a snatch-and-grab mission while it hibernated, though they claim it woke twice on the flight here. [52.3]I've reviewed the footage, it's messy. [55.5]I'm not sure we can ascertain its goal, or where it goes when the tub refills. [60.8]We've run tests on the blood to dismal results - zero genetic matches. [66]But we'll keep giving it a stir... uh, figuratively speaking.
Dialogue.47E384F5444B303199DDA3BC2C32810B_F5807AE: Dr. Manse, Cascade Facility. [2.73]091 is contained at last. [6.1]As long as we project a strong X-Ray beam, and it remains steady, it seems to be no risk to anyone. [12.75]Dr. Stern can sleep easy, but we do fear it may "switch" to another individual before long. [18.93]The team have started refering to it as 'the Leyak', its local name - [24.55]even Enderson, it seems.[27.05]I suppose Cascade is its home now.
Dialogue.0CEF6CAA4523170FBE8BB1A298551827_F5807AE: Dr. Manse, Cascade Facility. [2:18]Reporting on IS One-Three-Eight. [4.43]A unique entity, One-Three-Eight has the distinction of being both an immurement subject and an entire anteverse in one. [12.46]I cannot emphasize how important it is that we invest any required resources in ensuring the train does not stop. [21.05]We have compelling data to suggest that a cessation of the train's forward motion [25.1]would have apocalyptic ramifications. I will explain more shortly.
Dialogue.6207C4204BF79AA8F2A845BC12DF79E0_F5807AE: Dr. Pendleton and I had a frank exchange of views today. [4.47]I described I.S. Oh-Five-Five as a noxious weed, and suggested that recent events in the Reactors have borne this out. [12.02]But she insisted that Anteverse flowers had a beauty to them. [16.52]I was not in the mood for a lesson in aesthetics, and pointed out that so does a mushroom cloud.
Dialogue.41B598414F3AD2862E3081875CA65F98_F5807AE: Dr. Pendleton questioned the Exor's similarity to humanity's own morphology, and I referred to her to crabs. [7.25]Their form has evolved independently on Earth on at least five separate occasions. [12.33]It would seem that evolution resolves certain environmental challenges in a remarkably consistent fashion ... [19.22]There is, of course, another explanation for the Exor's apparent similarity to ourselves, [23.53]but without the necessary data, I refuse to indulge Pendleton's penchant for unnecessary speculation. [31.22]And besides, they look closer to birds, if you ask me.
Dialogue.5FFA966D463AF44659416A92C75909F1_F5807AE: Dr. Rigg's first TransRecon foray into the new Anteverse has delivered more questions than answers. [7.2]I'm still working through her report. [9.74]It's unfortunate that video recording doesn't work over there, [13.19]but she claims to have found an Exor settlement - she specifically called it a 'village' - [19.10]with some kind of monument at its center. [21.65]I've spoken to her about my theories, and it seems this edifice may hold the confirmation we seek.
Dialogue.4F8B5C6342CD8B9E544A4CA86DDA734F_F5807AE: Dr. Tengku appears to have made a breakthrough, but we've had false starts before. [5.22]But this time, her results seem reproduceable. [8.89]I almost can't believe it. [10.94]Tengku has discovered a new kind of bosonic matter, a sort of negative photon. [16.43]And in so doing unlocked an entirely new mathematics. [20.81]Exactly what this means for research here at Cascade is unclear. [24.55]We are charting new territory, and making new discoveries almost daily. [29.6]I feel we have passed through the looking glass.
Dialogue.58B2AF9A4EA7610AD88F6A959639CAFD_78497A6: Euh..tu vas pas passer par le portail là?
Dialogue.B39526EB4BAEA35216DEC98F3A99C8B2_F2E10BE: Excuse me, I have to go right away.
Dialogue.24A2E5334F39B9D1032A1F869C35AA5B_9EEEEC2: Explain yourself! Why must vehicle persist in its motion?! ?Tell me this instant!
Dialogue.F61ACC44441145B97F87AFA461B72299_F2E10BE: F-Food. I need to find food.
Dialogue.D8BE3DA84D6F3D52F1C64CB7252BE215_18C7EC2: Facility's lookin' pretty rough - and you're hangin' around like a bad smell. [5]I'd be looking at pushing through to manufacturing if I were you. [9]But I'm not. So ... that's on you.
Dialogue.F417A9334AA55F0ABEEAACBD2657ED86_D73DE1F: Fixing the power system can't be all that difficult, it's not quantum physics.
Dialogue.6F46E1BB4A5795741BFEAD9D26E6C6D0_F5807AE: Following a malfunction of the Dark Lens, [2.67]one of our TR teams was transported unexpectedly from Anteverse 16 to 23. [8.10]Unfortunately, that location has been contaminated by A16's native symbiote. [13.15]How such a temporal disjunction occured, I am determined to discover. [17.39]Dr. Janek has questions to answer. [20.3]As to the long term results of this cross-contamination, I shudder to think.
Dialogue.708AEF494DF79E6525E8EBB81429EFBA_58FA765: Frake wants to blow a hole in the floor? [3.2]She's too smart for her own good sometimes, but what choice we got? [8.8]I can trade you parts to fix the pumps, sure. [12.8]But there's a couple things I need first - price'a doin business - cause Frake ain't the only one with plans. [20.7]I'll buzz the list to ya. [22.5]One more thing - you're gonna have to unlock the tram station, too. [28.2]One'a Frake's people, said there's a gateway in there. [31.4]If that portal leads where I think it does, some'a what's on that list is on the other side. [37.7]I'll give you specs for a Tram Key, should open the station right up.
Dialogue.D50D3DDE469F3200AF3C0EAC5502F24A_AF4702B: Frake wants to overload the synchroton? [2.5]And it's not gonna take half this facility with it?
Dialogue.8EE5AE8346DAC4F93EBC07983B000FA8_D5875C8: Gah, gymnasiums. I hate them. Sweaty shrines to insecurity.
Dialogue.6F27ED0E4DFEE2C9C506889BDEEB4916_EF8738C: Getting a little cold, isn't it.
Dialogue.DBC484BD4F6E93E32801D8B539A33B81_4D54ED2: Getting a little crowded down here.
Dialogue.27AE2657463288B2FCC4A6A99220BA66_7E44BA3: Good evening. Today's power and primary illumination in this sector will be ceasing shortly. [6.8]Have a safe and successful evening.
Dialogue.45FF6EC04198A6036EC75B991300BA5B_AF4702B: Good luck finding what you need - I'll try and keep these guys busy.
Dialogue.5A8FB517483C8A9085658AAB772DAD9C_18C7EC2: Gotta admit, I figured an underground facility'd be a bit more safe than this.
Dialogue.7A8C728E40670BDB45AF25981F11D98E_18C7EC2: Ha, you got through into Manufacturing. [3]Guess you ran into some issues, or you wouldn't be back here. [7.5]Or you just looking for the 'suggestion box'?
Dialogue.DFB93D4F4545AD7973B3178EAF3B6021_EF8738C: Have you ever actually met Annette Garrick?
Dialogue.469E99F24D4C75E35BFBB795232A4512_F2E10BE: Have you ever seen anything like this?
Dialogue.8F3A47F040421C3A566D44A5E63A55DC_F2E10BE: Have you ever seen anything like this?
Dialogue.49421D7E4FF65B474E1E5A99D724F527_0630D2E: Have you heard it ... speak?[2.5]What on earth is it saying?
Dialogue.FA448C6D4D791732511B90B5003A855D_4D54ED2: Have you met the Blacksmith yet? [2.0]He's a strange one, but his fabrication work is excellent. [6.0]Seems he can make just about anything.
Dialogue.8F50738B48C98217946B08B278BDEFC3_1E8E4DD: Have you seen Frake? I don't know if she made it out or not ...
Dialogue.5553EEDE45E2E747DE804F8A658D9BE1_98535A7: Have you seen that strange material growing on the vacuum chamber? [1.0]They've totally let this sector go.
Dialogue.3AC0E7C84780DE30FC3D14A7CA878A35_09CA50D: He, how's that first day going?
Dialogue.F13F9A6749B900785A3BBB8DEB4DD639_96C2A83: Head down to the elevator, yeah? Okay.
Dialogue.438CF8BB4B5642930DCC2EAC236A9570_58FA765: Heard the explosion from here. Place shook like a snowglobe. [5.3]But what are you doin' back? Need somethin?
Dialogue.CBC83F1445AE0F9A51E3FE83E2BBDAB5_A783C72: Hey it's not safe out here! The place is totally overrun. [5]We got sent down to hold the line, but they pushed us back - there's goddamn snipers everywhere! [11]They got everyone. We need someone who knows the sector, but we're totally pinned down. [17]I think there's survivors in the Electrical Station - maybe they had some kind of plan, but what am I supposed to do? [24]We weren't prepared for this, no-one was.
Dialogue.8E0BD41342D77B291A312B8134C68FA1_1FF8065: Hey, new transfer. [2.1]Uh, I got pulled in from Surface Duty. [4.5]The usual lady, she got called out to help downstairs. [8.2]Happens. Chaos is kind of our thing around here. [11.8]You seem a bit antsy - just wait, I'll unlock the gate in a second. [16.3]I've never run someone through this, but it looks pretty straightforward. [20.3]Coming from Springer Facility, you'll know the basics. [23.3]But since we deal with specimens directly [26.2]everyone on staff has to know basic ECP. [28.5]That's Emergency Containment Procedures.
Dialogue.A1251348499A5C5687C9E4B4A388E665_1FF8065: Hey, nice work plugging in that plug. [3.2]We're done here. [4]There's some stuff on this list, [4.9]but I don't reckon you're going to need it. [6.7]That's why you've got people like me around. [8.4]Keep you safe. [10]Looks like I got to check on some situation top side. [13]So, yeah, head to the elevator and it'll take you down to residences, real cozy stuff. [18]Clipboard says you'll be looking for a doctor Can or, or Cahn. [21.7]Sounds familiar. [24.1]I guess he's in charge of the rest of your orientation. [26.9]Alright, onward to science. [30.4]Well, for one of us, anyway.
Dialogue.2992348F4DD2AD8B80DE60A786956967_58FA765: Hey, one'a Frake's folk came through. [3.4]Got some new stuff for ya ... if you got what I need.
Dialogue.58EC4F1A42280069EE4D35B8863DE3F1_52045D4: Hey, take a look around, it's a free facility ... kinda, but you got better places to be, right?
Dialogue.02D189604AE9F501DB79BC8626BD1D2B_6AA6D76: Hide somewhere. But not here, alright? [3.5]Close the door!
Dialogue.26B24D7B46FD33BDF25D7DB6D75DAD3F_6B614EA: History will judge us, or else erase us.
Dialogue.77E7E7B44C64128A114368BB9697E2BF_F2E10BE: Hmm, yes that will do nicely.
Dialogue.6E2E1DC64F24BD6A0975229A6027AD8F_F2E10BE: Hmm. My circadian cycle is failing.
Dialogue.378602DE400B474334483B8AF7949346_84DFBE1: Hmmm. Manse mentioned something about that ... material on the vacuum chamber, [7.4]I'm sure of it, in one of his precious logs. [12.0]But I'll be damned if I can remember what he said.
Dialogue.FB0291404645B299A00464A0D5D5988F_98535A7: Honestly, looking around at all of this,[3.45]I'm asking myself whether it's been worth it.
Dialogue.5026C6204BA8AEC242317F96F292530E_EF8738C: How on Earth are we ever going to find a way out of here.
Dialogue.A421E9154A818FC6879E83BC8729718D_5D63EF4: How you got through in one piece, I can't imagine.[3.33]I came through a portal from Labs and it spat me out here -[7.51]I should have known better, but what was I supposed to do,[9.95]just wait for them to find me?!
Dialogue.79CB8C244FC35612EDE0FEACBD66F522_4AE005C: How'd you get past the snipers?
Dialogue.21E393594B0EED08ADA9E2813F218215_4AE005C: How's that power system looking?[2.36]You reset it yet?
Dialogue.9C35945244158454349F9E82520B7F0E_09B430A: I advised, Abe.  What are you trying to say?
Dialogue.AB8E44734EB57B780BC168A91DE1ABE6_EF8738C: I am distinctly under the weather.
Dialogue.105949A042EEBBFA3308E68D59F13F0A_F2E10BE: I am just about boiling up.
Dialogue.557A7260453898F285B28D8601057DCF_AF4702B: I been listening to their transmissions. [2]Military? Government? Mercs? Who the hell are they? [6.2]Can't understand half of what they're sayin'.
Dialogue.46712048471D993408595E8136B2F7B3_58FA765: I been working here eleven years, ain't seen nothing like this.
Dialogue.67F704E84AAD775F1C81809F8770328B_F2E10BE: I believe I need to uh, defecate.
Dialogue.802CC4D64FFFEE01532178AF232474AB_F2E10BE: I can barely keep my eyes open.
Dialogue.339EC3D542161345B4CE9F866BCA68A9_F2E10BE: I can feel my blood sugar falling.
Dialogue.46A644634FAE19336737309CFBB08548_EF8738C: I can feel my proteins de-naturing.
Dialogue.B605F1AC4F97C10AF63E018EB6453FE4_28A5EA9: I can get us through the Vacuum Chamber, I sure of it. [3.5]But you need to find a way to the Control Center and reset the security system.
Dialogue.8DE5786B4E57B55B5250258B56D7CF0D_28A5EA9: I can get us to the Surface Elevator, if we can just get the Vacuum Chamber open. [5.5]I'm certain of it. [7.5]But someone needs to retrieve that goo from the Mycofields. [11.8]Now, I'm not necessarily saying that's 'you', but you do seem rather well suited to this kind of thing.
Dialogue.D6896946493747F93465B2B73E8E44B0_5D63EF4: I can't believe we're actually going to do this!
Dialogue.4AFE20414124867B90A932B08E554FD6_F2E10BE: I can't contain this much longer.
Dialogue.7D07EEC9482C894291C3D88C1B088F5B_EF8738C: I can't go on ... without water
Dialogue.FA9CEC7A4FEB81D2AD03A5890B0F25BC_09B430A: I can't just conjure portals out of thin air, Abe.[3.1]It's not magic.
Dialogue.5ED69BEC478075CB1E7601B28B4BDB2E_EF8738C: I can't think about that right now.
Dialogue.183ACDC945F2CBA78644CBA646F8241B_D73DE1F: I can't work under these conditions.
Dialogue.861BB4E14170D93102CBFC81F284A79C_F2E10BE: I can't... go on... too... cold.
Dialogue.2749AB884D2187FEEB77B7ABD20AA5BC_EF8738C: I could do with more, but ... (hmmm)
Dialogue.6E91591E47633EFC6479B6AEA088419D_7D797E7: I couldn't live with myself if I had to abandon my data. [4.6]I mean, what would the point of any of this be?
Dialogue.8DEB2D244C789500EC16E894B1BD4DC7_EF8738C: I don't feel good at all.
Dialogue.7C845C514B843A09BB9041ABC6245757_587DB37: I don't know how you made it this far, those savages have blocked every exit - [3.5]they even collapsed the surface tunnel! [5.7]But remember what happened in '85, when the kinetics team overloaded the synchrotron!? [10.0]They triggered a singularity that carved a hole clean through to the next Sector!  [15.2]We could do it again right now ... if these damn quakes hadn't broken the electron pumps. [19.9]So I sent my team to the Blacksmith [22.12]he can make parts to fix the pumps - [24.3]we'll make our own exit! [26.3] All my people need to do is follow the pipes, red, yellow, green - [29.4]they'll find their way to the pumps they need to fix. [31.8]It's been hours since they left, but they'll be back, I'm sure of it.
Dialogue.2FBDA73F4BC207159384DEA37FA014A8_98DBDC4: I don't know if Stewart's coming back.[3.6]Please.[5.31]Finish the neural bridge?[8.2]It's what he would have done, I'm sure of it.
Dialogue.C29D857C4A79D918A22448B0B52B5BDC_09195BA: I don't know what happened. [2]They’re saying evacuate, but have you seen what's prowling around out there? [6.7]Clearly some escapees from the Wildlife Pens.[9.9] Things must be really bad if we can't even keep basic containment protocols in check
Dialogue.25ED483240932013297AB3AF2CFA977C_5D63EF4: I don't know what you're going to find there, but it has to be better than this ... doesn't it?
Dialogue.5274FDF34BFDB8F2935546A13654BE59_0508B95: I don't know what you're planning, but if you've got half a brain you'll get as far away from here as you can.[6]The portal system's gone totally haywire. [9.2]I've seen data like this before, when a portal opened in the neutrino detector. [14.5]I swear it's happened again. [16.7]It could lead anywhere, but anywhere's better than this right now. [21.8]Only problem is, it's entirely underwater. [26]I'd come with you if I could, but there's just no way. [30.5]How are you at holding your breath?
Dialogue.281B109943E8736B5AAF6CA6835BADEC_58FA765: I don't know whatcha planning, but it better be something smart.
Dialogue.62A4FDCB40B405FF4A8C07930317419E_B19337C: I don't know who they were ...
Dialogue.A98C76344D3F08C9CD8BC58502AD96EA_EF8738C: I don't think I can hold on much longer.
Dialogue.6ECD3738489A6B286AAD38A69976AD28_98535A7: I don't want to get anyone's hopes up, so let's just say - [5.0]there's certain ... substances in the Containment Block that could be very helpful right now.
Dialogue.0A13DD914C08AE3ADD7A8BA70DD8136F_7D797E7: I don’t understand it! The system’s locked us out. [4]But I’m not leaving without my data. I could lose everything! [9.2]I'd never get a Nobel Prize! Then I had an idea. [13.4]I worked on the security bots. [15.5]Their CPUs store access codes. [18.6]If we salvaged some, we could make something to hack the door. [22.3]What do you think?
Dialogue.F579F7144A9C8E240ED494BA96FF7344_18C7EC2: I got a gun ... just sayin'.
Dialogue.2767D3FD4BD8DFD3D05F9896491D7F7A_58FA765: I got a lot of fabrication gear back here. [3.1]You need somethin', I can make it, if you got somethin' to trade - [7.3]gettin' a little low on some necessities back here.
Dialogue.91981D4C490E65F5DE38749A2964DF3B_AF4702B: I got drinks up here, snacks, and ALL the TIME in the WORLD!
Dialogue.6D1B110445B843B425075A8328845605_F5807AE: I have had to secure IS Five-Two personally, following the latest abuse of containment procedures by staff in C-Blocks. [8.35]I understand fully well the attraction of jumping three times higher than normal, or floating gently down from the third story of the megalift, [17.15]but the gravity cube is NOT a toy. [20.48]While I admit to a light skip as I carried it to its containment cell, it is a profound and unique disturbance in the space time fabric of our universe. [30.86]It's also quite glowy.
Dialogue.6773898F43CFA5BD52B684A453FC6379_F5807AE: I have immense respect for Dr. Wakeman's achievements, [3.6]but I'm concerned at the limits - or lack thereof - on his robotics research. [9.67]As far as I can discern, Wakeman has been given carte blanche to pursue a machine consciousness program. [15.6]He is a poor communicator at the best of times, but if I understand his recent ... mutterings, [22.7]he has incoporated elements of IS-Oh-One-Four-Two into his new "Waterbot". [28.8]How he did this, and whether its conversational ability is a charming trick, or something more ... enduring, [36.76]well, I'm not convinced even Dr. Wakeman knows.
Dialogue.6DF0EFCD43421177CA9993A8FE821ABA_EF8738C: I have no idea what you're talking about.
Dialogue.6DA5F67949C326894B0461A7920C4C92_587DB37: I have to admit, you surprised me. [2.85]I had to come and see this for myself. [5]You gonna do the honors?
Dialogue.A22CB6E84EB7B53EB357669382802772_09B430A: I haven't been there for a while, but it can't be as bad as what happened in Reactors. [4.9]That took months to clean up.
Dialogue.FBD3E6A94848556ECCFE82B1ADDCC6E5_98535A7: I hear those gun-toting apes stole the dark lens, and caused this whole kerfuffle. [7.3]Didn't you work on that project, Janet?
Dialogue.DA36615146F73CE2A9CB988DF7F7F5AC_6AA6D76: I heard their radios, something about Level 3. [3]I’d stay away if I were you.
Dialogue.0CC0E95C4C885E0C08BED9A5CFFCAE7D_AF4702B: I heard those crazy assholes blew the tunnel up. [3.0]Real smart thinking! [4.8]Sounds like Frake's got an even crazier plan. [8.0]Don't tell me you're gonna help her? [10.3]Haha - I knew today was gonna be a wild one!
Dialogue.05627E1447D8EE2A3A27D9BE2A599088_5952414: I knew this would happen. [2.25]Ever since Verenkov's team took over Silo 3. [5]You couldn’t get a single power cell after that. Now look. [9]Their precious 'anteverses'. Totally out of control.
Dialogue.DF376C274BC7C24E926B178AC951E1A6_28A5EA9: I know I'm asking a lot, but working together is our best chance. [5.0]It's our only chance, don't you agree?
Dialogue.CD7A05824E91A382FF853FB315126BEE_09CA50D: I know it sounds crazy, but if Frake says it'll work ... well ... I trust her. [5.6]Just ... stand back when it all goes up, yeah?
Dialogue.860A05A34F88CE14B5E0B8B5BF1A7858_08113E4: I left them alone for thirty minutes, and this happens.
Dialogue.0A51DC094E6DECD386063C8525917AC9_5FC0510: I locked it in there ... along with everyone else.
Dialogue.B2CE76C047A389BC259417AD04AA2687_A783C72: I lost my whole team - you think I'm going back in there, you better think again. [5.3]You need a goddamn army.
Dialogue.9EB89BD24E90F397A23AAB89D9A9C8B1_F2E10BE: I may soon need the facilities.
Dialogue.9AE972DA4A2092BD1458759E5FB60F1F_F2E10BE: I must say, I am feeling a bit under the weather.
Dialogue.E66D55164AABF49D1661A688D10D4A47_F2E10BE: I perceive a distinct lack of snacks.
Dialogue.CB04684E417826851AB45CB7ACF1D9DE_28A5EA9: I really am in your debt.[2.0]I'm not just saying that.
Dialogue.0589B13F4C127DDDC5555EB215128339_EF8738C: I really don't know what to say.
Dialogue.845D0F5D41C378AF2A380583A5516C0B_08CBFFC: I remain, as a witness, and gatherer.
Dialogue.D56F1BF040A69D8311930682A665EB4C_0630D2E: I saw a transrecon report once.[2.35]It mentioned something looking like ... that ...[6.69] like ... well, I don't have to tell you, do I?[10.58]But I've seen every specimen TR brings back.[13.37]There's nothing like this in Containment ...[15.57]It isn't one of OURS, so how did it get here?
Dialogue.72333268469C1069F141AAB96704AEE1_28A5EA9: I see why they call it the Control Center.
Dialogue.851AB1204312A8BFA7FB55891A8CE8B4_58FA765: I seen some crazy stuff down here. Workin' with Frake's been a trip. [5.7]First time we been invaded, though. [8.4]If I were you, I'd head for the surface tunnel. Get your ass outta here.
Dialogue.2663204C42EFEC946182E385C21E033E_A783C72:
I seen some crazy stuff here, I mean, we all have, [4.5]but no-one said
anything about a goddamn invasion.
Dialogue.0CFBAB5D4E241435E74D35A05E0919B1_F2E10BE: I should probably locate a restroom...
Dialogue.EACF69924E69F47102F3A6BEF26F7251_7D797E7: I still don't understand - the system shouldn't have locked us out. [4.6]That's not how I designed it.
Dialogue.65FF2A564B04F2ED7AAB60AF1BAADA5D_09B430A: I suppose it's a bit like a slip and slide,[2.95]but bigger, and louder,[5.7]and more likely to kill or maim or drown you.
Dialogue.1A91D11E467B3E6C89B214A1A72F8ACF_5D63EF4: I think that's Dr. Verenkov over there ...
Dialogue.B4B39A2A431A931C823CD0ADB51DEF7A_587DB37: I think the soldiers are running out of ammo, but we're not safe yet ...
Dialogue.730265EB4D08264CF9C699A4AE2EE082_28A5EA9: I thought I was going to be stuck there forever.
Dialogue.B8528AD74AF3F118292B908DCBD9F8D5_5D63EF4: I thought about using the portals to get out of here, of course I did! [5.2]But without the Lens they're impossible to predict, let alone control. [9.6]And besides, exits ground near entries. [13]If you don't get stranded in some random anteverse, you'll just end up dumped in another part of the facility.
Dialogue.5D9CCA1F4C2B1DF92DEAC7A3581F4FF9_6AA6D76: I thought they were coming to help! [2]But they weren’t Gatekeepers! [3]They started shooting! [4.6]I wasn’t trained for this! [6]I’m just a receptionist!
Dialogue.C6DFEF0B486EC3D645332A8F034EA55B_D5875C8: I thought this might be a safe place to wait until they sorted this out ... [4.1]whatever 'this' is. Looks like I was wrong. [8.3]That useless rent-a-cop in the plaza said to go through Manufacturing, [12.26]then head for the Surface Tunnel I suppose... But that's a whole sector away. [16.3]If they think I'm walking all that way, through their toxic machine shops, [20]they can think again.
Dialogue.EB26E10E4BC660BCEB709A9C65915983_0630D2E: I thought you ... were the creature ...
Dialogue.77EA0A2B4843AD4483026290B3AE6D73_09B430A: I told you it was going to get worse before it gets better.
Dialogue.5A5FDFF945368E7C17A2F4B281C5BE6F_F2E10BE: I was not made for this heat!
Dialogue.786335F14330E08D8BEE1A816112B92B_8C6F078: I was trying to get down to Reactors,[3.0]but prudence dictated holing up here, as you may imagine.[7.6]I can only assume you're here to utilize the transmitter for some reason.[13]It appears the radiation is blocking the signal. [16.6]Perhaps you could devise something to shield it,[19.8]but I'm afraid that's outside my realm of ... ah ... expertise.
Dialogue.AD54944D4454E9E440474894D1972AA7_5D63EF4: I wouldn't blame you for trying your luck, but don't expect me to follow.
Dialogue.811674E14E615ECF10342AB7006C6305_587DB37: I wouldn't say we have a lot of time.
Dialogue.A35C93EA40DB47CA9F15D69FEA2F5775_F2E10BE: I'd give up my doctorate for a little rest.
Dialogue.2CA0076B46013B7B9A43ADBA1D1D7C0B_AF4702B: I'd head for the garage, and go from there, if I were you. [3.2]You can't miss it. [4.4]Just be careful - these guys ain't messin' around.
Dialogue.0B8F088443C8A6F30A6F5CBABAC5E1D2_18C7EC2: I'd love to help, but what am I supposed to do?
Dialogue.47A712EE48DE468ED5700FA681DE2A7B_98535A7: I'd say this makes the top five worst things that have ever happened here.
Dialogue.5B4FAF184471886B43A4EA889A1956DC_4D54ED2: I'll be going soon - I'm sure Frake's worrying about me.
Dialogue.61B8E98F4DE5E46E6A59DF8E95517E60_587DB37: I'll be sorry to sacrifice that beautiful machine, but we're past worrying about property damage.
Dialogue.77C6C98840D1EDD0C90F2C81CF1E2E4F_1E8E4DD: I'll come soon, when it's safer ... but I'm not going to stop you.
Dialogue.7EEC7DF449A105C5E678E1981382BD2D_5FC0510: I'll follow you soon ... Uh, through Manufacturing... or was it ...?
Dialogue.AF9F39564463FE6A9E7BF0B1D6EDBFEC_28A5EA9: I'll just wait here, shall I?
Dialogue.5FFFF3B54ECF0ED0CDD5D6BB9CCEC429_5D63EF4: I'll try and convince Abe and Dr. Ross to follow you ... if I can.
Dialogue.5BF0B1204729B303A0BF8F84AFF503E8_F2E10BE: I'm experiencing an insufficiency of food.
Dialogue.BDCAE3424E7BBC2BECCDB6940AD47213_5D63EF4: I'm glad you're still alive, and look,[2.37]this is going to sound ridiculous ... but ... we need to get down to Reactors![7.55]With the Dark Lens gone, it's the only working portal equipment in the facility![12.1]... A way out![14.25]So what if we opened the spillway?![17]All that water ends up in one place - Reactors![21.2]Nobody would expect us to risk our lives like that -[25]which is exactly why we should do it![28.2]It could be our only chance!
Dialogue.3353D23141F691213CEBC7AF79787A88_98535A7: I'm glad you're still with us.
Dialogue.8DA6699746FAA52B4F3ACB9764DB57BF_98535A7: I'm going to miss this hallway.
Dialogue.ED876A69481D2C8A2CF2FA8DD9408DFB_08113E4: I'm going to wait here. It's not safe out there.
Dialogue.165F21D24249B362E212F29FCC06F033_09B430A: I'm just fine with lonely, Abe.
Dialogue.7D83604F48306B6BD2C229AF2EA6D44F_09CA50D: I'm just trying to help get us out of here
Dialogue.63556C594A99D9224C3F749EAEB8183F_28A5EA9: I'm not entirely sure how this happened,[2.1]but it looks like the way into the Hydroplant[4.77]is blocked by a rather large volume of water.[7.23]But not to panic - if you just activate the pumps,[10.2]I ... think it should drain ... somewhere.[15.48]And whatever that is ... in the water ...[20.4]I wouldn't worry about it ... we've got bigger fish to fry.
Dialogue.4F778E1E41EC96B2241862A20951256A_587DB37: I'm not going to say it, I'm not going to say 'I told you so'.
Dialogue.F8FACFCB498D003D4C16869F7B5D9BA2_D5875C8: I'm not ready yet ... just a little longer ... [3]Maybe they'll fix this and I can get back to my work. [5]I have samples denaturing as we speak.
Dialogue.1F91F4524D689E5C14068CB0E892EC84_EF8738C: I'm not sure I understand what you're getting at.
Dialogue.A4CDC9A24A7CF4888B4BC890D21575B8_0508B95: I'm not sure if you're aware,[2.27]but IS Oh Four Two has colonised[6.39]a large part of the reservoir down there.[9.95]It's benign as far as we know,[13.1]but I wouldn't go touching it.
Dialogue.9CCA634441194EC936D22299378F8B55_84DFBE1: I'm really not enjoying this at all.
Dialogue.0162461D4121081DCA71448A2751F2E8_09195BA: I'm staying right here. Anything else is crazy. [3.7]If the portal system has malfunctioned, [5.9]there's no telling what could have found its way into the facility.
Dialogue.0E8A8C3B40D0680569972A9315DFCBA9_84DFBE1:
I'm sure Manse and his crew made it out, of course they did. [5.96]
The Exec probably rocketed out of here on golden jet packs.
Dialogue.6E2A0DC94C531A4FB5499C89C006217E_98535A7: I'm sure we'll think of something.
Dialogue.75F536354CC5F667A62C82AF68B68089_28A5EA9: I'm surprised we haven't met before, actually.
Dialogue.E9826F0A490EC09FBDACF4825D0715D9_8C6F078: I've been here almost twenty years,[4.5]from the very beginning.[7.7]And now we must abandon the facility.[12]I can scarcely believe it.[15.3]But bullets have a way of bringing reality forward, rather, don't they.
Dialogue.87DC7D534EA3C775EEACDD834EECF0B8_28A5EA9: I've been working in this facility for almost 15 years. [4.1]I honestly can't believe it's come to this.
Dialogue.9E6B46CD4F1CD7B16BB1A9995CC3884A_08113E4: I've had just about enough of this.
Dialogue.D85B1A6C44667A3B01A9DC86069DCB7F_F5807AE: I've never been entirely sure what Lenora sees in IS-111, [4.55]or even why she brought it back from A21 in the first place. [8.77]She says being near it gives her a 'warm, calm sense of peace.' [14.75]I pointed out that as the strange little furry cone of flesh seems to hunt entirely by telepathy, [20.6]it's likely she was simply falling prey to its psychic lure. [24.9]She did not seem overly concerned. [28.03]But after all, that is her way.
Dialogue.2D08BAFD4E6EE141C0C4CFB8EAEA9C88_0508B95: I've seen something in the water ... I think.[3.0]Could be to do with I.S. Oh Four Two ...[6.58]or something else entirely ...[9.0]Right now ... it's impossible to tell.
Dialogue.DAF20DF84462ED57882A17BA489367FD_F2E10BE: I... I'm dying. It's so hot.
Dialogue.F5C642244C71B498805634A543E6D7C2_F5807AE: IS-0173 - the aptly-named Pest - [4.64]is intriguing in part for the similarities it bears to so much early life on Earth. [9.52]Based on certain genetic parallels, and indeed, its genetic structure, [14.05]Dr Pendleton has identified some striking similarities to early life on Earth. [18.44]But until we gather more information, her theory remains ... theory, at best.
Dialogue.31574D724AA945B59A50EA992374D02F_F5807AE: IS-091 is the most intense AV candidate we've ever encountered. [6.5]Despite its appearance, it's a transcorporeal entity of some kind, [11.50]invulnerable to any of the physical deterrents we've tested so far. [15.93]Walls, doors, shielding, they do nothing to impede it ... [20.85]Intriguingly, it only appears to a single viewer at one time. [25.53]Dr. Stern has that dubious honor. [28.95]He identified it in the field and it followed him back here - [32.4]began materializing in the facility, looking for him like a lost puppy.
Dialogue.0482F1724ED61069284FB59B559F467B_5D63EF4: If I could only get to Reactors, there's equipment that could help. [5.8]But it may as well be on the moon right now.
Dialogue.17211204454924C337EB6BBDA0220776_EF8738C: If I don't go soon, horrible things will happen.
Dialogue.C3734EAA4CED2D0503D729851314E30F_EF8738C: If I don't sleep, I'm going to fall over.
Dialogue.5395A4BA412D9185EB5FB6B51FB18EAE_28A5EA9: If I tried to help, I'd just get in the way, wouldn't I?
Dialogue.7DE413A04A3AB18BBC81939DC1B5A22B_F2E10BE: If I was any more tired I'd be comatose.
Dialogue.483CE92A40A72718F00AF99411CB8D09_08113E4: If Jager thinks I'm crawling through the vents to let him in, he's got another thing coming.
Dialogue.85DFE8D648849023331970A5506E98B3_EF8738C: If it gets any colder, I may have a problem.
Dialogue.9C146A344B5F99D8DF086D9BD47A2124_5D63EF4: If it's a choice between random portals [2.7]and risking my skin with whatever's lurking in Security Sector, [7.3]well, that's no choice at all. [9.8]I'm staying here.
Dialogue.E2E076284210D8BEEACF59828ADEE865_F5807AE: If our intelligence is to be trusted, the Order - [4.27]I forget their pretentious Latin name - [7.0]regard themselves as the only safe custodians of the anomalies we research here at Cascade. [13.53]Indeed, reports delivered to the Exec Committee suggest these zealots see themselves as protectors of humanity - [20.6]the usual alibi for retrograde behaviour through the ages. [25.23]Imagine what humanity could learn - how we could profit as a species - [30.25]from access to something like the Sun Disk! [33.74]We are sure they have it in their possession. [36.48]A reply from the stars, and they bury it like some shameful secret. [41.5]Superstitious idiots.
Dialogue.B308E71840A37B1E0AF9009E4A3C6D5F_09B430A: If that was the only option left, Abe,[3.55]I'd push you down first.[5.05]And besides, I've heard the plant portal is totally out of control.
Dialogue.5E630676492A888EEDF0AE853DA72B21_587DB37: If the Blacksmith can make the parts to fix the electron pumps, [3.0]we'll blow the synchrotron to kingdom come. [6.0]A little extreme, perhaps, but clearly the rules have changed and I don't hear any better plans.
Dialogue.4DFCB26241D5A814084B91B2AE5BE64A_A783C72:
If there's anyone left in the Electrical Station, maybe they know to get
out of here, but this isn't my sector. [5.5]As long as that trigger-happy
asshole's out there, I got nothing!
Dialogue.BCDD81BA41DA82DCC89B2E85D02AB328_1FF8065: If there's something in your way, 'cuz I put it there... [3.4]There should be a tool down there. [5.3]Something you can smash the crate with. [7.6]You might have to look around a bit. [9.2]Don't worry about smashing stuff, we got a lot crates [14]A lot of crates.
Dialogue.EBA0313946EB6134E80B6F80A068B8A0_EF8738C: If we escape from this, would you like to collaborate on a research paper?
Dialogue.46AEF59543625625977C9C983A808CAF_08113E4: If we miss the neutrino burst, it'll be months of work wasted.
Dialogue.9284196D4CFBC92BB1FB899FB558534D_08113E4: If we miss the neutrino burst, it'll be months of work wasted.
Dialogue.6BB8E4234A0D4027039E6080E44FA061_1E8E4DD: If we survive this, our high energy research will been set back months, maybe years!
Dialogue.DCCAF0164C761D7BF4713F801C3DCA3D_B19337C: If you can get out of here, send help ...
Dialogue.3E5CF76046C1141C126CF7B7FB144C3F_28A5EA9: If you find a way out of here, tell me.
Dialogue.19D6031A41D5A35745F6B190A855B8E6_0630D2E: If you find any open terminals, tell me![3.4]But be careful - it can hear everything!
Dialogue.1AF27DA84A8C608108994F8400929F7D_587DB37: If you see any of my team, tell them you've found a way out.
Dialogue.900DEB1C4F2136F80A91F7B1F6EB1995_F609D41: If you think I am taking one step out there so long as les connard are here, think again.
Dialogue.0434C73144EBA940621F04A6F34E8D1B_0508B95: If you want to reach the portal in the neutrino detector,[3.55]you've got a rather long swim ahead of you.[6.95]I wouldn't try it without equipment,[9.6]and the sub's out of action ...
Dialogue.841C319348B1B1094D2029B80F13BD56_0508B95: If you want to reach the portal in the neutrino detector,[3.55]you've got a rather long swim ahead of you.[6.95]I wouldn't try it without equipment,[9.6]and the sub's out of action ...
Dialogue.E2BF62E14EAA90A1A7E6EB92A9FD44B6_58FA765: If you're in the area, I got some new gear, could help you right now.
Dialogue.CE567DE44ABCD3D5AA83FBAED33C0973_4AE005C: If you're looking for the spillway mainframe,[3.5]it's on the bottom level of the Waterfall Apartments,[7.8]if you can get in there.
Dialogue.0A5667BD47C4FA532305B4AC1BEBE9CB_587DB37: If you're not going to press that button, I will.
Dialogue.9CE48C2E4EEC584900EF418E2EC98081_4AE005C: If you're serious about opening the spillway flow control,[4.5]I can tell you two things:[6.7]Start with the power system over there - these quakes triggered a shutdown, but should reset easy enough.[16.3]The next part's NOT gonna be so easy.[20]You'd need to reboot the spillway computer,[23.7]unlock the flow valves,[25.67]and bring the central network transmitter back online somehow.[31]It could be done ... but ...[35.77]How desperate are you?
Dialogue.0EA5FEB141162D5D56C5BC9FE0D49ED4_23ED69A: Imagine the horror, the chaos, no, I must keep going, no matter what, [5.3]no matter who ... or how ... it must continue, never cease ...
Dialogue.36EA937E455C4B52C5EAC9BC1C4AA5B5_7D797E7: In the end, the science is all that matters.
Dialogue.89CC61C74A5601E3749D02BA0E24ED9F_F5807AE: Increasingly, we believe I.S. Oh-Four-Six - the Composer - is not an individual being at all, [7.29]but the extension of another entity entirely. [10.33]We have not been able to reach this entity, nor open a perforation to its original domain. [16.31]We achieved close contact of a sort, but now it seems to be almost ... hiding from us. [23.32]We are unsure how it managed this, but if I am right, [26.91]and it interpreted our first intrusion as an attack, this may have consequences we cannot forsee.
Dialogue.4D488E7A4D5DFB47DFA524953A6654D2_98DBDC4: Is it done? [0.2]I don't feel anything ... [0.4]Wait! I can feel ... a way out ... opening! ... [5.0]Thank my you friend! ... [8]Take me with you ...
Dialogue.2E70E9D64D8C8B4C2B4887812945C4BF_EF8738C: Is it your first time dealing with this sort of thing?
Dialogue.4A20595040D1498E40EE75BF0E4F89D4_EF8738C: Is that all you have to say?
Dialogue.9681DD1D41EBBE1E6FED4788C0054FEE_D5875C8: Is there a human out there?
Dialogue.919BC1D34663A663613F9ABC913A66CE_EF8738C: Is this the end of something, or just the beginning?
Dialogue.496888194597A4F6432A428EB3CC3013_EF8738C: Isn't there something you should be doing?
Dialogue.2B375FF24F4DFC65357B08857C20CDC8_4D54ED2: It could always be worse. You're probably hearing that a lot, though.
Dialogue.3E4587B244926663DDEB9083F5E320D1_98535A7: It knows we're here, Janet ... [2.3]There's nothing holding it back ... [5]Flathill is open.
Dialogue.FE09925D47DFF77B263C8F982EC445E6_23ED69A: It never stops, it never ends, it goes on, and on... [6.0]Haa...wait ... no, I must not stop ... it must ... I must ...
Dialogue.985FC564458ABD3666307BB27AA957E0_6B614EA: It seems our research is not as secret as we thought. [3.0]I believe they have been watching us for years,
Dialogue.872CE875400D458878E64A8076405B62_AD7A481: It was ever so, that we struggled at the edge of the light, [5.0]knowing not whether we stepped towards darkness or day, [9.7]and soon enough, darkness will rise.
Dialogue.992E8F8A484C64380DA1F8AD17E163BB_F980962: It was never meant to exist here ...
Dialogue.E28270664FF3518690E2FA8ADEADF644_F5807AE: It would seem that IS Oh-Two-Three is quite averse to the high energy EM spectrum. [5.78]Coming from Anteverse 42, I'm aware it may become too large to contain. [11.24]Dr. Feltman suggested releasing it to the Hydroplant reservoir. [15.4]I often struggle to know when that man is serious. [18.71]Anyone who would do that should not be allowed anywhere near this Facility or its erudite accomplishments.
Dialogue.2CD177434350D3F66EC50DB979BA912E_52045D4: It'd take more than a few quakes to shut the surface tunnel down.
Dialogue.649123B041C7B600AF26C3A50B59775A_EF8738C: It's Arctic, or is it just me?
Dialogue.C7A901B0431C6D7198CAF89FB63E8217_28A5EA9: It's a bit of a long story.
Dialogue.C35D668F4FFCEFFB47B61F8CCA0F66F6_5D63EF4: It's almost like they knew our system's weakness ...
Dialogue.5E7AF59449F39A52C7730580B42896BD_98DBDC4: It's dangerous,[1.6]Stewart never pretended it wasn't, but ...[5.7]if you leave me here ...[7.6]my chances are zero ...
Dialogue.E2ECBA9D4856DB0C4A980B9F43969089_EF8738C: It's hard not to feel slightly responsible for this, don't you agree?
Dialogue.C85760304E48611BA201DCA33590B3A2_4AE005C: It's how the Dam systems talk to the facility's network.[6.17]It's on top of the Hydropump building. [9.5]It's got a big H on the side, you'll know it when you see it. [14.5]But something's messing with the signal ... interfering with it ...[18.3]radiation maybe?
Dialogue.0E2804894D6733C9520FFF89032D701F_09B430A: It's just walls, tiles and some weird drinks machine that nobody except you ever uses. [7.5]But I know what you mean.
Dialogue.839C4EF9446811AAEDCC209EA7605AAF_F609D41: It's not so bad here, for now.
Dialogue.46571C5D4FB9FB25270949BE12CE95AB_5D63EF4: It's not the worst idea I've ever had, but ... um ... here we are.
Dialogue.A786618C4F732CF67B8C5EAF8FB43A3B_587DB37: It's safe, you can come up!
Dialogue.A4F43807499C7BA9945D7993A22AA103_EF8738C: It's worrying, but also fascinating, don't you think?
Dialogue.AAB6767444AE83C53AC6339941249B85_3FC2161: It’s not my fault!  I work on power cells! Not portals! [4]They take them into Silo 3 and I never see them again!
Dialogue.24E603044211C38DE82D869E3249AEFC_98535A7: Janet got us back into Labs, and we had a plan ... [4]although it didn't quite work out. [7.8]Now, we've got a NEW plan ... [11.0]But first, we need to get into the Containment Block and access our equipment ...
Dialogue.4ECB74FA43213E275F22E98146909A36_98535A7: Janet! I've got it![1.6]What if we opened the spillway[3.08]and rode it down like a waterslide to Reactors!
Dialogue.7AB456F049362D169E55058851A70778_98535A7: Janet, I think we're nearly there!
Dialogue.F11B5585446273D89867A8BE71785FDD_98535A7: Janet, you know, I don't think this is the way out of here.
Dialogue.C64B7E4E4A28E10985FB2B9D7E1B1B62_78497A6: Je fais partie de l'équipe scientifique!
Dialogue.C203817A462ECC1366E4D884E2B1029C_78497A6: Je pensais qu’on était en sécurité ici,[2.1]mais à te regarder, apparemment pas.
Dialogue.387EABBB4AF2C5111E72B5AE24437EC3_78497A6: Je peux pas revenir en arrière,[2.0]qu’est-ce que je suis censé faire?
Dialogue.96B40AE044EF3D57C0D7229B5E0AFA9D_78497A6: Je suis passé par le portail depuis Voussoir.[2.6]Les soldats n’étaient pas ceux qu’ils semblaient être.[5.0]Ils tuaient tout le monde.[6.6]Je me suis échappé de justesse.
Dialogue.E08D21FF4C6B88F21CA6A1B115DD85F7_09B430A: Just breathe, Abe, we'll get through this just fine.
Dialogue.8A355B894AF97110BB74099FF063BFAE_96C2A83: Just chuck it on your head, and I'll let you through.
Dialogue.9A65FCCB4F5F9898811285A7D7FD0AF3_58FA765: Just don't go asking for no hot air balloon.
Dialogue.E3318DE84C21D87556ECD2BF60B5196F_08113E4: Kinetics were running a perforation experiment, I know it. [5]Dr Verenkov is too impatient, and look what's happened.
Dialogue.FC137D36489361F7737021B9B061BF72_28A5EA9: Locked myself in here! Two PhDs but you'd never know it!
Dialogue.86E0B601463B65993D1917B5CF05B386_09CA50D: Look just talk to Frake okay?
Dialogue.8218F6DF40902D3863F968A5596E3631_18C7EC2: Look, I dunno what's going on. [3]They don't tell me squat on a good day, and this ISN'T a good day. [9.5]But if the big voice says get out, I'd do what she says.[14.7]Elevators are dead, so head for the main tunnel in Manufacturing, on Level 2.[20.6]There's maps over there. [23.7]But me, I'm stayin' right here.
Dialogue.F90EBCE04340B9910750BEB02287C8E9_D73DE1F: Look, just find a way to let me in.
Dialogue.4DDF48B341EA0D49A4209E953952ECDF_52045D4: Look, this place ain't healthy. [3.0] I'm keeping an eye on it, because someone's got to, and Frake'd kill me if something went wrong. [10.0] Things are bad enough already. [12.7]But you, you need to head for the Surface Tunnel, up the roadway. [16.5]There's no reason to stick around here.
Dialogue.BD0AD77C41CE7D552EB4C0B7B6A6E501_58FA765: Look, we don't got a lot of time. [2.7]Radio's out, Frake's gone AWOL, and the place is crawling with gunned-up psycho cowboys. [10.9]They ain't shut me down yet, but folk like you need to be gettin' to the surface tunnel. [17.0]Roadway's locked up tight, so you needa find a way through the security doors up there ...  [22.5]Maybe you can hack through somehow - [25.3]they don't exactly leave the codes lyin' around, if you know what I mean. [31.0]If you need somethin', though, I can help - equipment, gear, whatever - [37.3]I can make it, if you got what I need.
Dialogue.9F2C998A42AF836784434B8AD5EB0D76_98535A7: Manufacturing? It's huge. We'll never make it. [4.8]I'm 83% sure we're doomed.
Dialogue.06BA8E9B47A5C6346E7B3E80F1DB9753_1E8E4DD: Maybe the Blacksmith knows what happened to Frake and her team ... [3.5]Last I heard, there were down in the mines ... then the radio died ... and ... all this started ...
Dialogue.C552204C47669230D1FB719E10E88099_96C2A83: Morning. Lift's down there. [2.5]But first, you need a hardhat. [5.3]Health and safety and stuff. [7.4]Grab that one, and chuck it on.
Dialogue.F1554D9F48A225DB3AAD318AC9BD9C70_58FA765:
Most of what I need's round here somewhere, but you might needa go a little ... further ... afield. [7.1]There's places that ain't on the map, if you know what I mean ... [11.7]So look around the tram station, 'cause it's more than just a bus stop.
[16.8]Best'a luck.
Dialogue.5ECF2D904F9B6A0471230D8E3A2643A9_F5807AE: My concerns about our experiments with temporal perforations are increasing. [5.03]Causality is even more fragile than we imagined. [8.51]Unless someone can assure me that they know what they are doing, [11.66]I may have to put GATE efforts in this direction on hiatus.
Dialogue.DE4272D74E70B1513C1A408BCD0F10BD_6B614EA: My friend, this is no place for the careless. [4.0]I need to get to the Surface Tunnel, but the soldiers are waiting, I'm sure of it. [9.4]I heard screams from their camp, a slaughter, but they are not done for yet. [16.0]Somehow, they knew this chaos was coming - how?! [20.5]There are spies among us. [22.4]Must we become spies ourselves? [24.5]I must disable the security doors. [27.5]No system is perfect, there will be a weakness, I am certain. [30.0]I will not be left down here to die
Dialogue.E8683C0A417E69F587204E9E115C1BB6_500EBB0: My legates would anull me if I return, but I will find a way from this limbo. [4.9]Frake's fortress is not impregnable. [6.7]She knows the secrets of this sarcophagus, and she will be made to reveal them.
Dialogue.C3C9188546344188D470BFB21921EEF0_EF8738C: My mouth tastes like the Sahara
Dialogue.DB126E814E00D23ADE0BCD8366CAD90E_F5807AE: My personal disinclination towards firearms in general leaves me largely underprepared to record anything of value surrounding Oh-Nine-Nine. [9.51]I am not what you might call "a gun nut." [12.58]I can tell you it's antique, I can go on about its material makeup, and even tell you how it functions on a chemical level. [21.03]The answer is: mundanely. [23.94]This shotgun shows no anomalous properties when held or fired, but it certainly did, at one point in time. [31.67]We've tried different personnel, brought it back to its place of origin, and tried several types of ammunition. [38.28]At present, it bruises your shoulder when you fire it. [42.48]Testing is... ongoing, for now.
Dialogue.415B29D84600393E0772A6A97B976B89_58FA765: Need me to make you something?
Dialogue.63BEAC8C474B2DC33D26CE868F7B98FE_1FF8065: Nice. You've got some athleticism in there, somewhere. [5]Now, real creatures might wriggle outta that one, [7.9]but that's not a real creature, so ... [10.6]Next step is ... special containment, isolation, wash hands, innoculate ... [17.3]You know what, just, just stomp on it.
Dialogue.426A804D4DF19DC1787ACDB16AF7852C_09B430A: No-one said science was easy.[2.2]Or safe. Or even smart.[5.05]But ... we always learn ... something.
Dialogue.A2861E1543E7B55F6AE63B82AF69FE01_F5807AE: Note on IS-102. [2.83]We have determined the bacterio-phage recovered by Lenora's team from Anteverse 16 is a form of symbiote, [9.88]used by local species to assist mating. [13.35]You could almost call it a 'love potion'. [16.35]Preliminary tests show the affects on mammalian biology are extremely traumatic. [21.94]I have suggested Dr. Tengku NOT include images in her first report, [26.68]if she wishes to continue her research.
Dialogue.3C662139439AB57BF392AD998F5C2040_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I don't feel right at all.
