Dialogue.EBEEA19E42B7F5E84277EE95EC80C76A_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I don't feel right at all.
Dialogue.BCD227734CAC0DB2CED5478D0B8A7A9B_F2E10BE: Oh dear, I really must use the bathroom.
Dialogue.349DAC8E42491C96EAE7869464B74F6F_AF4702B: Oh hey! I'm over here, in the crane! [3]Glass is bulletproof, but these guys don't know the meaning of 'give up'! [7.2]I keep hearing 'em talking some kinda code, sounds like. [9.8]Whatever, I figure the best thing I can do is distract 'em, so they don't notice poor suckers like you. [15.8]I'm guessin' you're lookin' for a way out ... [18.0]but first thing those trigger-happy assholes did was lock down the crossroads. [23.0]You could push straight through, if you got the guts ... [26.8]Or you could get smart, and work your way round 'em - head for the garage ... [30.6]try'n touch base with the blacksmith - he ain't going anywhere. [34.5]I know what I'd do!
Dialogue.492371BC485E9813585C30A89F34453A_08113E4: Oh my God. What happened to Jager? [3.9]He didn't deserve that. I mean, not really.
Dialogue.F09F77544F0C6F0B88A3C58DDB11B1B2_D73DE1F: Oh … you’re new. [3.0]Looks like that little … pest damaged the power system. [7.00]Can you get someone to fix it? But hurry, would you. [10.0]I’m not enjoying standing around out here. [13]It was hours last time. I don’t feel safe at all.
Dialogue.7A2ED4084BB27A6ED8A2B88220D94C6E_EF8738C: Oh, I can't wait much more.
Dialogue.9E52E9D14C1E4A6403D338BDBA58AF7B_EF8738C: Oh, I wish I had time to investigate this properly.
Dialogue.CAAC30784BFDF212298CAE83078741B6_09B430A: Oh, I'm sorry Abe,[1.45]I left my tap shoes in FLATHILL.[4.29]REMEMBER FLATHILL?
Dialogue.BC30E7CC499B8AE55C803A90E153FAE0_4D54ED2: Oh, don't mind me, I'm just taking a moment.
Dialogue.0A7004F844047DD21C1AEFA60FC4ACE3_1FF8065: Oh, ho ho, brutal. [2.3]Okay, so next uh - uh, what's going on with your leg there? [6.4] Looks to me like you're bleeding. [8.2] Uhh, look, we'll call this training - basic first aid. [12.8] Find some cloth and make a bandage. [15] And uh, just keep this between us for now. [17.3]I'll buy you a beer in Residence later. [20.3] Sorry about that.
Dialogue.61224E684BCFCE3AE6B2269B0DFB97DB_84DFBE1:
Oh, it's you. [2.9]I came through the hole some maniac blasted in Manufacturing.
[9]Obviously, I was planning on getting through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator. [15] But it's covered in some  muck. [18.30]Typical. [19.90]I suppose they'll have something to deal with that in the Containment Block, but the place is completely locked down. [28.0]Ugggghh, it never ends. [31.6]I really need a coffee.
Dialogue.2AE1B9FD4EB2A462904A3F92019ECE69_1FF8065: Oh, okay, I was just thinking I would grab like a plastic bag for you ... [3.5]You know what ... this... [4.7]This is why we do the jobs we do here at GATE. [8.6] Go ahead and throw your ... fantastic net on the dummy.
Dialogue.23C74F504FABC7E3D230BD88EC8EA6EC_0508B95: Oh... I didn't see you there.
Dialogue.288827DE432848F54CD86394F9DDFE42_F2E10BE: Ohh... When did I last sleep?
Dialogue.31A4C6A84E5360EEBFA06792FCE66DD4_1FF8065: Okay, uh, now I have some instructions here [3.5]that aren't really compatible with the current security situation around here... [7]So we're gonna improvise a bit - uh, bear with me. [10.13]I'm going to have you crawl through that vent down there. [13.6]Consider it like chasing down an escaped specimen. [17.4]You got a big brain, you got a big imagination, right?
Dialogue.23D9203746653B71ED83ADA357703B46_1FF8065: Okay, you did that way cleaner than I would have. [2.3]And you would, wouldn't you. You're gonna fit right in down there. [6]Looks like you can walk on it alright. [7.8]Let's head on through to the next room. [10.3]Feel free to mosey, I've gotta check some stuff out. [14]We got some weird crap going on today. Not gonna lie to ya.
Dialogue.A84074EA445969DB896F8FB6F98D3235_9B469B0: Okay, you're the transfer, huh? [2.7]You sure picked a day. [4.5]Things're a bit hectic downstairs this morning, [7.1]but just grab your GATEPal there, it'll help ya get sorted.
Dialogue.9D27E4C742B7FB7E6045DF8C47B430D6_08CBFFC: Once, I will come, maybe, as they see fit.
Dialogue.02D740E34ADC16D3B202389FED77534B_F5807AE: One further note - Badwell's team have given us the all clear, [4.24]so our data protocols are returning to normal.
Dialogue.75F6D3EC458D849EADC7E59DBA54EACA_F5807AE: Our contamination of Anteverse 23 is worse than we ever feared. [4.68]Recent data suggests it is not a separate universe at all, but Earth's own future. [11.0]Likely only one of countless possible futures - [13.80]we've noticed some distinct differences - [16.7]but it is sobering to think we may have inadvertently triggered an apocalypse in one small slice of infinity.
Dialogue.B8F67B18492A78FCCE35E3AD74B5D661_5D63EF4: People called it the Dark Lens, but that's so ... portentous. [5.5]Technically, it's a tachyonic telemetry targeting unit ... [9.5]I should know, I invented it.
Dialogue.7A15925E4EC7ECFF6505F79F246673C6_F2E10BE: Perhaps I'm getting a little too endothermic
Dialogue.3B5F70124DD798B46628458632C466E8_AD7A481: Perhaps you are the true anomaly here ...
Dialogue.B674765B4A3D695081AEFE8EDFC4C4C0_78497A6: Peut-être que je pourrais traverser l'eau à la nage?
Dialogue.EAC9C407450FF9E5382325B30299B4EA_F2E10BE: Phew, my gastrointestinal tract is unhappy.
Dialogue.608AC49E47922CE9D2847BA153314A91_84DFBE1: Please, let me be. You're not helping anyone.
Dialogue.83C6395C41D1501FF2576B92027AB670_7E44BA3: Power services for today will be stopping momentarily. [4.5] If you have any specimens outside of containment, return them immediately. [10.5] Have an efficient and effective evening.
Dialogue.DD1565AC4DAD8C18DBAA78B004FA1DA2_F5807AE: Preliminary note on IS-091. [3.16]At this point, details are inconclusive. [7.85]We've dispatched a research team to Indonesia to gather field data, [11.73]with a view to bringing in a Transrecon unit, [14.15]and possible Gatekeeper support for capture, should it come to that.
Dialogue.952631E54702A397C8A5848E2354C4C7_F5807AE: Private note. After several months of inquiry, I have finally acquired information about our "lookie-lous." [6.8]It's far worse than I imagined. [9.0]A certain amount of attention to our research is inevitable, but thankfully, [13.18]the organisations that are in a position to know precisely what our research entails are few... and rare. [19.5]This group's reputation, however, is of a different order ... [23.2]If their attention is a harbinger of greater ambitions, I believe we have a problem on our hands.
Dialogue.F986C607458546321848B6B8D74096C7_F5807AE: Private note. [1.7]I believe that GATE has the wherewithall, both political and practical, [5.91]to withstand the attempts of almost any organisation on the planet to interfere in our operations. [11.64]There is only one group I'm aware of with the power to intrude on our operations here. [17.29]Unfortunately, we seem to have fallen under their gaze, or perhaps always were. [23.79]As much as GATE attempts to uncover the truth and technology behind the anomalies of this world, the Order seeks to suppress them. [32]We are two antithetical principles, set to converge on a single point. [38.63]Annette avoids the obvious truth. [41.28]If that point is our facility, I cannot guarantee the outcome.
Dialogue.5395C191462FCDA8C68D59B733A18B51_F5807AE: Private note. [1.8]It's undeniable that operations at Cascade are being monitored by external forces. [7]This much the Cascade Executive committee have been permitted to know. [11.3]Exactly who has been infiltrating our communications, [14.6]and to what ends, remains unknown. [17.4]Or rather, those who know refuse to say. [22.6]I have been directed to tell my team that we are conducting some security drills, [26.1]but... the threat seems quite real.
Dialogue.7F22482944E0372713C017B50EBE9AC7_9EEEEC2: Prometheans, your bretheren are madmen! [2.0]Using your science to taunt things you cannot comprehend.
Dialogue.2B0A3D7048BC350B6FA5A496EF8630DD_18C7EC2: Reckon I’m leaving here? I don’t think so. [2.7]Radio’s dead, half the doors are buggered, and now there’s little hoppy things everywhere. [8]You’re on your own.[10] But look. [11] If anything useful turns up, I'll chuck it into the machine over there. [17.7] You like peas?
Dialogue.513BEBDC4008F2B93E4305A154495683_18C7EC2: Reckon you know what you need to do, and if you don't, well, don't look at me.
Dialogue.5D9708CA4B7F51440559809EDC5668E6_86CB0D7: SCIENTIST! Do NOT reignite the Rift! [6]There are abominations within! [9.4]My brethren crossed over, to seal your folly! [14]Is the cost of your knowledge ... not already clear? [21]If you will not stop yourself, WE WILL.[28.3](Dying) [33.8](Imprecation)
Dialogue.2E11F67F4D4F6D33CC1AD08F51886E1B_18C7EC2: Saw a buncha eggheads heading to the Silos on Level 3 earlier. [5]Tried to tell 'em about Manufacturing, but they weren't having a bar of it.
Dialogue.36D557DA4A1A44969AE273879000EC2D_28A5EA9: Say, did we work on the neutrino detector together?
Dialogue.3C5147104B556956707F68BA83DEB797_3FC2161: Science isn't good or evil, it's just ... science.
Dialogue.5D5401F0426C3CB9E10DAE937B37DA30_9EEEEC2: Scientist! What purpose do you have with this anomaly? Speak!
Dialogue.62EA223747CBA9A9D641809472533F41_9EEEEC2: Semper idem! You seek knowledge but cannot see the true enemy.
Dialogue.7F7292E24943DCA20331178487F25A41_98F20B1: So ... ready for your first day?
Dialogue.6B2CC72F4D03953BC771139F35CA4DD7_1FF8065: So I'm betting they didn't have these at Springer. [2.6]It says here, 'All Gate staff at Cascade need to understand the facility's unique power system.' [7.5]It goes into a lot of detail only an egghead would want, er, no offense. [12.9]Every power socket here comes with its own little extension cable [16.2]and we build everything, purpose built for those sockets. [20.5]So what you're going to do, you need to package the heater, [23.5]place it back down near the power socket. [25.9]And then ... (distracted) What? [29.5]Okay, now I know that was a lot [31.4]I'm getting some weird interference on my radio. [33.7]I'm going to leave you to the whiteboard down there. [36.3]You might need a screwdriver. I'll get back to you in a minute.
Dialogue.9D0A31F149E4D84F8B539A87EF6ADCD0_96C2A83: So you've got what you need. [2.5]Head through the gate to my left, [5.3]down to the elevator. It'll take you down to induction.
Dialogue.240C20474BE226873CC41ABBD8A96611_D73DE1F: Someone needs to sort this out!
Dialogue.30EFE56E46D41005E6F5808CFC7AB5EA_84DFBE1: Sometimes I think Sukov arranged all this just to spite me.
Dialogue.BE2C95514F1C7143C50BF695EA0E0B56_84DFBE1: Sometimes, I wish hell actually existed, just so GATE management could go there.
Dialogue.8737271D4E2351FB3BCDBE9ADA05FB9A_6B614EA: Sometimes, it is difficult to tell an ending from a beginning.
Dialogue.CA2B95C342B5D0D2B1D50785A60106E1_9B469B0: Sorted? Okay. [2.24]Most'a what you need should be in ya GATE Pal ... eventually. [6.36]But you're good to go. [7.44]Head down to the elevator, it'll take you down to induction. [10.1]They'll take care'a ya.
Dialogue.D51B2D55491909B30FE043897DE09A70_4AE005C: Sounds like you've had an idea.
Dialogue.982AA4A74A6CDDE123C982920C3053C1_98DBDC4: Stewart said the transfer destroys the substrate ...[5.5]the source, which I suppose is ... me ...[13.1]But whatever I was ... has no future.[18]You know that, don't you?
Dialogue.207F1C1149B49F222BB7F2BFD066CF2F_18C7EC2: Still stuck here, huh? How about those life choices. [3.7]Anyway, it's time you got on your bike, I reckon. Smart sort like you. [8]Science your way outta here.
Dialogue.C184595142C0BFD0F02E529016C5DCDD_09B430A: Sure Abe, we'll get you your big lasers.  [3.5] Listen, we're not staying here one minute longer than we have to. [7.1]I just need to look after my colleague first.
Dialogue.D7452B8B4EFB0C4BCEC7038B611C634E_28A5EA9: Thank the stars!  [2.0]All I wanted was a place to rest a few hours without getting eaten or shot or minced ... but I accidentally locked myself in! [10.2]Two PhDs but you'd never know it! [13.5]I'd very much prefer not to rot here, so if you could help me out, I'd be extremely grateful ... and I can help. [21.2]I'm ... confident that I can get us through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator ... [25.7]in fact, I'm sure of it - if you can just get this door open. [30.5]Resetting the system in the Control Center should open these cells and reprogram the guns out there. [36.5]And, if I'm right, it should give us access to the rest of the Containment Block, too. [42.5]You just have to get to the Control Center ... in, ah, one piece.
Dialogue.DB432A0743A80593207F789FD6A0FD70_98535A7: That ... was a very, very bad idea.
Dialogue.C14CAC2A4B6B8EF8583C9DA4CA3A07F3_5D63EF4: That portal ... just appeared. [3.2]I've no idea how, but I am not going through! [7.9]Without the Dark Lens, it could land in the middle of a supernova for all we know!
Dialogue.72A3E86445E69C8E45094B826E0ACB2F_5D63EF4: The Central Transmitter?[2.4]Am I supposed to know what that is?
Dialogue.49E5B98540DF536A1BA921BB24B3A0A0_500EBB0: The Divinitors may punish me for dereliction, but I must warn them! [4.0]There are worse things to fear here than ... excommunication.  [8.5]It is imperative my legates understand the scale of this disorder.
Dialogue.C87E849A427037FE6FA3DDBC73096BF9_3322B20: The Exor have secrets ... things we could barely even guess at ...
Dialogue.DD77624545AB00437DA77C92BFB1447E_A783C72: The Gatekeepers pushed onto Reactors, down there... left us to deal with the Dam. [4.8]I don't know why. [6.2]Haven't seen any of those maniacs in days. [9]Normally, those guys give me the creeps, but right now, if I saw them, I'd kiss them.
Dialogue.28C4E9C54407FF1ACBF319BC1AB50DD5_F980962: The Tarasque is incredible, but we had to make sure it couldn't reach the other specimen. [5.1]If they managed to ... uh ... well, you know ... the energy released would be ... unthinkable.
Dialogue.92C972034BACE9BE7E32B1A9DCF8F092_F980962: The Tarasque is massive, but in its home anteverse it's almost microscopic. [5.7]Can you imagine what else exists there? [8.2]I'm sure the Gatekeepers would have brought home even bigger specimens if they could.
Dialogue.DDEE96F8421817A1B67BE18E73FE5ED9_F5807AE: The Voussoir team seem to have accepted that this is in fact the Yeti of legend. [5.58]Personally, I have questions, but certainly, we have more than enough to keep us busy here at Cascade. [12.21]Corresponding with staff in our Alps facility, one could get the impression they have better things to do [17.51]than resolve the mystery of the so-called abominable snow man. [21.84]Perhaps they're off searching for the Loch Ness Monster or some other snowy unbelievables.
Dialogue.358048A244E1856EF6BF67AE08EFE9DD_98535A7: The Wildlife Pens are full of testing gear, which could be useful for getting into Containment, [4.8]but it's an absolute zoo in there right now.
Dialogue.0C2DB7C847FF17FECD02B88DABA4553A_23ED69A: The autosystem should have been failsafe. They said it was immune?
Dialogue.3385554A429CB9B9D155C5B079902C5D_08CBFFC: The crusaders ... you're not one of them ...
Dialogue.1E5587064AEDFD265BB962B12D79310C_08CBFFC: The crusaders came to combat them – they will fail.
Dialogue.3159B09E4FD2CF64DA86A28A9F26A659_23ED69A: The dark lens! They removed it, but did not comprehend the effects!

Dialogue.C33208C0457E0C4CFCE2BFAC456DA4AE_98535A7: The fog is coming ... Janet, what are we going to do?
Dialogue.6BBFAF0A4C9A591FBF62FCAFCC274747_28A5EA9: The portal chamber is on the top level of the atrium ... or it was last time I looked.
Dialogue.9E3C59D442CAE3966F4D839A13674390_28A5EA9: The portal system's gone beserk, but I wonder - could that be just the shortcut we need? [7.0]There's entries and exits grounding all over the place. [10.8]Just ... don't do anything crazy.
Dialogue.AEE5B59C484470E36053C9B8521500AD_F5807AE: The properties of 139's residue is fascinating, [4.54]I'm not entirely sure where to begin, but... the being disintegrates during extreme stress, [11.36]leaving behind a material that can store and distribute electrical charge with extraordinary efficiency. [31.28]Even he should be able to understand, here is a big bang from a small package.
Dialogue.DD9A42884A26B6BD05FD4F95BB99CF29_1E8E4DD: The quakes destablized everything ... [2.8]if the synchrotron down there has been disturbed, it could blow this place sky high ...
Dialogue.11E3CB6545AB4056C0181EBBD37B2E5E_A783C72: The rain in here, they say it's just condensation, moisture from the roof or whatever, [5.6]but, I dunno, feels like it's got heavier ...
Dialogue.DFDC9B15401F2C0E2ADB4BA29DAC653B_587DB37: The science team never listens, and look what happened.
Dialogue.80DA499442064F42FE9595B53E00D6DD_587DB37: The science team would like to forget it happened - [3]but it did, and we're going to do it again. [5.0]But this time, it won't be an accident.
Dialogue.6BD3276948115ECEF191DA8A52997E45_F5807AE: The self-painted variants of IS-0184 are truly intriguing specimens. [6.1]These priests or... monks show clear indication of tool-making and ritualistic behaviour. [13.78]It seems to have formed a rudimentary civilisation in one of the Anteverse II locations we've accessed. [20]This raises intriguing research questions, as well as some ethical implications, I suppose. [25.84]Though I'd note that these haven't stopped us previously.
Dialogue.88610562487C268999675E972F7BBE9E_587DB37: The smartest thing you can do, is keep your head down.
Dialogue.1332B8FC4D921E1DAEA131ADB0B6AEC5_B19337C: The soldiers came through ... they locked down Manufacturing ... [5.3]Wanted information about ... the Silos ... on Level 3 ... [10.5]They weren't Gatekeepers ... they were something else ... [15.3]I couldn't tell them anything ... [18.2]But if you can find a power cell ... [20.7]We can use the forklift ... to open the door ... [24.4]get out of here through the Surface Tunnel ...
Dialogue.8A874A4C47156DF2503CDB9BF7496F70_23ED69A: The train cannot stop... it cannot stop ... it cannot ... Do my team know I'm in here? [5.4]They'll send somebody? ... to assist? ... but I cannot stop,
Dialogue.2506B35145C3C635C88223BF9EEE194F_23ED69A: The train must roll on, yes, no matter what [3.6]I cannot rest, must keep going, cannot stop, or we know what will happen [7.9]what we've feared, for so long ... all these years ... cannot stop, must keep going
Dialogue.09AE3A9244E4527489DB0F925845AFE7_8C6F078: The way ahead lies beneath us, I am sure of it.[3.05]The Reactor Sector is the oldest part of the facility ...[6.4]with any amount of equipment we could turn to our advantage if we can reach it ...[11.8]It's also a labyrinth, with access to the rest of the facility,[15.3]and spaces far beyond it ...[18.3]places these oafs could not possibly know about ...[22.8]I even hear the Gatekeepers have a way out, somewhere in those depths ...
Dialogue.DD79DACE4E63EFA4C4B9FCB23F7B4787_08CBFFC: The way was closed. [2.1]Remove the cells, and the way will open.
Dialogue.2BE5B0E449EE5FFA02B50E9E56B367E9_AD7A481: The world is a wheel that crushes the weak, the wary ... the unwise ...[8.2]Be sure of which you are before you seek the depths of this ... nexus ...
Dialogue.C55AC0AA4783AF32DC7E078A68CD4748_98535A7: Their song, it was beautiful. Terrifying, but beautiful.
Dialogue.21D6BC4E47F65494FD4F9F9F324107A3_F5807AE: There are a handful of things I am now certain of about IS-0059. [5.0]Firstly, it is a hunter -- the bodies and pieces of bodies are evidence enough. [12.0]Secondly... We are not its first encounter with humanity - [17.0]an increasing weight of evidence points to repeated appearances in the historical record. [22.0]Hundreds, if not thousands of times. [25.4]Lastly, although we cannot yet decipher its communications, Dr Veltman's exploration of early human dialects may be starting to bear fruit. [34.7.0]Despite this, we must face the fact that we remain almost entirely ... [40.0]excuse my morbid humor ... in the dark.
Dialogue.FBDC84A141A438D13D2952916FF63A6F_F2E10BE: There are deserts more hydrated than I am.
Dialogue.A8D468EC450869C53944E29066E7B22D_0508B95: There are no safe options now,[2.93]just less bad ones.[6.3]Take your pick.
Dialogue.DA96C6704CE97E018EC2E1996F883E95_84DFBE1: There are things in this Sector you should just leave completely alone. [6.0]You'll know when you see them.
Dialogue.A800A1E24BCDE6519437788E500A8B45_8C6F078: There are those who seek to extend our knowledge of the universe,[4.4]and there are those who would keep us in the cradle of ignorance.[9.3]Perhaps it is possible to uplift AND protect.[13.5]But who can answer such questions.[16]It would be enough, today,[18.2]to survive ...
Dialogue.1092809241515040C0FF3CA210A80C1C_6B614EA: There are worse things in these mines than men.
Dialogue.826CE1F34106D31E672FFBB53798C669_3322B20: There is a force at work in their world ... something we haven't seen ... [5]but its effects are everywhere ... if only we knew how to read it ...
Dialogue.02258B9B4AB60466DA623DB43B0774E9_F5807AE: There is an even more intriguing possibility pertaining to the Exor.[4.53]There are indications they are not native to that realm, but introduced. [9.88]Raising the dubious question: introduced by who? [13.59]And of course followed by the inevitable why.
Dialogue.BE82D0884950587ADEC8E5B0A75A8417_500EBB0: There is no justice in further conflict.
Dialogue.23329D7E4B951F6E28DADFB68A5DE440_F609D41: There is no way out here -[2.5]unless you've got a helicopter,[4.36]we're stuck on ziss damn mon-tain ...
Dialogue.3BC66C344AAAAA6720E0688719B16377_08CBFFC: There is still work for me here.
Dialogue.EA96B480402A423E9A3EC990AE43650D_5FC0510: There must be another ... a way out ... Manufacturing? [5.2]I - I don't I don't, I can't remember...
Dialogue.D78B2BE343D42EE88FC3DF9A1327C11C_F2E10BE: There must be water here somewhere.
Dialogue.A2A15364471FAD2BB2A712913118B432_28A5EA9: There's no getting past those cannons out there until you reset the security system. [5.2]Perhaps you can find a way across the chasm out there without plunging to your death in a dank abyss.
Dialogue.A1AFBF9A4AF6A9E9FBEC23993D915A2E_09B430A: There's no point, Abe, the portal will just reset. You know that.
Dialogue.8A60D1234BE79840E473548F4D847DB7_7D797E7: There's no way in. I think they've revoked our clearances.
Dialogue.30A1E9244EB4AB6290087E86B062CBDC_F609D41: There's one possibility ...[2.2]but it's ... suicide ...[4.06]I.S. One Three Four ... the yeti ...[6.8]Dr. Moreau said there may be a portal ... in the containment zone ...
Dialogue.8B359FD448454DBC67D7189DB3592687_28A5EA9: There's worse places than this,[2.1]but if you're lucky you'll never see them.
Dialogue.1D46010E4218048092F12EA7F4998F08_587DB37: There's your EXIT! [2]Nothing a micro-blackhole couldn't take care of! [4.9]Now you can get into Labs [6.7]We'll follow soon, but I'm not leaving any of my team behind. [11.4]You could be useful, try not to get yourself killed.
Dialogue.90A1D1E0448EA02F0C0FC29F30F12BCD_AF4702B: These guys, I keep hearing ... Latin? Maybe? It's creepin' me out.

Dialogue.0FBA10E04B267A60196B14B1AAAC60C6_58FA765: They ain't gettin' in here any time soon, but you gotta be careful, okay? [4.8]The cleaners are gonna have enough on their hands. [7.2]Haha. Look after yourself, okay?
Dialogue.3ADF81944BFB816409287781E0BA9077_08113E4: They always pick the worst possible time to lock the place down.
Dialogue.DAF6B6FD4C0F0AB6524C3382D2CA7256_5952414: They did too much, too fast.
Dialogue.A67D884546B01BD026E5FA99ED525783_D73DE1F: They never tell you what's gone wrong.
Dialogue.400658414E2C2B94CE0AE1B222D01B2B_3FC2161: They say evacuate. [1.8]How are we supposed to do that?
Dialogue.6340CB39449C288A8E08DF8597CB8286_B19337C: They weren't Gatekeepers ... [2.75]someone else ... not government ... [6.4]heading for the Silos ...
Dialogue.D65F37774B9A9A3B9B670DAB7F007F68_1E8E4DD: They're hunting us? Why?! Who are they?
Dialogue.0D16AE3F49801A0DD37690ABB702B331_4AE005C: They're in the tower across the reservoir.[3.8]But I got no idea how you're going to manage that right now.
Dialogue.519825D24885CBF878D229BE57DD997E_587DB37: They're with the Research Division! Don't shoot!
Dialogue.35EAE87F4C9E422FA889409310741C54_52045D4: This ain't the prettiest part of Cascade, but it does the job.
Dialogue.2FB03C31467F42779DDF0B9F0BE16001_F5807AE: This is Dr Derek Manse. [2.55]As our understanding of perforation technology grows, [6.21]we have discovered new facets of its physical laws. [10]One of the most fascinating is temporal tethering. [13.29]Each entry to an anteverse seems to start a timer, which resets after a given period [19.4]as though a band of time stretches, before snapping back to its origin. [25.0]I am confident we will understand this phenomenon in time, [27.8]but until we do, it violates a dozen scientific principles.
Dialogue.05E1D20846BBA5C25BF97EAE9E0764D8_F5807AE: This is Dr Derek Manse. [2]Today I discovered that Dr. Stern's latest software experiment [6.7]was simulating the entire facility - [9.4]a microcosm of Cascade, and every staff member within it, [13.6]even myself, I gather. [16]When I asked about it, he claimed to be trying to find a way to accelerate our research. [21.5]I enquired about the ethical considerations, [24]and he just looked at me blankly. [26.7]The man is a genius, [28.4]but more dangerous to this facility than most of its subjects, I'm sure of it... [33.4]An exceptional scientist, all the same.
Dialogue.E6CFCD7E4D2F47342C8712B7978C74CD_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [1.8]When I visited Dr Stern's laboratory today, he was acting oddly, even by his standards. [8.05]He seemed extremely agitated, speaking too fast to follow. [12.64]Then I saw the empty can from IS Five-Three. [16.57]I would have thought a man of Dr Stern's apparent intelligence would know better than to imbibe [21.36]beverages from a dispenser that appeared literally from nowhere, restocks itself, and cannot be turned off. [29.23]I will be pushing Enderson to review the protocols that allow such a device to sit in an open hallway.
Dialogue.B0829AEF4067D86E874CF3A24403DD38_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [1.92]Despite the obvious risks, IS Oh-Eight-Three has become a regular lunchtime haunt for several staff members. [9.27]They call it research, and in a facility such as this, there needs to be some lenience, I suppose. [16.33]So long as no-one forgets to close the door.
Dialogue.626C02114BE29D4FAAD06FA9FFCEF296_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.0]One of the most interesting aspects of the One-Seven-Three's [5.3]life cycle is how rapidly it evolves. [7.8]The high energy conditions of our universe [9.9]compared to the torpid energetics of Anteverse 2 [13.2]appear to accellerate their growth immensely. [16.0]It's humbling, if not a little frightening, to watch lifeforms alter so quickly. [21.0]The explosion of Anteverse flora in Reactors was far from an isolated event. [25.6]It goes to the very nature of life in that realm.
Dialogue.CD2FB6814864F0468F00C8A7EFF4EB1D_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.0]To this day, I have no idea why we persist in containing IS Oh-Nine-Three, when it does not exist. [9.53]There is a shared delusion among certain staff, a conspiracy of foolishness. [15.02]This is no place to go into the details, but I want to state clearly for the record: [19.36]there is no disease we classify as IS Oh-Nine-Three, there is no such thing as a subjective infection, [27.63]it was not created by Russian researchers. [30.4]I am not choosing to believe this in order to protect myself. [34.05]There is nothing to disbelieve.
Dialogue.CCE7C4B9489D38587734D9BE59CD1846_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2.1]Now that I.S. One-Oh-Seven is on its way safely - for a time - towards interstellar space, [8.93]I find myself taking a step back. [12.06]In moments like this, one sees with shocking clarity how fantastical so much of our work and research here really is. [19.95]If we weren't established and - by and large - esteemed scientists [24.61]with decades of experience and education behind us, this place would sound ... nothing less than insane.
Dialogue.3C1B43A9420EC06F3A26398864877BC4_F5807AE: This is Dr. Derek Manse. [2]I'm pleased to confirm: the first Flathill perforation was a success, [6.6]although the geomagentic convergance was stronger than we anticipated, [10.6]allowing an entity to pass across - IS Oh-Six-Four - [14.7]perhaps the largest we've yet logged in our Immurement Registry ... [18.7]Indeed, the events here in Flathill have advanced our understanding of perforation by orders of magnitude. [26.5]I regret the contamination and consequent - ah - closure of the township, [32.6]but I am more confident than ever in GATE's ability to develop a functional portal network. [38.2]What we learn here will alter the history of our species ... [42.3]And maybe we can finally stop flying Economy.
Dialogue.6B4CE52F46203F99E796839253092C28_F5807AE: This is Dr. Manse. [1.48]If you had asked me five years ago what our chances of using the perforation system [6.44]as a stable travel network were, I would have assumed I was talking to an imbecile. [11.83]Today, such a network seems within our grasp. [15.82]The T3 Unit - or ... the Dark Lens, they're calling it... [20.68]has proven exceptionally succesful. [23.84]There are few places on Earth we cannot access under stable conditions, [28.58]and finally, we can create those stable conditions. [32.9]Uh, in theory. I would say, our ambitions have extended far beyond their origins. [40.9]Far beyond.
Dialogue.2D37ACBE42FD292DD9C6FBAC23110F01_F5807AE: This is Dr. Manse. [2.4]Studying the tensor dynamics of our perforation system, there's one particular thing I've noticed. [9.35]It seems that the distension of the continuum has an attractive effect - locally. [14.96]Which is to say, left unguided, portals will ground their exits near other portals. [21.41]If they weren't so unstable, I'd be tempted to suggest this could be exploited as a way to travel rapidly around the facility. [29.28]I can imagine what Dr. Thule would think of that, unless it meant getting his coffee quicker.
Dialogue.6EBDCE9E4234CE82628CCCB7F106B105_0630D2E: This is a nightmare.[2.1]The power cut off, and that ... creature appeared ... [5.8]it's taking people ... somewhere ... [8.7]and that awful stuff is growing over everything ...[12.65]That sound - it was the surface elevator, wasn't it?[17.6]We're trapped, aren't we?[20.43]Locked in here ... with that thing.[23.9]Have you seen my glasses anywhere?[25.6]If I can just find them, this is the Security Sector, [28.58]there has to be codes, passes, something to help get us out of here.[33]But we must stay QUIET.
Dialogue.089DFCB249EFC607F4F77789187B836C_98535A7: This is completely different - we're fighting fire with fire! [4.4]Manse never let me try this, but if I can just bootstrap the neural array ... [10.0]I should be able to ... ah ha! ... [13]oh ... oh no! Janet!
Dialogue.71949ED340AFEF46F8CAF49C70CD313C_587DB37: This is either going to work, or it's not. I think it's time we find out.
Dialogue.320B9BBD4C1CB9662C3396A7E102C2E4_3FC2161: This is worse than last time ...
Dialogue.47B8612E469D17E0BE09329FF6EF49E6_98535A7: This is worse than the time ...
Dialogue.DDAD010D4A1C18D9EB20D6856729E595_5D63EF4: This isn't my sector.[2]I have no idea where the flow valves are.
Dialogue.F84101E8490B1D098A812EAC37B3B335_500EBB0: This place is cursed by forces greater than we can endure.
Dialogue.A8CC313A468F97CCF13A6287F106EBB2_587DB37: This place is done for, I don't know why you're sticking around.
Dialogue.B53414494BD63D3DB7678884315BEA14_7E44BA3: This sector will be powered down momentarily. [3.3]If you have not already evacuated the facility, consider this your top priotity. [9]Have a wonderful and productive evening.
Dialogue.04D6C06B4ED6F2EC3752D4AC2F6265BD_7D797E7: Those security bots are lethal, [2.4]but taking one down and getting the CPU is our only chance to rescue my data.
Dialogue.5CD9B52D407BF6A2148D18942A528E49_F5807AE: Though we haven't yet captured a complete specimen of 0139, [4.0]Dr. Thule took a sample of its ... dust, but this raised more questions than answers. [11.0]Foremost, One-Three-Nine appears primarily to be a host, rather than an individual. [17.0]Pendleton theorizes One-Three-Nine may be suffering an infection, [21.0]which will require tests to ensure no cross-contamination can occur. [25.6]And if true, we're unsure whether its behaviours are innate to the original being, [30.7]or a byproduct. [33.6]It's... quite a tangled web, really. [36.4]We'll need more time.
Dialogue.6B036BDF4F68A5B460CD76B209C21783_EF8738C: Tired, light-headed, dry mouth ... ahhh, dehydration
Dialogue.1AB6ECC04120F9F81CE27A99A5C03E62_F5807AE: To anyone considering study, investigation or indeed any kind of interaction [5.3]with the Red Chair, IS Oh-One-Eight, I can advise only caution. [11.4]Consider this piece of furniture a tool of assassination, no less for being so thoroughly arcane in its function. [20.05]If you find yourself affected, we can little do to assist you. Perpetually.
Dialogue.6F50C47F41F37804DB2379B2E5CEEB0B_F5807AE: To anyone handling fluids of IS-121, the Tarasque, be extremely careful. [6.42]The ichor has properties we've yet to fully assess, and can interfere, interrupt or even instigate perforation events. [15.04]I'm sure you're all aware of what happened to Dr. Stern, last week. [18.6]Luckily, we recovered him unharmed. Mostly. [23]With thanks to the staff at Torii Facility, we have the Tarasque hooked up in that insufferably hot "Shroom Room". [30.27]Please ensure you do not to disturb the arrangement.

Dialogue.52E3B3B04E321A24E3F017A5130E0DA6_500EBB0: Understand me when I say, there is no pathway here.
Dialogue.347890FD40651D47CC3DA0A93071274A_18C7EC2: Unless you get a move on, you're gonna end up as tucker [3.5]for some frilly peg leg drongo from God knows where. [7.5]NOT a good look. [9.7]You're smarter than that. Or you should be. [12.8]I've seen those Science Team paychecks.
Dialogue.463D3F064CCEE6B8BAC63CBEC824212A_F5807AE: Update on IS-102. [2.6]Human exposure to the phage has highly negative effects, [6.1]transforming victims into hyper aggressive, mindless predators. [10.73]While it encourages breeding in its original hosts, human hosts seem only to consume one another. [16.83]If there are useful applications of this phenomenon, I am slow to see them. [21.93]I have given Tengku two weeks to show productive results.
Dialogue.9668C1EF41147A9A7309BB97E9777FA8_7E44BA3: Warning, biological incursion detected. Please alert Defense Team personnel.
Dialogue.5C4A73FE4AD66A8472E0068B0294521E_7E44BA3: Warning, this facility has been compromised by unauthorized entities. Alert nearest Defense Team staff immediately.
Dialogue.9E6FEAE74BD877CFC300BF8D73333D28_7E44BA3: Warning. The safety rating of this sector is now - negative four. [6.5]Please exit this sector via the Main Surface Tunnel. Have a safe and successful day.
Dialogue.1727AB834FEF033F81470C8EB82E403B_4D54ED2: Watch out for those hoppy...potatoes! [2.3]I found a few of them down here. [4.4]How on earth did they manage to get in?
Dialogue.FC0114C54BA7F72D0F59BDA022C1E500_F5807AE: Watching Dr. Peters work with the 173 this morning - [3.36]the little hoppy one - [5.45]a thought occured to me about its relation to the other two, [8.65]and indeed all the entities we have encountered in Anteverse 2. [13]At best, the implications are ... concerning. [17.39]In the most extreme reading ... no ... it will have to wait.
Dialogue.76901A7140BCB4EB663E40A1187D65F8_5FC0510: We ... can't go this way ... You don't... want to.
Dialogue.C0393ECF40537ECE2CC5008FC57D32E5_98535A7: We HAVE to do something, Janet. We need to go back into Flathill.
Dialogue.0FCC8B2B4301F785D57F28BA5D26509E_500EBB0: We came here to cleanse, and protect, but this chaos is beyond our capacity to supress. [5.2]We are beset by demons from the depths of the mines! [8.0]And that termagent FRAKE has holed herself up in the Processing Plant! [12.2]I must warn my betheren, this course is impossible! [15.5]But our engineers collapsed this tunnel, to ensure no egress. [19.0]We need another way to bring tidings of this terror to the Tribunal. [22.8]Frake is concealing the escape from us! I am sure of it! [26.0]She hides in her fortress, letting us rot here!
Dialogue.1C7FB85E4398224625C16EA76125364D_09B430A: We could try the adjustment wing, too. [2.6]Every time I'm in there, they've got some new piece of fancy equipment. [5.9]They get ALL the new gear.
Dialogue.740ABC184F55CC0B273A89BECFE91A30_F609D41: We have done extraordinary things here, and perhaps we shall again.[3]I do not know what the future holds.
Dialogue.A4D68A0645A7D7D9FF7418973609E9CD_98535A7: We just need to get in there.
Dialogue.78B4BA524A3162B1D91A9DA7C6296EC7_23ED69A: We must fix it, but keep it going... it must not stop ... must persist ... at all costs ...
Dialogue.4796FB7C44DDAAE99C0197ACE6D39A5F_98535A7: We need WEAPONS ... BIG LASER GUNS!
Dialogue.A1DD13B54075B587BF884EB6648D7EB1_98535A7: We need to shut that place down, now.
Dialogue.8CF79DDE4D24AADD3B9DEEA9320A1160_3322B20: We were on the cusp of understanding ... [3.5]So much knowledge lost.
Dialogue.9AF995324F8498B35BF9BAB9D9A94730_6B614EA: We will leave here, one way or another.
Dialogue.EA0A2B5D41CB8F811D0CFF800ABCBC6F_09B430A: We're going to head through Manufacturing, then take the Surface Tunnel out of here ... [6]when you're ready, Abe ... so ... just try to calm down.
Dialogue.5B85E9AA4431AEE4BF1107A2B86CC7E1_09B430A: We're never going to live this down.
Dialogue.798F20674A696A732F6ED8AEB67C6D61_28A5EA9: We're not out of the woods yet, but I'm starting to think we've got a chance.[4.07]If we can just get through the Hyrdoplant,[6.06]perhaps we can even get to the Residences -[8.75]so close to the surface, comparatively speaking, anyway.
Dialogue.1320120C4CA6DA5D159ED68986876761_09B430A: We're safe for the moment.[2.3]Our best option is to wait, and keep our eyes open.
Dialogue.B3885DEC408384308BECD2BAD1165BC5_28A5EA9: We've gone out searching for new realms and other entities,[3]only to lock them away like some cosmic zoo.[6.5]Is anyone really surprised that it's come to this?
Dialogue.535A8EDF4E2165E075E09AA1F3A18457_F5807AE: We've had IS Oh-Two-Three contained in the aquarium for almost a decade now. [5.42]We recovered it from Anteverse 42, so we should have guessed where this would lead. [10.46]Oh-Two-Three shows no sign of stopping its growth. [14.25]There were several specimens, but it seems to have consumed its remaining competitors. [19.35]I have better things to do than repeat myself, but as directed by the Executive, [23.69]I remind staff: swimming alongside the beast is prohibited.
Dialogue.E1F465F240254388A907E091288C107B_7E44BA3: Welcome to the GATE Cascade Research Facility. [4.4]You are in the Induction Wing. [7.91]The facility is currently at Alert Level: Precautionary. [13.3]Please listen carefully to, and follow, all security instructions. [19.5]Now arriving at Staff Processing.
Dialogue.B41753F34FC5A4E4082A33A287AE3276_98535A7: Well, I've had a good look down here, and ...
Dialogue.49CABD91470DF162202EA18238E2886A_98535A7: Well, Janet, I've come up with several ideas.[4.2]Aren't you supposed to be a teleportation expert?
Dialogue.35784F2F4F3AA03E61C131B0DEF235A0_D73DE1F: Well, if you're the only help available, you should set up somewhere and sort this out.
Dialogue.848ECC564C439FEF67C2458B474BF961_28A5EA9: Well, it looks like the way is clear, for now.
Dialogue.BB33C611444C7557BC15CCA75570C279_8C6F078: Well, that certainly looks to have done it.
Dialogue.964927D648085A7CAC26B68ACD3C39B9_8C6F078: What I wouldn't give for a few hours[3.8]to study whatever's swimming around out there ...[7.3]the Gatekeepers call it the Darkwater ...[11]and they have their reasons, I assume.
Dialogue.1AB25B2747F72E8959DAAB95D4206CB6_09B430A: What are you waiting for? Get to Manufacturing. We'll be along as soon as Abe's ... feeling better.
Dialogue.1FE5F9254B6D1645092502BA56F4A740_AD7A481: What awaits will wait, what comes will come,[5]what is not done remains undone until the fetters fall ...[11]and the time is not yet come ...[14]So halt, or return, but proceed no further ... for now.
Dialogue.EB36942845C6C8C36CB013A21252D75D_EF8738C: What do you suppose the chances of this happening were?
Dialogue.C2CF196648B963199EA9879D8D2736D9_08113E4: What on Earth is going on?
Dialogue.C4CA61B84B604EAAC4832BABB7FF15CE_18C7EC2: What're you gonna do, just stand there?
Dialogue.12840E224DC35828EAFCE8835E2BD82A_F980962: What's going to happen now ... I don't know ...
Dialogue.15AAF304418DBCAE83D8F4810E6B4ACB_28A5EA9: Whatever that is, in the water,[2.09]it's not our problem.
Dialogue.8E6721334B381AE3393126B5C747EC73_5952414: Whatever they're doing in Silo 3, it used every powercell we had.
Dialogue.8AA80C7341CC9BC3BFF875A418A64369_587DB37: Whatever those soldiers were expecting, it wasn't this.
Dialogue.8ABBB6ED4EC5D03A55362B99FFF6DBF6_84DFBE1: Whatever's going on, it'll be something to do with their work in Containment Block - [6.0]Those cowboys can't tell a boson from a bathmat, [10.0]and sometimes I wonder if they even care. [13.5]As soon as they set foot in another dimension, all good sense goes out the window.
Dialogue.70D99D49436BE16C8D91EBA0C6778FB0_AD7A481: When the way opens, judge your course with what wisdom you can, [5.5]for there is no return to unknowing ...
Dialogue.9E4B670C44E280B2947EEAADE8E47547_9B469B0: When you've got your GATEPal, I'll let ya downstairs. [3.76]Should work like your PDA at Springer. More or less.
Dialogue.E9D2B3F446D413392A85F6BA0597041B_AF4702B: Who taught you guys to shoot? Stevie Wonder?!
Dialogue.1106D85B49CD1F770778BD94D1838FEE_84DFBE1: Whoever those soldier are, their Latin is atrocious.
Dialogue.7FCBC196412FCAD1943966A6F2C2EF6C_98535A7: Why are you still here, are you insane?
Dialogue.461717C34D094FE4FE640598E8A11F24_F5807AE: With the detector online, we've been able to confirm a dense neutrino burst with the creation of each new perforation. [7.4]We've noticed something else - the neutrino detector attracts perforation targets itself, possibly due to its shielding. [16.25]At any rate, it's frustrating. [18.23]Every time a portal appears in the reservoir tower, we have to recalibrate the entire apparatus.
Dialogue.D225B78A4BBE4169B8556F94F0F6D357_28A5EA9: With the guns are deactivated, we've got a clear run through Containment Block. [4.0]But I hate to think about what else might be on the loose on there ...
Dialogue.94FFBC2A44A189FDD91524B18901AAF6_0630D2E: Without my glasses, it's hopeless.[2.8]Everything's a blurry mess.[4.8]Am I supposed to crawl through the darkness?[7.2]Even if I could get to the Dam, it might as well be fifty miles.[11.1]And then what?
Dialogue.3406C9764134F04FD94FADACDFCB738C_EF8738C: Would you have thought it could all go so wrong so quickly?
Dialogue.61F148FB4D38CDAABB070485D94E1D33_EF8738C: Would your modelling have predicted this?
Dialogue.E416ED17490E60672D136BB5CA018A44_F609D41: Yes, the eeire has become the prision.[2.7]Who could have guessed this could happen?
Dialogue.7ADF693948C9FBA799286EAFF408ECEE_7D797E7: Yes, yes, I'm coming. I just need a little longer.
Dialogue.44A97338485AFCAE4CE745A72420528A_AD7A481: You are learning, your aura is shifting,[5]but some doors open in their own time ...[9.2]and that is for fate to decide ...
Dialogue.181CE3A94FDD757D7A5CD6B6496BA178_58FA765: You been through the train station yet? [2.3]You wanna fix those pumps, you need to pay that place a visit. [6.3]You'll see what I mean when you get there.
Dialogue.450D3E744DF75FE80559EF97BA0120D0_F609D41: You came back. You are either very brave, or tremendously foolish.
Dialogue.5B46F775460CFF87A2D02FA14EAF8DA4_1E8E4DD: You came from Office Sector? Is it ... bad over there?
Dialogue.7D2280264F36A7851A525BBFF4F33CD8_9B469B0: You came from Springer? [1.5]Things are a bit different over here. You'll see.
Dialogue.5F6A441541539C785D772B86588FB771_587DB37: You can wait here, you'll be safe, just don't get in the way.
Dialogue.F67615A540E9B3A0783F28B6A739E31F_58FA765: You find a way out, send help, alright?
Dialogue.16C4B429464D50137C8E84867D3ED50A_D73DE1F: You going to leave me standing here?
Dialogue.E497B13241ADA9ED83E05ABA09C8E692_7D797E7: You got it open! ... I was right! [3]Looks like someone closed it from the inside. [7.1]But who would do that?
Dialogue.D9B328A747200AE0AF9DDEAE06ECEFD5_AF4702B: You guys look like you're having fun down there ... Me? ... I'm doing okay too.
Dialogue.92CA9E5B4A09FDA8FBCC7BA20AD93F52_98535A7: You had the same idea![2.65]Well done.[4.25]I'm very interested to see how it goes.
Dialogue.395EE7004ACD2FD1514887965AACBB71_AD7A481: You have come far, but you will halt here, before the darkness, [5.2]the water, the nexus, an egress ... perhaps.
Dialogue.B6031199416EDD93790D63BEBAC6F66F_AD7A481: You hear me, but do you understand?
Dialogue.D55567AC434F5402793B8796429678F4_AF4702B: You idiots couldn't hit the floor if you fell over!
Dialogue.5942DA784C15E5EA17AFFBAF790B83A5_28A5EA9: You know ... [2.2]There are surely beings in this universe far stranger[4.8]than anything this Facility has locked away -[7.3]or accidentally unleashed.[9.4]Things we can't even imagine.[12.7]Anyway, good luck in there.[15]If you can get to the surface elevator in the centre of the sector,[18.3]we may actually have a way out of here.[21]I know you'll figure it out.
Dialogue.87FCC35441B31CA55CC370898DE98027_98535A7: You know this cola's really not too bad.
Dialogue.378EB61F43BABD5B50A903B7F45DC63E_5D63EF4: You know what this is, don't you? [3.0]The Dark Lens ... the core of our perforation research ... [8.5]Or it was. [12.4] I'd heard rumours of a threat, there are always rumours ... but this is insane. [20.5]They killed everyone, then removed the Lens ... [25.8]Without it, how are we supposed to control the portals? ... [30.0]they could appear anywhere ... connect to anything ... [35.6]Do they realise what they've done?
Dialogue.C7071B7444A923F55F7E309504C51B75_98535A7: You know, sometimes, Janet,[1.6]you can be very pessimistic.
Dialogue.B946DBBD448C47D5DC236B8BB19FA97E_F980962: You made it past the turrets ... You're the first! [3.2]I've been locked in here since we contained I.S. one-two-one. [6.3]For its own safety, as much as ours! [9.3]Such an incredible specimen, and not just its size. [13.8]The capacitance of its circulatory fluid is extraordinary! [17.3]Just a few drops contains enough energy to power an entire portal network ... [21.8]We've barely begun to understand the possibilities!
Dialogue.D8DED5D547625F5CACC53C836B429D07_09B430A: You mean the soda that just appears in the vending machine and no-one knows where it comes from? [5.4]And even if you unplug it, it keeps working? [8.4]That's some quality refreshment right there, Abe.
Dialogue.AAEE83E8441EC335FA92DCB48056E004_AF4702B: You need to get a move on, I can't last out here forever.
Dialogue.667D5BC945C191EEB74292920672FC95_D73DE1F: You need to open the DOOR! ... NOW!
Dialogue.FAB776B0465F15823A1A8281E38C8B78_08CBFFC: You opened the way. And now they are free. [4.6]Trapped no longer. You have given them freedom, whether you meant to or not. [11]That is the price of your own escape.
Dialogue.B3D55CCC47C5CDFA6ED48F8EBB86F4DB_09B430A: You quantum entangled us?[2.05]Or the time you shrunk me to the size of a bagel?
Dialogue.5D47DA7646FE11D82B6035B0A4297630_28A5EA9: You reset the system AND turned the guns on those apes! [4.0]Bravo! [5.5]We may yet get out of here with our skins. [8.0]Now we just need to get that odious gunk off the Vacuum Chamber door. [12.9]But this isn't the first time we've had this problem! [16.4]That goo was a curse until they opened a portal to the Mycofields in Anteverse 2 [21.8]and the TR teams discovered a substance that could remove that awful stuff. [27.0]The test chamber portal may even still be open, but with the state of things, who's to say? [33]I suppose we just have to go and find out.
Dialogue.6F481D2645ADB1EB35DDAE9418D1A6BD_52045D4: You see Frake, you tell her I got this place under control ... for now.
Dialogue.7BEB854648E8328352C1C2997F804939_EF8738C: You should focus on getting out of here.
Dialogue.BAC50A6846687ADC229166B91E3EEC15_587DB37: You should leave this to engineers - we built this equipment, we understand it.
Dialogue.D743B3EA408B9F9BF276C9996586C2EF_5D63EF4: You think Security Sector is any safer than this? [3.6]It's not just a rumor, staff have disappeared! [7.7]The Defense Team says there's nothing to worry about, [10.6]but that's when you know there's a problem.
Dialogue.877CD04A45DCCC0BB1BE96BB98509988_AD7A481: You think you understand, [2.6]but your mind dwells in the shallows ...
Dialogue.E17573F54A6948A5E1CFBEB0A05BCDD3_08CBFFC: You want out? Of course you want out. [2.6]Like them. The giants. You are trapped here. [6.1]But shut down the devices. Your devices. [9.1]Remove the power cells. One two three. [12]You’ll have your way out. But what then? [15.7]When you’ve opened your door? What then eh?
Dialogue.A8AB756B48CCA5934AC3538DE615738F_09B430A: You'll have to forgive my colleague, Abe, he's had a bit of a shock. [5]We tried to get out through Flathill, and ... well ... some people ... died. [11]Then some genius deactivated the Composer containment system. [16]So, clearly, we need to find another exit out of here, [20]and that's looking like Manufacturing West. [23]I don't exactly enjoy the idea, but our options are... limited.
Dialogue.C7D117EA442EC1548AF773AFC154F44B_9B469B0: You're all good, head downstairs to the lift.
Dialogue.A5C20334413F5717CF68A69028252207_4D54ED2: You're evacuating, aren't you? [2.4]And trying to keep out of sight - I know the feeling. [7.5]But I can't think about it right now. [10.7]Frake asked me to get something from the Blacksmith. [14.1]She's got a plan to get us out of here. [16.6]It's extreme, but it just might work.
Dialogue.133F956F460264F95A9DD796B538A542_58FA765: You're not one'a Frake's people, are ya?
Dialogue.403BAE0245B6285A2587D5A1CE01AD96_58FA765: You're not one'a Frake's people, are ya?
Dialogue.FDD1C1DB49A54B5331D052883A9ED20E_5D63EF4: You're not seriously thinking of going through ... [4.2]are you?
Dialogue.F6600FCE4F1C5C79140CAC8347C1764A_98DBDC4: You're part of the Research Team ...[4.1]I'm sorry ... I can't see much at all now  ... [8.7]Whatever happened, it shut down most of the lab's sensors ...[13.6]There was shaking, then the water ... then nothing.[20.8]I've been waiting for days ... I think.[25.1]Stewart ... Dr. Wakeman ...[28]He was working to free me, but ... what happened to him?[35]He was almost finished.[38]Don't leave me here, please.[42.6]If you can complete the neural-bridge,[45.3]I can transfer to hardware, finally.[50.5]Dr. Wakeman said it was almost ready ...
Dialogue.9B19B9A8409941DAEE740FA2709BC025_5D63EF4: You're probably as sick of portal-hopping as I am,[3.4]but the equipment in Reactors could be how we get out of here.[6.6]It's old, but we never decommisioned it.[10]And the spillway should drop us straight down there.
Dialogue.17F223A94E106716477EDC98D9AED0F6_8C6F078: You're really going to do what I think you're going to do? [4.2]You're quite the empiricist. [7.4]But I think I'll wait for ... more ... data.
Dialogue.8F8958D543092AF654C87E8D2DA20F38_98DBDC4: You're wondering ... how I got here?[4.7]Was I forced into this ... cage?[9.2]Well, no ... and ... yes.[14.8]When Stewart found me at the clinic, he gave me a way out.[20.4]Another few months, and I would have died ...[25.2]Another few days work here, and he would have succeeded.
Dialogue.502E7AC443098ACC7D49FDBF3CF95664_9EEEEC2: Your Gatekeepers will not help you now!
Dialogue.0D3DE8EF4788213A46DB8AA7A50634C2_9EEEEC2: Your hubris blinds you - TELL ME what is the purpose of this train's perpetuity? [5.8]What disaster accrues if it halts?? Speak, Scientist!
Dialogue.84D9BD734F68CD0893C93CA51615C83E_08CBFFC: Your people would not open the way, [2.7]but they are gone, the crusaders saw to that. [6.4]So there's no-one to stop you.
Dialogue.BDC4FC7449D7C930D8F00AB8EEDE572B_F609D41: Ze soldiers, they were in disguise ...[2.86]We thought they were Groupe, until they started shooting ...[6.2]I tried to call Heystone, Brace, Leaf, nothing -[9.6]our comms were dead.
Dialogue.C4BA56AD42A83F5F6A250B88617FE871_AD7A481: [3.0]A reprieve, be grateful. [8.2]I perceive you've come far, and seek escape, from the depths, the shadow lair, where our kinds cannot co-exist ... [19.5]You are of our kith, but not our kin, and I came with a warning, which is a gift. [29]Halt here, and no worse shall befall you.

DT_AccessibilitySettings.Language_DisplayDescription: Change your desired language for menus and subtitles.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.CameraShake_DisplayDescription: Increase or reduce the amount of camera shake you experience. This includes world effects like explosion shake, but also camera movements from first-person animations.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ShortHoldInteraction_DisplayDescription: This decreases the time the key has to be held for a hold-key interaction to complete.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.LargerText_DisplayDescription: This increases the size of text on terminals and a few other places, where possible. (This will not enlarge all text at this time.)
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ToggleCrouch_DisplayDescription: This option allows Crouch to be pressed instead of held in order to activate it.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ToggleSprint_DisplayDescription: This option allows Sprint to be pressed instead of held in order to activate it.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ToggleAim_DisplayDescription: This option allows Squinting/Aiming to be pressed instead of held in order to activate it.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ToggleShield_DisplayDescription: This option allows blocking with a shield to be pressed instead of held in order to activate it.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ToggleGear_DisplayDescription: This option allows certain special activated items to be pressed instead of held in order to activate them.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.StaticInteractPrompt_DisplayDescription: This setting prevents the interaction prompt from moving around the screen or trying to stay lined up on the object.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.LoudAmbientSounds_DisplayDescription: This will allow loud ambient sounds to be randomly heard in the world. Turning this off will disable these sounds (screams, roars, etc.) but they may still play for other players in the game.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ColorblindStrength_DisplayDescription: This will determine how strong to make the colorblind filter.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.SubtitleText_DisplayDescription: This will determine the font size of subtitles. If you are having trouble reading the subtitles at their default size, increase this value.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.SubtitleBackground_DisplayDescription: This will determine the opacity of the background of subtitles. Setting this to zero will remove the background and may make subtitles more difficult to read.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.Misophonia_DisplayDescription: This will disable certain sounds from occuring, such as chewing or slupring sounds as well as some sharp or high-pitched sounds. This may not encompass all uncomfortable sounds.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.DialogSubtitles_DisplayDescription: This will display subtitles where possible, particularly focused on character dialog, but may not always encompass all potential dialog and enemy combat dialog.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.SubtitleDirection_DisplayDescription: This will show a directional arrow indicating where the source of a sound is when a subtitle appears.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.ColorblindMode_DisplayDescription: This will tint the screen to make certain colors more vivid or more distinct from one another, depending on your type of colorblindness.
DT_AccessibilitySettings.Arachnophobia_DisplayDescription: This will turn off certain spider-like elements of certain enemies.

DT_AudioSettings.PushToTalkEnabled_DisplayDescription: This determines if you have to hold down a key in order to send your voice to other players. Leaving this off will mean you have an open microphone and anything you say could be heard by other players in the game.
DT_AudioSettings.MicrophoneVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine how loud your volume is. If other players are telling you that you're too loud or too quiet, adjust this value.
DT_AudioSettings.MasterVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine overall volume of sounds in the game. This will affect every other sound effect channel, overall.
DT_AudioSettings.FootstepsVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the sound of footsteps in the game. This includes player and enemy footsteps.
DT_AudioSettings.VOIPVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the sound volume of other players microphones. If other players are generally too quiet or too loud, you'll want to adjust this slider.
DT_AudioSettings.NPCDialogVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of NPC dialog, such as when a friendly NPC is telling you a tale.
DT_AudioSettings.SFXVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of environmental and action sounds, for the most part.. Some enemy vocalizations are considered sounds and not NPC Dialog.
DT_AudioSettings.MusicVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of music. This also controls short musical stings, but will not control things like music emenating from a TV, which is controlled by the SFX Volume slider.
DT_AudioSettings.AmbientVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of non-specific ambient sounds and ambient sound loops. Sounds from specific sources are typically controlled by the SFX Volume slider.
DT_AudioSettings.PlayerDialogVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of your character and other players' characters when speaking.
DT_AudioSettings.PagerVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine the volume of yours and other player's pagers.
DT_AudioSettings.MinimizedVolume_DisplayDescription: This will determine whether or not the game continues playing audio when minimized.
DT_AudioSettings.VOIPMicrophone_DisplayDescription: This will determine which microphone you're using when speaking to other players.
DT_AudioSettings.MicrophoneLoopback_DisplayDescription: This will enable you to hear your own microphone, which may help you adjust your volume and will also probably be super annoying.

DT_BenchUpgrades.BenchTurret_DisplayDescription: A self-defense turret for your favorite bench.
DT_BenchUpgrades.ItemTransporter_DisplayDescription: Allows the bench to automatically access nearby containers when crafting recipes.
DT_BenchUpgrades.Dioxohealer_DisplayDescription: Allows the bench to passively heal nearby players. The more farmable plants nearby, the faster the healing, up to 6 plants.
DT_BenchUpgrades.MetabolicField_DisplayDescription: Hunger, Thirst, Continence, all decrease at a much slower rate in bench radius.
DT_BenchUpgrades.MatterSynthesizer_DisplayDescription: Over time the bench will fill a small container with random useful scrap and sometimes other items.
DT_BenchUpgrades.BenchWarmer_DisplayDescription: The bench will emit a cozy heat in all directions.
DT_BenchUpgrades.PortalSuppression_DisplayDescription: The bench will suppress all Portal Storms and no longer allow them to occur near it. Non-portal assaults may still occur.
DT_BenchUpgrades.TougherBench_DisplayDescription: The bench will take 30% less damage.

DT_ControlSettings.GamepadXSensitivity_DisplayDescription: This will determine the left-right looking and aiming speed of your camera when using a gamepad.
DT_ControlSettings.MouseXSensitivity_DisplayDescription: This will determine the left-right looking and aiming speed of your camera when using keyboard and mouse.
DT_ControlSettings.GamepadYSensitivity_DisplayDescription: This will determine the up-down looking and aiming speed of your camera when using a gamepad.
DT_ControlSettings.MouseYSensitivity_DisplayDescription: This will determine the up-down looking and aiming speed of your camera when using keyboard and mouse.
DT_ControlSettings.InvertYAxis_DisplayDescription: This will reverse the up-down movement of your controls. Some people prefer this because brains work in mysterious ways.

DT_Emails.Email_Rats_EmailSections_Index0_EmailTex:
ATTN: ALL STAFF
As you know, we have had a bit of a rat problem throughout Cascade and my team is working diligently to solve the problem. This was all going quite fine until we saw, quite literally, A RAT APPEARED OUT OF THIN AIR. Purple light and thunderbolts. I thought we had a gas leak for a moment but we checked the security tapes.

Look, we are perfectly capable of dealing with any rodent infestation on THIS planet, but if someone is teleporting rats in from Universe 432718 or god-knows-where, that is another matter entirely.

If anyone has further information on where these rats are coming from, PLEASE LET US KNOW. Thanks, and best of luck with your science.

- Stanley Rein, Janitorial Supervisor

P.S. We caught one of the little fellas, if anyone needs it back.
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_01_EmailSections_I: ALL of our necks are on the line, in the grandest sense. Lenora knows very well that I appreciate her work.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_BunsenBurners_EmailSections_Ind: ATTENTION: Due to an unacceptable number of bunsen burners disappearing, anyone who needs such an item must apply directly to Dr. Manse. Anyone who has any information about this, please contact me directly. We are currently conducting an investigation. Please do not try making your own. We have enough things that explode around here.
DT_Emails.email_timebomb_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: Abe, let's solve for "now," and trust that we'll have the rest of the solution some time in the next 50,000 years, shall we?
DT_Emails.email_Dam_Glowworms_EmailSections_Index1: About the glowworms? No, Daria, they're worms. They glow. That's what I notice.
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index6_Emai: Actually, yeah, it's out there, but as a hypothesis, it fits all the observable results. I just wish I knew more.
DT_Emails.Email_ExorHeart_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: After your email, I fed some to a rat. It vanished. Do you know what happened to it? It literally just disappeared.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection: Agreed. If this is another prank by the Accounting Department, I will raise hell.
DT_Emails.email_dr_jaggers_funding_EmailSections_I: Ajay, I have an enquiry about Dr. Jagger's project. He seems to have access to some rather exotic equipment, even by GATE standards. Who's funding his research? No one talked to me about it. For that matter, does he actually work for us? He doesn't appear in any employee files.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index0_E: Ajay, you asked for my assessment of 0177. I'm afraid I didn't come up with much to bank on, but I'm happy to provide you with my theories.
DT_Emails.email_artefact_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: Aliens? Monkeys? The mole-people? Who knows, not our concern. Tell Derek, let him deal with it. This is a great example of why we have Ordo storage. You could always donate it to a museum, but that might cause a bit of a stir.
DT_Emails.Email_ShadowImmurement_EmailSections_Ind: Alright, keep me posted. And Derek, I would encourage discretion and CAUTION. The GK won't appreciate your presence. You know how weird they get around entities like that.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index2_E: Alright, so we've analysed the EM recordings Rigg's team managed to gather. This thing was - definitively - transmitting information. It's pretty scrambled, but there's zero possibility these patterns are accidental. We're certain that this is a repeated phenomenon, and - I'm speculating here - there are many, many other reports across recorded history that are likely to be descriptions of this phenomenon.
DT_Emails.Email_Splints_EmailSections_Index1_Email:
Am I supposed to be impressed? That woman pushes too hard and her division doesn't know when to stop. This kinda of thing needs to be reported.

And for the record, I doubt she's picking up mystical healing from alien plants.
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index5_Emai: Am I to take it, Varsha, you think you've found a piece of a spaceship?
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection: And my fellow, I will be right behind you into the breach.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index3_E: And the theory you mentioned - where do you stand on that now?
DT_Emails.Email_AnteverseExploration_EmailSections: Any news? You've had those A2 samples for two weeks. What's the hold up?
DT_Emails.email_lostdog_EmailSections_Index2_Email: Apologies if this sounds dismissive, Hilda, but I've got better things to do than look at a painting of a weird dog.
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_EmailSections_Index1_: Are you kidding me? It was magnificent. We were looking for something to clean off that weird growth they've been struggling with in Labs. We mixed that A2 gel with some nitrate and iron and it burns through ANYTHING. It's 97% efficient oxidation!
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyComposer_EmailSections_Index0: Are you sure IS-0064 is contained in Flathill? What's to stop it leaving? I'm still waiting on your report. - T
DT_Emails.Email_Shadowgate_EmailSections_Index0_Em: As Research Director at Cascade, I have the right to inspect subjects at any GATE facility. However, I am being stalled and impeded in conducting my investigations into subjects held at our Intrados Facility. I have recieved no IS designations, or even confirmation of the exact number of subjects in their possession. The so-called contractors seem to think they operate outside the protocols of this organization, but I require access immediately.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_02_EmailSections_Index4_E: As far as I'm concerned, you're both dimweeds.
DT_Emails.Email_Garrick_Intel_EmailSections_Index0: Before we increase the range of our perforation experiments, I have to ask you one thing: where is Garrick getting her technical information? No-one I'm aware of is researching this. So how is she getting these co-ordinates?
DT_Emails.email_VoussoirSkeleton_EmailSections_Ind:
Bonjour Daria.

Apologies, we have not. The presence of IS-0134 has made any research into the skeletal remains extremely challenging. It appears to guard, even protect the remains. As to why it might do this, we are uncertain. I will alert you as soon as the situation changes.
DT_Emails.email_order_agent_EmailSections_Index1_E: Bonum est, Divinitor. Our forces are gathering, and the way is becoming clear. We have discovered a weakness your excursor may be able to exploit. Expect activation soon.
DT_Emails.email_OrderSniper_EmailSections_Index1_E: Bonum, Legate. We are positioned. The apostates and their demons will be given unto judgement.
DT_Emails.email_labs_mysteries_EmailSections_Index: But there's just moments when I've had enough. Like 0166, for example. What do we actually know? It's made of some kind of crystal, but no-one knows what sort. It's three times heavier when it's upside down, no-one knows why. And for some reason, it was hidden inside the goddamn BERLIN WALL. Surprise surprise, we have no idea how it got there.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Organization_EmailSections_Inde: Can we get some gosh dang organization down in Manufacturing? It's amazing we get anything done. I went down to see Varsha yesterday, and I was tripping over crates on every walkway, which are very much NOT up to even the basic safety standards. I know we don't answer to OSHA, but we'll be answering to Keystone if we have an accident down there.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Zomb_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: Can you think of a better word, Kathy? Or do we just pretend they're something else, like we've never watched Night of the Living Dead?
DT_Emails.Email_FH_Conspiracy_EmailSections_Index2: Confirmed. They appear to have been compiling a dossier of sorts. The exposure risk is significant, even if no one believes him.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_DarkLens_EmailSections_Index1:
Daniel, thank you, and yes I understand your concerns.

But I feel that the risks are both minor and manageable. It's not designed to be "turned off." There's no way around that.
DT_Emails.email_Boston_EmailSections_Index2_EmailT: Danise saw her too! We're not messing around. We're looking at something new here. She didn't know about the invasion. She hadn't even heard of the IS-0102 infection. Is it possible there's some kind of...  crossover? You ever hear of anything like that?
DT_Emails.email_Symph_EmailSections_Index0_EmailTe: Daria, do you have any data on IS-0407? Derek is obsessed with 0064, but I can't find anything AT ALL on this other one.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection:
Derek,
There's a project I've only recently become aware of. It's been assigned as IS-0060, but I can't find any record of who started working on it, or who's responsible for it now. None of the people named seem to have ever worked at any GATE facility I'm aware of. Yet paperwork continues to appear. Who is P. Libwell? Their name comes up a lot on the paperwork.
DT_Emails.email_NTA_EmailSections_Index0_EmailText: Derek, I need any information you have on an I.S. that looks like glowing, floating lights? A sort of will-o-the-wisp, I'm sure you know the one. It seems to react to glass or something.
DT_Emails.Email_Dam_Xray_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: Did you notice that 0023 hid at the far end of the Darkwater Cave when we were testing those new ultrawave systems?
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Bleak_EmailSections_Index1_Em: Didn't you say this place was 'breathtakingly beautiful' or something once we were assigned here?
DT_Emails.email_Dams_Order_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Divinitor, I salute your planning with this fact: we have secured the facility's Reservoir and Power Plant. We await your assent to move on to the Reactor. How progresses our bretheren in Voussoir?
DT_Emails.Email_ShadowImmurement_EmailSections_Ind: Do you have any information about the entities currently immured at Intrados? I believe the Gatekeepers are containing something unprecedented there. If the being is what I believe it to be, they are in possession of an extraordinary lifeform - although this word is barely sufficient for such a creature. Hell, even 'creature' isn't the right word.
DT_Emails.email_Boston_EmailSections_Index3_EmailT: Don't get any wild ideas. I see what you're suggesting, and I'll mention it to Inderson, but people have got bigger problems right now.
DT_Emails.Email_PowerCellLocationFlathill_EmailSec: Don't worry about it, they're high density sodium cells, good for at least a month but I'd wager longer. There's plenty of redundancy in the containment system, too. You'd have to pull out all three to reopen the Gateway. Access to the rooftops is restricted, and anyway no-one would be crazy - or stupid - enough to do that.
DT_Emails.email_shard_EmailSections_Index1_EmailTe: Dr. Hammond took it to cold storage for some low-temp work. I said it was fine. We'll catch up on the paperwork, we're on a deadline. Box-ticking stuff like PSM can wait.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Tara_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Dr. Laciter was asking about using the fluid from 121 as a power source for generating perforations. Honestly, Abeni, talking to him makes my head spin sometimes. But maybe it could work?
DT_Emails.Email_Dam_Xray_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: Either it hates high-energy EM energy, or the sight of your mug spooked it.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_DarkLens_EmailSections_Index0:
Elanor,
I've been reading through reports on your T3 experiments (I know you hate the phrase 'dark lens' but everyone else seems to call it that now). Firstly, I take my hat off to you. It is an incredible piece of work. You've managed to create a reliable targeting system for perforation portals. It's beyond anything we expected. But I'm also concerned. It seems to me that there are insufficient failsafes around it. I'm not even sure how you'd turn it off, frankly. Are we moving a bit too fast here?
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index1_E: Elanor, your theories are always welcome. Give me your thoughts.
DT_Emails.email_beliefvirus_EmailSections_Index2_E: Exactly, that's the point. It's impossible to even talk about it. The research is getting impossible.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index: Excellent, maybe we can catch the Celtics some weekend.
DT_Emails.email_tapewisp_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: Fascinating. Have you had any luck getting it to move?
DT_Emails.email_artefact_EmailSections_Index4_Emai: Fine, I'll recommend it for Ordo.... But I might ask D to keep it there for a little bit longer. It makes a nice centerpiece, don't you agree?
DT_Emails.email_Dam_Glowworms_EmailSections_Index3: Focus on 0142, Daria. They're just glow worms. Watch your head.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExor_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Folks, it's Exor. I found them, I get to name them. Manse agrees that this is a fair rule.
DT_Emails.email_MF_Coworker_EmailSections_Index4_E:
For want of a better word, yes. A creature pretending to be a rocklark. We checked on the specimens this morning. One had vanished. In its place appeared to be a member of the Research Team. I swear Daria almost let it out. It talked to us, speaking in cliches, and seemed obsessed with food. It was downright freaky.

Eventually, it produced a stapler from somewhere. We still have no idea how it did that.
DT_Emails.email_Dam_NDMonitoring_EmailSections_Ind:
Frake has signed off the monitoring station, and it's live. It should give steady results from the Neutrino Detector to anyone who can be bothered to walk up to the Waterfall Apartments.

It can only update once an hour, so if you want realtime data, you'll still have to sail out to the tower.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Synchroton_EmailSections_Index2: Frake isn't going to do anything. She makes up the rules as she goes along. This is a calamity waiting to happen (again!), and no-one seems to care.
DT_Emails.email_MF_silver_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: Fresh out. But here's the thing. There's an almost infinite amount of silver in IS-0138. That's where I've been getting it.
DT_Emails.Email_Spelling_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: Gaston, we need to be consistent here. Once and for all, are we using US or British spelling? We're dealing with superpowerful, other-worldly artifacts, and we can't even agree on a dictionary.
DT_Emails.Email_Sec_DataLeakage_EmailSections_Inde: Get her data immediately. Lock it down. Run GISP. Tell her if she talks about it with anyone else she's fired. I'll fill you in later.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Fur_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: Good news then. Its insulation value is off-the chart. You could make a jacket out of this stuff, and survive a bad night on Mt. Everest.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_SecurityLeakage_EmailSections_I:
Greetings Bridget,
I'm not sure if this is your department, but I ran a full-spectrum noise analysis on our Sector's communication network last week. I have strong evidence that there is leakage from our network, i.e. someone has gained external access. I'm happy to show you my data, or if not you, can you tell me who I should report this to?
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_02_EmailSections_I:
H, 
So we finally caught one of those dog things. KP called it a 'peccary' until she realized how large it was. I've noticed their behaviour is different here than in Anteverse II. She has a theory that the lower entropy on this side makes their biochemistry more potent. They're stronger. It certainly seems more angry.
DT_Emails.email_Boston_EmailSections_Index0_EmailT: Hanok, what's going on? I ran into a TR team member this morning - here in Boston - but didn't recognize her. I didn't even realise they were still operating. She seemed quite disoriented, and asked about the state of things 'in this anteverse'. I told her, because her clearance checked out. Am I crazy?
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: Have you had a chance to study 0052?
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Manse_EmailSections_Index1_Em: Hello Derek - we're processing your request. IS-0134 is a high-risk subject, so getting everything lined up may take a while. In the meantime, I'll send you Dr. Moreau's materials research. We hope you find them interesting.
DT_Emails.Email_NASA_probe_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Here are those images from Roamer probe - note these are classified Tier 3, and should be treated accordingly. They have no idea we have these.
DT_Emails.email_shard_EmailSections_Index0_EmailTe:
Hey Fyodor,
I was supposed to be running PSM tests on IS-0010, but ... it's not there. Did someone check the Shard out and forget to fill out the form!?
DT_Emails.Email_Office_Gibbing_EmailSections_Index: Hey Imamura, I'm looking for a gift for friend of mine who loves cooking. Any thoughts?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyCarbuncle_EmailSections_Index:
Hey Isaiah, 
How did you manage it? I've been forced to work with dead specimens.

Incidentally, autopsies suggest they're the second stage in the lifecycle of a metamorphic creature, starting with 171. I'm beginning to wonder if it's possible that all the A2 specimens are connected?
DT_Emails.Email_TimeOff_EmailSections_Index0_Email: Hey Jane. Several of the Labs team missed their alloted leave last month (due to an influx of specimens from A2). They'll be getting extended leave this month. So just a heads up Labs Sector is gonna be a little shortstaffed for a few weeks.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_02_EmailSections_Index0_E: Hey Katherine, Idris - where did you say you collected that Murkweed?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_MineTunnels_EmailSections_Index: Hey Sarah, I've got the map information you requested. I'll run you through them tomorrow, because there's areas you'll need to avoid. The TR team lost an IC in there a while back. It's been causing us trouble for months.
DT_Emails.EMail_MF_DrAdlamsGoo_EmailSections_Index: Hey Sarah, has Dr. Adlam been hassling you about his 'goo'? He won't shut up about it. I asked him for help with contact films and all he wants to do is turn them into goddamn blue glue.
DT_Emails.email_Dam_Glowworms_EmailSections_Index0:
Hey Steven,

Quick question. I was in the Dam doing some work with 0142 this week, and I noticed something.

Have the glowworms been moving? I swear they've all moved since I was here last. Have you noticed anything?
DT_Emails.email_Voussoir_Signals_EmailSections_Ind:
Hey, it's me again.

This is getting a little weird... My friend from ASO just sent me this data on the down-low. You might recall they've got that VLA just over the range from Voussoir. 

They've picked up some pretty remarkable signals recently, and some uncomfortable ones at that. We both thought it was a planet, initially.

Please check over this data and see if I've missed anything. I'm hoping I'm just being a bit paranoid. These mountains will do that to you.
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_2_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Hey, you asked me to get in touch if we found any applications for new materials. You remember that fungus Lenora's team brought back? We did some tests. This stuff makes penicillin look like tapwater.
DT_Emails.Email_Sub_EmailSections_Index1_EmailText: Hi Archie - we're moving as fast as we can. We'll be starting to assemble the prototype in the bay this week. But please be aware, it's going to be several weeks of work and testing before it's waterworthy. Until then, it's just a fancy bathtoy.
DT_Emails.email_NightRealm_EmailSections_Index0_Em:
Hi Bridget

Sorry I don't have a lot to give you. Read the full report for yourself, but the key data is:
