- We have not been able to open a stable perforation to Anteverse 39; we've had to rely on those 'created' by IS-0059.

- There were no reported manifestations of either IS-0059 or portals to A39 before our first onsite perforation experiments; Dr Shepherd's analysis indicates incidences are increasing.

- Following one such appearance, we dispatched a squad of Gatekeepers through a residual perforation under urgency. We have had no subsequent communications from that squad.

- In at least one instance, two staff exposed to the same A39 portal reported seeing entirely different details on the far side, suggesting perceptive subjectivity may be an element here.

- There are indications IS-0059 is susceptible to high energy x-rays; Dr. Tengku is investigating.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_MineTunnels_EmailSections_Index: Hi Dayton, I know this is an unusual request, but we need space to test the range of the perforation system. Have you got any maps of the old lithium tunnels east of here? We need somewhere out of the way, so it won't matter if the system does something unexpected.
DT_Emails.email_VoussoirSkeleton_EmailSections_Ind:
Hi Denis,

Have you been able to take any samples of IS-0202 yet?
DT_Emails.Email_PowerCellLocationFlathill_EmailSec: Hi Jim, what's the operating lifespan of the Flathill containment system? How long do the power cells last?
DT_Emails.email_labs_daybook_EmailSections_Index1_: Hi Kay. Just log in the daybook that you're its current target. That's all you need to do.
DT_Emails.email_labs_daybook_EmailSections_Index0_: Hi Petra. We haven't met yet, but I'm new on the IS-0091 project and wanted to check something. I'm seeing 0091 right now, should I be reporting it?
DT_Emails.email_700_EmailSections_Index0_EmailText: Hi, Stanley from janitorial. Something is very wrong with the supply closet under the Curie stairwell. I can't explain it. Can someone from CONT go check it out, please?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyPeccary_EmailSections_Index0_: Hi, you need to take this one seriously. We retrieved IS-0178 from A2 and it nearly killed us. It needs FULL Crucis containment and anyone interacting with it will need GISP-rated impact shielding at the VERY LEAST.
DT_Emails.email_lostdog_EmailSections_Index0_Email:
Hilda,
This report on 042 is gobbledygook. I only need to know one thing: was the Reubens exchange undetected? Can you confirm this?
DT_Emails.Email_SabotageDL_SubjectLineText: How do we turn it off?
DT_Emails.Email_Sub_EmailSections_Index0_EmailText: How soon until the sub is ready? We've reached the limits of research into IS-042 using scuba equipment, but there's so much more we need to know. The reservoir is DEEP.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection: I am certain none of my team are working on this. I can't even find record of who filed it as IS-0060. I'm sure we'd both remember signing off on that designation. I suggest we don't tell anyone about this until we understand more. Bring it to the next Exec Committee meet.
DT_Emails.email_labs_badtable_EmailSections_Index1: I apologize for the discomfort caused by the presence of IS-0513, but as GATE's Research Director, I remind you that we secure these things for the EXACT reason you're emailing me right now. We can't figure out what exact property is at play here, but you seem rather susceptible to its effects. In short: we all hate it, but we can't let that stop us doing our job.
DT_Emails.Email_KeypadHackerUnlockRecipe_EmailSect: I appreciate the concern for safety, Richard, but we're confident in our security procedures. Someone would have to get into the Facility to access the bots in the first place, and at the point? Bigger problems. - T
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Nirvana_EmailSections_Index0_Em: I can hear your music from here. It's REALLY loud. What on earth is that?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_SecurityLeakage_EmailSections_I: I can't access my files now.
DT_Emails.email_timebomb_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: I can't help but feel, Janet, that in the long term, there isn't anywhere sufficiently far away. This thing will, eventually, destroy our entire universe.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_DarkLens_EmailSections_Index2: I did some rough calculations. It would take only minor perturbations to throw the system into disarray. We could end up with portals popping up... well, everywhere.
DT_Emails.email_timebomb_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: I did the math too, Abe, and it seems we have 50,000 years until it's larger than our galaxy. Which, given that it cannot be destroyed or dismantled, suggests to me that we need to move this thing as far away from us as possible, as fast as we can.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_CommsMonitoring_EmailSections_I: I didn't want to raise it on the call yesterday, but you saw the security data, didn't you? We're being monitored, that much is clear. It looks like someone's been tracking a LOT of our communications.
DT_Emails.Email_ArmoredExor_EmailSections_Index2_E: I don't know if there's a limit - everything we've been learning suggests they can evolve as needed.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake2_EmailSections_Index2_Em: I don't want to put this in an email. Come see me in C Block when you get a moment. You're going to love this.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExor_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: I doubt it's a surprise to anyone but these A2 entities are pretty dangerous. We analysed the specimen you brought back. They're smart, but we can't tell if they're actually intelligent yet. Kath's running MCC tests, though it's hard. Their bio-electrical systems are off the charts. They keep frying our equipment. Also, we need an actual name for them. X-ers?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExorLifecycle_EmailSections_I: I get that. But even so, doesn't it seem a little too perfect? I've been thinking about it. There's some really weird cellular architecture, like the favorable binucleation. Extremely hard to imagine how this would have occurred naturally in such a stable form.
DT_Emails.Email_ShadowImmurement_EmailSections_Ind:
I have no direct access to Intrados or its subjects. You are aware of this.

Derek, are you trying to be deliberately obscure?
DT_Emails.Email_SabotageDL_EmailSections_Index0_Em: I have no idea if you'll ever receive this, Elanor, and I hate to say I told you so, but it appears that someone has sabotaged the Lens. The system is relocating portals at random. If you DO read this - how do we turn it off??
DT_Emails.email_labs_creepingcrystal_EmailSections: I hear you. I'll put Dayton on it. He had some ideas for improving the failsafes.
DT_Emails.email_artefact_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: I just can't believe what I'm seeing here. I've doubled checked the testing apparatus, but they're working fine. The results must be accurate. This thing looks like a piece of bad sculpture. But it's 1.2 million years old! It's made from a ceramic-metal alloy, but we only invented those in the 1940s! Who MADE this?
DT_Emails.email_labs_mysteries_EmailSections_Index: I know, I know, but just occasionally - sometimes - it can feel like we know nothing, at all, about any of this stuff around us. Then I start questioning everything. I probably just need more sleep.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: I know, but Dr. Verenkov touched it and was practically stuck to it for the next 20 minutes. Now Dina Khattar's team want to assess the effects on him, which is fair enough, but we're still no closer to discovering where on earth this came from or who made it.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection: I looked into it, and honestly, I'm baffled. It's impossible to know what is being talked about in the paperwork. Who wrote this? I wouldn't be surprised to discover this is something to do with Shadowgate. Gatekeeper accountability is a joke.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_Tier5Hacker_EmailSections_Ind: I need three photon receptors for testing, and they're telling me I don't have clearance! How can we be expected to do our jobs if you lock up basic equipment?
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Fur_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: I ran a series of stress tests on the fur samples from IS-0134. Do you want the good news first or the bad?
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_2_EmailSections_Index1_Em: I reviewed the report. You're cleared for Phase 2.
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: I reviewed the results for 0169, and I think they're correct, but I just don't see how it's possible.
DT_Emails.email_amnesiathreshold_EmailSections_Ind: I spoke to Yung about it, and she said something interesting. It makes people forget, right? She suggested it could be imprinted with something, a force we're not detecting, but embedded by an event so traumatic that it became part of the wood.
DT_Emails.email_NightRealm_EmailSections_Index2_Em:
I strongly contest Dr. Hammond's thesis and methods. He is unrigorous and I only included a summary of his notes out of respect for his work on IS-0010, etc. Drawing conclusions based on little more than mythology is unreliable in the extreme.

I would further emphasize that calling A39 a 'purgatory' or the 'latest instance of a recurrent yet chimeric underworld' is entirely without concrete evidence.

As to A39 being a 'psycho-nest' built by IS-0059 using living material 'harvested' from external regions, the man is letting his imagination run away with him.
DT_Emails.Email_February_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: I suppose that makes TWO creepy monsters lurking in our midst...
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_02_EmailSections_Inde: I think Hutton's getting sick of me going over his head to Manse, but if he can't see the problem, then he IS the problem. Leave it to me.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake_EmailSections_Index3_Ema: I think we can be fairly sure it wasn't Turkmen nomads, so that's a start.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_AnomalousProject_EmailSection: I thought about that, but it doesn't add up. Gatekeeper reports don't sound like this. And those aren't any GK staff we have on record. Are you SURE none of your staff are working on this?
DT_Emails.email_Voussoir_Signals_EmailSections_Ind: I tried... Haven't heard back for a couple weeks, but I don't want to just sit on this kind of data. It feels irresponsible to keep it to myself at this point. I'll let you know if I hear anything else.
DT_Emails.email_labs_badtable_EmailSections_Index2: I understand what you're saying Derek, but there's something very wrong with that thing. You can feel it. Frankly, I can STILL feel it.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_DarkLens_EmailSections_Index3: I understand, but if we didn't think the system was secure, we wouldn't be using it.
DT_Emails.email_labs_Ichor_EmailSections_Index2_Em: I understand. Lord, I'd hate to see their lice!
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Synchroton_EmailSections_Index0: I was coming back from the Foundry yesterday and passed an eye over the collider. They were working with the synchrotron at nearly 95% load. They're not supposed to go over 90. Don't they remember what happened in '85? The Manufacturing team seems to take no heed of safety protocols whatsoever.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyPest_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: I was talking to Dr. Tengku. She suggested the low entropy of A2 could, theoretically, encourage metamorphic lifecycles. They're more energy efficient.
DT_Emails.Email_Shadowgate_EmailSections_Index1_Em: I will enquire directly with Intrados administration, Dr. Manse, and confer with Ms. Garrick when she returns from her own research trip. You are not the first to express difficulties. Expect to hear from me shortly, but don't expect a welcome mat.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_MineTunnels_EmailSections_Index: I wouldn't use the word monster. We thought we brought back three, but there might have been four. It's a long story and it's not the easiest entity to track. We sent out a security bulletin with more information - check your inbox.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: I'd say it's more 'dim', so Dimweed. And testing suggests it's actually edible.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Train_EmailSections_Index1_Emai:
I'll deliver a full report tomorrow, but to answer your question, no, we don't know where the train actually 'is'. The star positions are the same as ours, for the location, but it's non-Newtownian. Dr. Stern believes there are two superimposed states at work, which the train's motion maintains somehow. That's a lot of suppressed energy. 

In short, if it stops, we're going to end up with a crater the size of the moon. We think, anyway.
DT_Emails.Email_February_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: I'll get Frake and her people to review the system immediately. We may need to install another tier of failsafes. Apologies for the late check-in on this, I was held up by a Keystone visitor.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Entertainment_EmailSections_Ind: I'll pass your complaint on. Don't hold your breath.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Tara_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: I'll tell him to be cautious, and use one of the smaller portal generators for his experiments. Shouldn't be a problem. He already treats the one at the top of the lift chamber like it's his own personal workshop.
DT_Emails.Email_Tier4KeypadHacker_Security_EmailSe: I'm aware of the situation, Richard, and will do my best to get it sorted shortly, but we've got a lot of staff on leave after the 59 recovery, which was your suggestion, if I recall. You'll have to excuse me if it hasn't been 'high priority'.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_BedsRecipe_EmailSections_Index0: I'm concerned some of your people have been working extra hours, and not returning to the Residence Sector each evening. I've been hearing some of them have built BEDS down there.
DT_Emails.email_artefact_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: I'm looking at the results of the radiocarbon tests and I just had to ask - is there any chance 172 was contaminated during its recovery?
DT_Emails.email_beliefvirus_EmailSections_Index0_E: I'm not sure how to handle this. I wanted to send a note to all staff working with IS-0093, but ... well ... you know the problem.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_Tier5Hacker_EmailSections_Ind:
I'm sorry Isaiah, but all the receptors I had available are being used.

We had a few lying around but someone up the chain has decided they're a security risk. Something about their optics being a threat to our high-tier security systems - beats me.

I'll try and get you some, if I can, but between Rutger and Dr. Mayfield it's like talking to paranoid androids.
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_01_EmailSections_I: I've been analysing the fluctuations from the last perforation with Suan. It's like there's energy entering the system from somewhere else.
DT_Emails.Email_Dust_EmailSections_Index0_EmailTex: I've been meaning to request a sample of the 'dust' from IS-0139, but I wasn't sure who to ask. Did you have some on hand or do I need to file an excursion request?
DT_Emails.email_yellowpaint_EmailSections_Index0_E: I've been putting this "yellow paint" investigation on the back burner for months now, but Manse asked about it, so I better do something. You did the preliminary assessment. Anything I should know?
DT_Emails.email_labs_Ichor_EmailSections_Index0_Em: I've been reviewing research on IS-023 and 121. We don't really know how big they're going to get. The Tarasque, as you called it, just seems to keep growing. I feel like we're really going to need to see some other specimens from A42 if we're going to make progress here.
DT_Emails.Email_BuildCraftingBench_EmailSections_I: I've been trying to put a personal project together, but I think I need some help.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExor_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: I've clarified this before: A2 is NOT "Planet X", it's not even JUST a planet. I don't know why this nickname is still sticking around.
DT_Emails.email_tapewisp_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: I've completed my analysis of the IS-0235. It appears to subsist on high contrast magnetic recordings. Copying the tape reproduces the entity, but any changes in the original are replicated in the copy. This leads me to believe they are essentially the same entity. In informational terms, they are identical.
DT_Emails.email_sundisk_EmailSections_Index0_Email: I've decided which one it is.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Lockdown_EmailSections_Index0: I've just seen the new security protocols. They make a lot of sense, but between you and me, are you concerned about the general staff reaction?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemySecurityBots_EmailSections_In: I've mentioned this before, but your "security" bots are a menace. They don't seem to distinguish employees AT ALL, and whose idea was it to get them to restock the soda machines?? I understand the goal, but there's a TON of valuable equipment in those things, which would have been a lot more useful elsewhere.
DT_Emails.email_700_EmailSections_Index3_EmailText: INBOX AUTO-RESPONDER: Mr. Rein is on medical leave until further notice. Please send all janitorial inquiries to Mr. Beckett.
DT_Emails.Email_February_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: Idris told me that IS-0091 escaped containment again this morning. I need to know exactly what happened.
DT_Emails.email_MF_Coworker_EmailSections_Index1_E: Idris, I'm not an expert. I wouldn't know if one was acting weirdly. They're fairly strange to begin with. What's the problem?
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Zomb_EmailSections_Index4_Ema: If you do that to me again in the restroom I swear I will shoot you with 099. This project is fraying my nerves enough as it is.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Bleak_EmailSections_Index3_Em: If you're feeling trapped in Voussoir, you'd hate Cascade - it's 200m underground.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index:
Indeed, the Furniture Store isn't located in our universe... or at least not our exact time period... I don't know.

We do know it's in Boston though!
DT_Emails.email_Symph_EmailSections_Index2_EmailTe: Injured, intact. How can you tell with these things? But I know what I saw, and it wasn't 64. It looked like someone smashed a doll.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: Interesting. But it's called Murkweed, because the water's so murky.
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_02_EmailSections_I: Interesting. Certainly the energy differential is strongly in our favour. But I wouldn't jump to conclusions. We don't know enough.
DT_Emails.email_amnesiathreshold_EmailSections_Ind: Is there any evidence for this? Or is it another one of her 'feelings'?
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Kizz_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Is this kind of obsession one of the side-affects when drinking KIZZ?
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_History_EmailSections_Index0_:
Isaiah,
Thank you for the tour of sector improvements last week, but I'm left with serious concerns. The hydrodam was built 30 years ago to meet the needs of the original mining company. We're pushing the structure to its limits, but can't let the demands of the Research Team force us beyond what's safe for the system. You remember 1985.
DT_Emails.email_MF_silver_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Isaiah, I'm looking at Elanor's specs for the T3. We need to extend the subwavelength limit of the lens, which takes a lot of silver for surfacing - have you still got a stockpile?
DT_Emails.Email_ArmoredExor_EmailSections_Index4_E: It fits the data, that's all I'm saying.
DT_Emails.email_Dam_Glowworms_EmailSections_Index2: It looks like they've bunched up. I'm almost sure of it. I wish I'd take some pictures to compare.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_BedsRecipe_EmailSections_Index2: It needs to stop, Sarah. The security bots don't have an 'employee' setting.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Nirvana_EmailSections_Index4_Em: It sounds like someone singing with a mouth full of ballbearings.
DT_Emails.Email_Dam_Xray_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: It was definitely the x-rays. Who could say no to this face?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyComposer_EmailSections_Index3: It'll be in my report, but I'm afraid you're going to be disappointed. They're 'part' of the fog phenomena, but we lost any chance to explore their origins once we installed the containment system. They may actually generate the 'fog', but last time I suggested researching it, you said I was blowing smoke, remember?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Organization_EmailSections_Inde: It's a work in progress. Just try to just keep your tie from getting stuck in one of the machines, okay?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_ScienceWriting_EmailSections_In: It's a work in progress. Remember, sometimes the only difference between science and screwing around is writing it down.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExorLifecycle_EmailSections_I: It's complicated, but so are we. Their evolution must be selecting for a variable we haven't considered yet.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_02_EmailSections_Index3_E:
It's dimly lit. You can barely see it down there in the water.

It's dim. It's a weed.

Dimweed.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Fur_EmailSections_Index4_Emai: Its ignition point is far lower than cotton's and the flame spread on this thing's Class C.
DT_Emails.email_timebomb_EmailSections_Index0_Emai:
JANET,
I've got some interesting news about IS-0107. Well, perhaps that's not the right word. Maybe the phrase is "distantly terrifying." You see, Janet, it's growing. Not much, about 0.1% per year, but it's a geometric progression. I haven't done the exact mathematics yet, but in about 15,000 years it will be the size of the Earth, which could be inconvenient. Particularly given that it appears to be - conventionally - indestructible.
DT_Emails.email_dr_jaggers_funding_EmailSections_I: Jagger knows what he's doing, Michael, and he's extremely useful. That's all I can tell you right now, I'm afraid. But he's a nice guy.
DT_Emails.email_labs_creepingcrystal_EmailSections:
James,
It happened again. The intake got clogged on the 94 processor and it just stopped. I checked in the morning and the cell was knee-deep in crystals. We've GOT to make sure this doesn't happen.
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_1_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Jane, what's this I'm hearing about an investigation into our security? Has anyone spoken to you about it?
DT_Emails.Email_ArmoredExor_EmailSections_Index1_E: Jesus, how many more of these things are there?
DT_Emails.Email_PowerCells_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Jim, I'm concerned we haven't field tested the power cells sufficiently. I told Enderson about them. He's worried we're 'relying on salt' to keep Flathill in check.
DT_Emails.Email_ThisDamnFacility_EmailSections_Ind: Just keep an eye on your wristwatch. Don't start a task you can't finish before the facility power goes out. Why the hell were you working at midnight anyway!? Get some rest, we can't afford to make mistakes. - T
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_EmailSections_Index0_Emai:
Kath

I've been looking at this plant from the Reservoir, the Dimweed. The most remarkable thing about it is that it seems to grow at such low light levels, though I suppose we shouldn't discount the illumination from IS-0142.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyCarbuncle_EmailSections_Index: Kathy, I'm glad to report we've finally made some progress with 173. The little bouncing fellow. We couldn't get near it at first. The thing wouldn't sit still, not to mention the spikes.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyPest_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Kathy, after studying IS-0173's internal structure, I'm coming round to your theory. It shows clear morphic continuity with IS-0171. I agree, we're looking at a more complicated lifecycle than we thought.
DT_Emails.Email_KH3_Pens_EmailSections_Index0_Emai:
Last Wednesday I needed to substitute an optical component so I 'borrowed' one of the AV gems they're studying in the Adjustment Wing. Someone who I won't name suggested I get liquid crystal from one of those broken CRT monitors they use in the Labs - and it worked!

... Until Moyer heard about it and got worked up. He said I was 'misusing company property' or some nonsense like that.
DT_Emails.EMAIL_Order_Pens_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Legate, are your bretheren prepared? Our operative is in place and can remove the Dark Lens when ready. He awaits only the signal.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Train_EmailSections_Index0_Emai:
Lenora,
I hear you're back. Very interested to hear your report on the Engine. Are we any closer to figuring out where it is?
DT_Emails.email_MF_Coworker_EmailSections_Index0_E:
Lenora,
We had some issues with the specimens you brought back from A24. Was there anything unusual about the rocklarks? Did you notice any strange behaviours?
DT_Emails.email_NTA_EmailSections_Index2_EmailText: Let me know if that changes, but don't mention this to anyone.
DT_Emails.Email_FH_Conspiracy_EmailSections_Index4: Limited. The resident is an outlier from the community, and regarded as something of a screwball. I believe we have scope.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_BedsRecipe_EmailSections_Index1: Look Richard, if they sometimes work a little extra, it's because they want to and a project needs it. A lot of this stuff, you can't just walk away at 6pm.
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_1_EmailSections_Index3_Em: Look, Manse is great at theorizing, but sometimes he lets his imagination run away with the facts. It's all speculation at this point, we haven't detected anything beyond a few probing actions. Our data is secure. Let them know it's under control - because it is.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Kizz_EmailSections_Index4_Ema: Look, Petra, I think we've been clear about this, or as clear as we can about Jura-level subjects. It has 'decided' it lives there. We destroyed an entire hallway, and it just moved to a new one. If we demolish every office-like hallway in Australia, it would probably just turn up in New Zealand! The safest course is to let it stay where it is, educate people on its effects, and discourage use.
DT_Emails.Email_Garrick_Intel_EmailSections_Index1: Look, this is her show. All of it. And we've all got questions. That's our job. But don't expect an answer to that one. No-one knows where she gets her deep end data. My guess? The Contractors.
DT_Emails.Email_EmergencyProtocolsOffice_EmailSect: MESSAGE TO ALL STAFF: In the event of an emergency, proceed to the nearest SECURITY KIOSK immediately. Security staff will arrange for transport to Sector 4, where you will be able to exit the facility. The results of last week's emergency drills were dismal. Shut your station down and walk out. There are only three projects worth dying over, and most of us aren't working on those. If it had been a real crisis, I hate to think what would have happened.
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_1_EmailSections_Index2_Em: Manse suggested the Executive Committee thinks someone may be monitoring our data network. I thought that was impossible. The farm needs to know about this, we're the ones who work with the data day-in and day-out.
DT_Emails.email_NIghtEssence_EmailSections_Index0_:
Marta

We need this sample assessed URGENTLY. 

IS-0059 appeared while we were testing Varsha's x-ray system, and it accidentally strayed into the beam. It dropped this material I've sent to your lab.

It seems to be emitting blackbody radiation, but I need more data. Please be extremely careful.
DT_Emails.email_leyakessence_EmailSections_Index0_: Marta, I'm doing some work on high energy EM emitters for Frake, and need more of that material produced by 091. Do you have a supply?
DT_Emails.email_artefact_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: Marta, if there was, I would have told you. It would have been in my report. What's the issue here?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Synchroton_EmailSections_Index3: Maybe it seems like that from the outside, but Frake knows what she's doing. There is oversight, it's just not YOUR style of oversight.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemySecurityBots_EmailSections_In: Moira, why are you telling me this? I am not in charge of security OR procurement. If you're serious, try Enderson. He O.K.'d the Wakeman project and I have never had any problems with the bots. I stay out of the halls when we shut down for the night - like you're supposed to. Let them do their job. We're making valuable strides here.
DT_Emails.Email_Dust_EmailSections_Index1_EmailTex: No need, I've got some. I'll have Tang send it over this afternoon.
DT_Emails.Email_ShadowImmurement_EmailSections_Ind:
No, apologies. I just have very little information. Getting data from that facility is like pulling teeth. However, I'm working on it.

In fact, if I have my way, I'll be visiting there shortly.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Nirvana_EmailSections_Index3_Em: No, the album's called Nevermind. It's amazing.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake2_EmailSections_Index1_Em: No, what you need to tell me is that you've found a way to emulate it.
DT_Emails.Email_February_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: No-one knew it was missing for almost half an hour - the creature's invisible to most people. We chased it down with x-ray lamps, and it almost got Dr. Tang. Peters thinks the x-ray system had a brown out, but we're not sure. You're in charge of containment processes, you tell me.
DT_Emails.email_MF_inquisitor_EmailSections_Index1: Non, Legate. After Lazone, his technical order are sadly reduced. We must preserve their numbers, and trust we can reveal to him, with diligence, the virtue of our cause. He cannot, at any rate, escape without your help.
DT_Emails.email_sundisk_EmailSections_Index12_Emai: Not in our lifetime it doesn't.
DT_Emails.email_tapewisp_EmailSections_Index4_Emai: Not so far. It's modes of movement remain uncertain. I've even tried shifting the show to black-and-white, but that just seemed to make it sick. I can't risk damaging such a unique entity.
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index4_Emai: Not yet - but this is different. If you push it, it just moves until it hits something. Zero friction, zero inertia. It's a piece of something, I'm sure of it. Some kind of vehicle?
DT_Emails.email_labs_daybook_EmailSections_Index2_: Oh great, now I'm never gonna relax.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyExorLifecycle_EmailSections_I: Okay, I'm certain: 184 is the final stage of the life cycle. It starts as 171, which metamorphizes into the little hoppers. That then gestates in those hyper-elastic pupal pods I showed you... Or sleeps in them? I don't know yet. Anyway, then it emerges as 178, then grows into the adult, for lack of a better word. It just happens a lot faster here than it does in A2, as we're seeing.
DT_Emails.email_timebomb_EmailSections_Index4_Emai: Okay, but in 50,000 years we get to do my plan -- Plan B.
DT_Emails.email_order_agent_EmailSections_Index0_E: Praetor, we have at last secured an excursor in their facility. They will abide as long as required, and act swiftly when directed. We await your instruction.
DT_Emails.email_MF_inquisitor_EmailSections_Index0: Praetor, we have lost one of our Inquisitors to doubt. Their fear of the facility's demons drove them to abandon their post. Shall we commence annulment?
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_1_EmailSections_Index1_Em: Relax, Richard. It doesn't concern anyone in your sector. It's the Labs team. You know how they are - always scared someone's leaking information.
DT_Emails.Email_AnteverseExploration_EmailSections:
Right, I'm taking the tablets too. The suit keeps most of it off though. 

As for your gateway problem, tell Sergei. That's what he's there for. Please copy me on me any updates.
DT_Emails.email_labs_creepingcrystal_EmailSections: Roger. I'll check in with Wakeman, too. No idea what he's doing with the stuff, but I'll tell him to expect a plus-size load this afternoon. We'll beef up monitoring too.
DT_Emails.email_Labs_Greyeb_EmailSections_Index0_E:
Ru, I just got handed an R-3 for something called "Greyeb seeds". 

You know anything about this?
DT_Emails.email_lostdog_EmailSections_Index1_Email:
Rutger,
It's all in there if you look. We gained access to the MDP, replaced the item and removed the original. The security was laughable and certainly nothing Lenora couldn't handle. The work is in our possession, they're oblivious. Weird dog aside, it's actually a very impressive piece. You should drop by Containment and take a look sometime. I'd love to show it to you.
DT_Emails.Email_Sec_DataLeakage_EmailSections_Inde: Rutger, I got a report from one of the data analysts on Moyer's team. She claims she's detected some kind of 'leakage' in our data network. Could be worth looking into. I'm concerned someone may be trying to monitor our communications.
DT_Emails.email_Sec_Targets_EmailSections_Index0_E: Rutger, I was at the Security range on Tuesday, and I couldn't help noticing something that the targets on the gun range all have labcoats. Why is that, exactly?
DT_Emails.Email_Splints_EmailSections_Index3_Email: Seeing a lot of e-mailing from a man behind on his quota.
DT_Emails.EMAIL_Order_Pens_EmailSections_Index1_Em: Sic Divinitor. But we must be aware, removing the device will destabilize the system. It is not without risk.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Sir, we've run into a serious issue with IS-0014. Its temporal distortion increases the closer we get, meaning that as soon as our instruments touch it, they stop working. There's no way to take a sample.
DT_Emails.Email_Random_IsWrestlingReal_EmailSectio: So do you think WWF wrestling is real? Or are they just acting? I don't get it. Why would everyone cheer if it was fake?
DT_Emails.email_amnesiathreshold_EmailSections_Ind: So it's from a ship? What else?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyComposer_EmailSections_Index2: So we've got a new Mozart on our hands? I need more than that, Hilda. - T
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Fur_EmailSections_Index5_Emai: So you could live through an ice age, so long as you stay away from naked flames? Fascinating.
DT_Emails.Email_Dust_EmailSections_Index3_EmailTex: So, did you get it under a microscope?
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_2_EmailSections_Index2_Em: Someone needs to go back in there. We need more samples.
DT_Emails.email_labs_mysteries_EmailSections_Index: Sometimes, I get tired of the mysteries, you know?
DT_Emails.Email_AnteverseExploration_EmailSections:
Sorry Lenora, yes, we think the intensity of the radiation over there is due to high entropy levels. Energy just dissipates faster. We're giving everyone iodine tablets to counteract the radiation from expeditions.

But there's a problem I can't figure out. The numbers don't add up. Even with the higher entropic quotient, there's excess energy coming through the Gateways.
DT_Emails.email_gravitydampener_EmailSections_Inde:
Sorry, Fyodor, you asked for this abstract on 0052 a week ago, but getting 0107 out of here took every minute! Anyway, here's the data on the cube:

- Located: Anteverse VIII, Feb 1989
- Classification: Relativistic device
- Effect: Reduces local gravitation
- Operation: (We're just guessing here) some kind of permeable graviton membrane.

We've done our best to look into this thing, but we just don't have the tools. No-one's sure what the 'right' tools are yet. Anteverse VIII is ... well ... you know it's like.
DT_Emails.Email_RepairAnvils_EmailSections_Index1_: Sorry, that was us. Check the supply closet on Level 3 by the Silo. We were doing some heavy repairs up there, and needed solid working surfaces.
DT_Emails.email_700_EmailSections_Index2_EmailText: Stanley, when did this start? That was unbearable. Has anyone else noted this? Come see me immediately, I will need a full list of persons who have access to that room. This must be a side-affect from a nearby IS. This should have been reported sooner.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index: Sure, just watch out for the rabid fans.
DT_Emails.Email_Splints_EmailSections_Index2_Email: Sure, sure, just don't tell her I said anything. She's the last person round here I want to piss off. Next to you, that is.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Taxonomy_EmailSections_Index0:
TO ALL CONTAINMENT STAFF

This is the third time this quarter I've found staff setting up containment incorrectly. I'm sure I don't have to emphasize how dangerous this is. Please make sure you are following the correct protocols for each and every subject - there is NO room for mistakes here. Ensure you are familiar with the procedure for the following tiers:

JURA: Unassessable

SOLUTUS: Uncontainable

THELA: Extreme Risk

CRUCIS: High risk

SANC: Known and controlled

ORDO: Benign

If you are so much as seeing these words on signs around you, you are in a place where knowing these by heart could potentially save your life, not to mention the lives of those around you. Our safety - perhaps even the safety of the world - depends on your basic understanding of this system. Let's get it right, people.

- T. Enderson
DT_Emails.email_Sec_VIPs_EmailSections_Index0_Emai:
TO: DEFENSE TEAM

Ensure LARGE SURFACE ELEVATOR is clear in advance of Executive Committee arrival tomorrow morning.

No Defense Team activity in the area between 11:00am-12:00pm.

All urgent transit between those times should take place via TR facilities.
DT_Emails.email_OrderSniper_EmailSections_Index0_E: Take a squad of your fratres and seek alta terra. Arrange yourselves for undique coverage, but we do not expect sustained threats from the water. You have full authority to free souls.
DT_Emails.email_Murkweed_02_EmailSections_Index2_E: Take it up with Katherine, she said she calls it Murkweed, and you know... she's our lead botanist, so...
DT_Emails.email_Labs_Greyeb_EmailSections_Index3_E: Tengku's got some new teleporter, beams samples direct from the Flesh Dimension.
DT_Emails.KeyPad_Hacker_2_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Thank goodness someone improved door security in this sector. The Office's system is a joke.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index5_E: Thanks - I'll need to put this in front of the Exec, so one more question: If you had to guess - I won't hold you to it - have you drawn any conclusions as to the origin of these perforations?
DT_Emails.email_Dam_NDMonitoring_EmailSections_Ind: Thanks Greyson. If there's any issues, I'll shout. But this look great.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_SecurityLeakage_EmailSections_I: Thanks Moira - good work. We'll take it from here.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_Receptors_EmailSections_Index: Thanks for the feedback, and noted. In the meantime, the Reservoir conditions are horrific. The receptors would work a whole lot better in clean water. Tell us if you want us to prototype a large-scale water purification system.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Synchroton_EmailSections_Index1: Thanks for the note, Richard. I will pass your concerns to Frake.
DT_Emails.Email_Dust_EmailSections_Index2_EmailTex: Thanks! Received. This is fascinating. The way it glimmers constantly is mesmerizing. Haven't gotten it under a microscope yet, but I will soon.
DT_Emails.email_labs_creepingcrystal_EmailSections: Thanks, can you make it quick? I did some rough calcs. If this happens, and we don't notice for more than 36 hours, the facility's going to have a SERIOUS problem. It WILL breach other cells.
DT_Emails.Email_RepairAnvils_EmailSections_Index2_: That certainly explains the noise complaints. Please let us know before-hand next time.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Kizz_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: That would be Dr. Stern. He's been using the decal printer in the labs. He's a big fan of the drink.
DT_Emails.email_labs_Ichor_EmailSections_Index1_Em: That's Gatekeeper territory, Hilda - I've assisted on GK TR missions, but A42 isn't somewhere I go unless I absolutely have to.
DT_Emails.email_labs_mysteries_EmailSections_Index: That's why we're here, that's the science we're doing.
DT_Emails.Email_Tutorial_2_EmailSections_Index3_Em: The Silo 2 systems are online. I think another venture should be fine. I'll talk to TR. They're itching to get back in there.
DT_Emails.email_yellowpaint_EmailSections_Index2_E: The TR team's notes make no sense either. They found it up cliffs, on the edge of buildings, even underwater. Their current theory is it's leading to something, but what? We've wasted how many hours following these trails, for what? I ran composition tests. It's just PAINT.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_ImmurementDesignations_EmailS: The arguments around immurement designations were getting totally out of hand with constant mixups between I.C. and I.S. So I've made a decision with the approval of Keystone. All subjects are now to be referred to as Immurement Subjects (I.S.) in all scenarios. Please make sure you update all internal documentation. I've also sent around a memo to the other relevant facilities (incl. Leaf and Haunch.) The painters are re-labelling the affected cells on Monday.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Lockdown_EmailSections_Index1: The bottom line is that in the event of a serious containment failure, everything shuts down. EVERYTHING. We'd be negligent if we did it any other way. There's too much at stake. But there's a reason the protocols are only available to Red tier and above. There's no point telling people they'll be trapped. It would just set them on-edge, and there's nothing they can do about it. Chances are they'll never experience a lockdown like that anyway.
DT_Emails.email_labs_badtable_EmailSections_Index3: The effect should fade - try to think about something else in the meantime. I've forwarded you some of our trainee reference for breaking soft c-hazard links. It should fade quickly given you're all the way in NYC.
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_EmailSections_Index2_: The entropy delta is extraordinary. I visited the test chamber above the Megalift, it's incredible. I can't believe he works without protective gear. He also noted some spores were taking root... We need to keep an eye on that.
DT_Emails.Email_Order_ControlCenter_EmailSections_:
The facility's Control Center is ours.

Be aware, their legions are not without resources, and the victory came at a cost. A quorum of our bretheren were martyred against one of GATE's heavy condottieri, that which wielded some manner of dark protection. Thankfully, these paganites have not penetrated this area in large numbers and have retreated to the Keep.

The way is barred. We investigate every passage. Time will reveal unto us the way.
DT_Emails.Email_KH3_Pens_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: The guy's paranoid. He'd be furious if he knew how much jerry-rigged stuff keeps his A/C running down here.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Bleak_EmailSections_Index2_Em: The honeymoon phase is OVER. I'm tired of hot chocolates. This place is a prison - just ask IS-0134. I'm applying for a transfer to Tori, or maybe Cascade.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Tara_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: The instantaneous energy from the 'ichor' is beyond anything we've ever seen. It operates on an entirely different scale. Unsurprising, I suppose, given 0121's origins. So yes, I believe there is value in using the fluid to open portals, but he has to be EXTREMELY careful. If something went wrong, it would go VERY wrong.
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_01_EmailSections_I: The only reason you have data is because Lenora went and got it. Don't forget whose neck is really on the line here.
DT_Emails.Email_ThisDamnFacility_EmailSections_Ind: The power sockets are on a timer!? I was working on mass dampeners and the place just SHUT DOWN. You know those have to warm up for hours - now I have to start all over again!
DT_Emails.Email_Tier4KeypadHacker_Security_EmailSe:
The state of the Security Sector's storage section is a serious problem.

Some of our most high tech gear, components, and cryptographic equipment, just piled up everywhere. Anyone could just walk in, grab something, and do anything they wanted. Can we at least shut it behind some doors?
DT_Emails.Email_Order_Snowbeast_EmailSections_Inde: The success of your operation is almost complete. Alert us when you have secured the beast's domain.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_CommsMonitoring_EmailSections_I: Then why are you using this email system? I'll discuss it with you in person, or not at all.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_ScienceWriting_EmailSections_In:
Theo,
I asked for your research on IS-0028 and I received a box of random notes, papers and photographs. What am I supposed to do with this?
DT_Emails.email_leyakessence_EmailSections_Index1_:
There may be a delay on that, Varsha. The 091 produces the "essence" you're describing when you bombard it with x-rays while it's roaming. Unfortunately, it tends to disappear shortly afterwards. As you can imagine, this creates containment problems.

We can either coax it to produce, or keep it contained, but we haven't yet figured out a way to do both. Working on it.
DT_Emails.Email_Tier4KeypadHacker_Security_EmailSe: There's a lot of stuff in those crates that I would call extremely 'high priority.' Consider reassessing your priorities.
DT_Emails.email_labs_daybook_EmailSections_Index3_: There's nothing to worry about. It's contained, and it'll switch soon enough.
DT_Emails.email_labs_mysteries_EmailSections_Index: There's reasons for all of these things, even if we don't know them yet.
DT_Emails.EMAIL_Order_Pens_EmailSections_Index2_Em: These are circumstances when chaos only aids our goals, I assure you. Remember Lazone.
DT_Emails.email_Dams_Order_EmailSections_Index1_Em: They report success, and will soon have access to the Snowbeast's domain. Once this is secured, they intend to use the prometheans' portals to make contact with your force. You will be informed.
DT_Emails.Email_Office_Gibbing_EmailSections_Index: They want to be a chef? Give them a knife. Until you chop it up, you can't cook it.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_SecurityLeakage_EmailSections_I: They're not your files, Moira, they're GATE's files. Do not discuss this with anyone without authorization.
DT_Emails.Email_PowerCells_EmailSections_Index1_Em: They've BEEN tested - containment systems, weaponry, even some of the personal transport prototypes. And please, they're sodium-based accumulators derived from our research into A2, not 'salt'. The fuel cells are not the issue here, if you get my drift...
DT_Emails.email_Sec_Targets_EmailSections_Index1_E: This falls into the 'I'll do my job, you do yours' category, Richard.
DT_Emails.Email_Crossbow_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: This is a notice to all Cascade technical staff. We have received some complaints from team members about misuse of office supplies, up to and including creating improvised weapons for flinging projectiles across the cubicles. We here at GATE understand and commend your ingenuity as scientists -- after all, it's why you work here. But if you want to continue working in this department, knock it off. - R.M.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Manse_EmailSections_Index0_Em: This is an official request for access to study IS-0134. I require access to its immurement location, any existing research, all relevant safety systems, and contractor support if/as required.
DT_Emails.email_NIghtEssence_EmailSections_Index1_: This is incredible. Thank you, Suan. I'll get back to you as as soon as I can.
DT_Emails.email_Voussoir_Signals_EmailSections_Ind: This is quite peculiar. I don't think you're being paranoid, no. Did you meet up with this "friend"?
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Kizz_EmailSections_Index3_Ema: This kind of obsession is one of the side-affects of being Dr. Stern. If you didn't want people to drink it, you shouldn't have left it in the hallway.
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_EmailSections_Index0_: This new region of Anteverse 2 that Dr. Laciter opened up - Lenora says it's completely different to the first. It's intensely hot, for one thing. And have you seen that gel she brought back?
DT_Emails.email_earworm_EmailSections_Index0_Email: To all research staff: due to the difficulty in containing IS-0078 and it's highly infective nature, all research on this subject is suspended in the interests of staff safety. Please do not mention or attempt to describe this subject to any other staff member. Do not hum, sing or whistle an impression of IS-0078. Thank you for your cooperation.
DT_Emails.Email_ZombiesContainment_EmailSections_I: To all staff working on the A16 viral programme: You are NOT to enter the research area unarmed. Whether you're undertaking virological study here at Cascade, working in A16 itself, or doing field research on its unfortunate outbreak in A23, you must carry self-defense equipment at ALL TIMES.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Manse_EmailSections_Index3_Em: To say that studying the creature is a 'challenge' would be an exceptional understatement. You'll see soon enough. Assuming your request is approved.
DT_Emails.Email_BuildCraftingBench_EmailSections_I: To start with, have you got a place to work? If you're building or making anything, you NEED a solid work bench and power. I can show you how to set one up tomorrow morning.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Bleak_EmailSections_Index0_Em: Ugh, it's so bleak, cold and depressing here. Can't you convince one of the higher ups to let me build a garden or something?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyCarbuncle_EmailSections_Index:
Very interesting theory.

I mentioned the problem I was having to Varsha in Manufacturing. She went away and rigged up a kind of trap that holds the little critters in place.
DT_Emails.email_MF_silver_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Wait, you've been raiding the Train for silver? Are you insane?
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyComposer_EmailSections_Index1: We can't be perfectly certain, but everything we're seeing suggests it's localized to Flathill. It seems erratic to us, but we've noticed some patterns. It seems to compose melodies of sorts. Report's coming - I've been busy.
DT_Emails.email_sundisk_EmailSections_Index7_Email: We don't actually know where that one is.
DT_Emails.email_Boston_EmailSections_Index1_EmailT: We don't have any TR on active deployment. I mean, have you seen what's happening out there? Don't beat yourself up, but yeah, sounds like the stress is getting to you.
DT_Emails.email_NTA_EmailSections_Index1_EmailText: We don't have anything in containment like that, Bridget. I spoke to Dr. Riggs about it, and she hasn't encountered anything like that either.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index: We don't know either. It feels like our two systems are operating on completely different principles.
DT_Emails.email_damnoise_EmailSections_Index1_Emai: We don't know. It's halfway between us and we only hear it at random intervals.
DT_Emails.email_amnesiathreshold_EmailSections_Ind: We got the mass-spectrography results back on IS-0017. It's teak from India, around Pondicherry apparently. But it's heavily permeated with salt, likely from the North Atlantic, suggesting it was used in maritime building.
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_02_EmailSections_Inde: We had another webbing infestation in Anning last week. I put a request in for more of that gel from Anteverse B. It's the only stuff that can get rid of it. But Lenora and her TR team have been in Anteverse 3 since Tuesday, so it might be a while.
DT_Emails.Email_FH_Conspiracy_EmailSections_Index5: We have dispatched contractors to resolve the matter. Hygiene protocols apply.
DT_Emails.email_tapewisp_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: We have no idea how it arrived in that specific Simpsons episode, but it seems to have disappeared from previous locations (e.g. Flintstones Season 2, Episode 32). This leads us to believe that 0235 is the same, continuous entity throughout all sightings.
DT_Emails.Email_FH_Conspiracy_EmailSections_Index0: We have reason to believe one of the Flathill residents is investigating our office structure. He's been turned away by security twice.
DT_Emails.email_yellowpaint_EmailSections_Index1_E: We have zero idea who leaves it there. We've got a dozen more samples at Rise, and credible reports on at least thirty more - which makes the absence of even a SINGLE lead all the weirder.
DT_Emails.Email_KeypadHackerUnlockRecipe_EmailSect: We may have an issue in Offices - the new security bots are walking security holes. I just learned from Mayfield they carry access data everywhere they go. Anyone who gets their hands on a CPU from one of the Security Bots could hack through any door in this sector.
DT_Emails.Email_Antethermite_02_EmailSections_Inde: We need to raise the priority on that. That webbing grows way too fast. In another couple of days, we're gonna have a problem on our hands.
DT_Emails.email_700_EmailSections_Index1_EmailText: We never go in there. I'll take a look, but I'll need to get some keys first.
DT_Emails.email_sundisk_EmailSections_Index10_Emai: We sent out a message - an actual physical invitation - asking intelligent E.T. to contact us, but then when they DID actually reply those bastards intercepted it. Just stole the whole message somehow. No-one can prove they did it, but everyone's too scared to admit it happened because of how bad it makes them look. It's the perfect crime, except they're not just screwing over the entire human race. They're screwing another race of creatures we've never even met yet. Worse, the rumour is that it's made of stellar matter, so even if we did get our hands on it, we couldn't read it.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index6_E: We tried matching decay signatures. It wasn't exact, but I'd say there's a significant probability that this one was coming from A2.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Zomb_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: We're calling them zombies? Seriously? Isn't that a bit... cliche?
DT_Emails.email_MF_Coworker_EmailSections_Index2_E: We're fairly certain one of them wasn't a rocklark at all. We're not really sure what it is. Some kind of emulator, able to adopt different appearances.
DT_Emails.Email_ExorHeart_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: We're looking into it. Our leading theory is biological entanglement. I'll keep you posted.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index: We're trying to compare your readings from Anteverse XVI with our research on IS-0138. Our goal is to figure out why test subjects often emerge from portals close to the original entry point. It's convenient, I suppose, but damned confusing.
DT_Emails.Email_ArmoredExor_EmailSections_Index0_E: We've discovered a new variant of IS-0184. It seems to be quite a bit heavier, sporting some kind of carapace shell, or something even harder. It's essentially the same morphology otherwise. Attached a pic of the sighting.
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_01_EmailSections_I: We've discussed the parameters, Sasha. They're within bounds. That's why we run tests: to figure out what's happening over there. The housing is shielding properly, so you'll have to define what you're seeing.
DT_Emails.email_beliefvirus_EmailSections_Index3_E: We've established protocols. So long as no-one's informed, they're safe. Not talking about it is the point. Let alone vaccinating people. Rejdák knew what he was doing. Be patient. It may be slow, but it's worth the caution. Imagine what would happen if this thing got loose.
DT_Emails.email_Symph_EmailSections_Index1_EmailTe: We've got almost nothing on 407. There's your Flathill report, and that's it. Are you even sure it's a different entity? Could it just have been injured?
DT_Emails.email_NightRealm_EmailSections_Index1_Em: We've seen this thing nearly half a dozen times, it just APPEARS in the facility at leisure now, and that's all we know?! Dr. Hammond seems to have a much better handle on the situation than you do.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_Receptors_EmailSections_Index: We've started installing the photon receptors in the neutrino detector. Excellent work from your fabrication team, Sarah. We're very impressed. But we're going to need a LOT more.
DT_Emails.email_furniturestore_EmailSections_Index: Well they are different universes... we think.
DT_Emails.Email_TimeOff_EmailSections_Index1_Email: Well, I guess there's not much we can do about that. They'll need to provide an itinerary, communication schedule, and take a tracker with them and keep it on them at all times. Remind them what happened to Rickman. All usual restrictions apply.
DT_Emails.email_amnesiathreshold_EmailSections_Ind: Well, maybe "interesting" is the wrong word, but it's the only theory we've got right now. We've dealt with weirder concepts.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_ImmurementDesignations_EmailS: Well, that is your prerogative. Hopefully this won't cause any of our research to get lost in the shuffle.
DT_Emails.KeyPad_Hacker_2_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Well, what can I say? It's not perfect, but at least she's made it harder to snoop. Manufacturing has always been the leakiest of the bunch.
DT_Emails.Email_PeccarySausageRecipeUnlock_EmailSe: Went to a 'barbeque' on the Dam in the Hydroplant last night. Those bue-suits can party. They had these great sausages. One of the hydrologists made them. Said they were actually really easy.
DT_Emails.Email_ExorHeart_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Were you working on the Exor dissection? You need to be extremely careful. The heart has some strange properties. Whatever you do, don't INGEST it.
DT_Emails.email_damnoise_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: What do you mean "we don't know?" This could be a structural concern.
DT_Emails.Email_RepairAnvils_EmailSections_Index0_: What happened to the anvils in our workshop? I needed it to repair some of my tools, but it's gone.
DT_Emails.email_damnoise_EmailSections_Index0_Emai: What's that sound coming from under the dam? Did you guys start up some new machinery I'm not aware of?
DT_Emails.email_MF_silver_EmailSections_Index3_Ema: What's the problem? It grows back.
DT_Emails.email_fragment_EmailSections_Index2_Emai: Where do I start? The material is immensely strong. Nothing we've got can break it. It's some kind of phosphorous alloy, according to spectrography. But it weighs nothing. It's like it's not even there. No space time presence at all. Almost as though it's only partly in this dimension.
DT_Emails.email_labs_badtable_EmailSections_Index0: While visiting Cascade last week, I was given a tour of the primary containment chamber. Let me be very clear: things like IS-0513 should not be stored at ANY of our facilities. I'll talk to Keystone if this doesn't change. I want it GONE.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Entertainment_EmailSections_Ind: Who do we talk to about getting some entertainment down here? There's nothing on the TV except Saved By the Bell. And it's not even this season!
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Kizz_EmailSections_Index0_Ema: Who keeps putting these KIZZ COLA stickers all over the place?
DT_Emails.email_timebrake_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: With respect, Daniel, it's your job to find a way around this.
DT_Emails.Email_Dust_EmailSections_Index5_EmailTex: Yeah, Tang had the same reaction.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_Receptors_EmailSections_Index: Yeah, there's complications there around IS-0142 - no-one's quite sure how altering the Reservoir's water content would affect it. It's sub-optimal. Not a pun.
DT_Emails.email_Labs_Greyeb_EmailSections_Index1_E: Yeah, they're new. Looks like they've got hyper-autonomic properties. I told Manse you'd be the best one to investigate them.
DT_Emails.EMail_MF_DrAdlamsGoo_EmailSections_Index: Yeah. Look, Adlam's a materials genius, but he's got some quirks. That expanding adhesive he's working on could come in useful though. Be nice to him.
DT_Emails.email_damnoise_EmailSections_Index3_Emai: Yeah. Maybe. Look, I don't really want to talk about it over e-mail. I'll come up to your office.
DT_Emails.Email_EnemyPest_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Yes! That would also explain why ANYTHING from A2 proliferates so rapidly here: there's so much more available energy. Their metabolic rates must skyrocket.
DT_Emails.email_perforation_EmailSections_Index4_E: Yes, I believe it's a perforation. Another group or entity is attempting to create gateways into our world, just as we are from this end. I think they've been trying for a long time, and we must assume they have had some success. If I'm right, then we have a problem. The kind you'll probably want to involve our "contractors" in. I'll send through my report shortly.
DT_Emails.Email_Labs_Zomb_EmailSections_Index2_Ema: Yes, it would make me feel better about the whole situation.
DT_Emails.email_timebrake2_EmailSections_Index0_Em: You asked for an update on 0014. We've started calling it the Time Brake, because frankly, that's what it is. Bear with me. If my assessment is correct, it's a device for low mass temporal distortion. Whoever created this found a way to induce near-singularity intensity distortions of local spacetime at close to zero density. I'm sure I don't have to tell you what this means.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_Nirvana_EmailSections_Index2_Em: You don't have to be rude.
DT_Emails.Email_RollerbladeUnlockRecipe_EmailSecti: You know what would be really useful around here? Rollerblades. I'd get around so much quicker.
You'd break your neck, Moyer would kick your ass, I'd laugh in your face.
DT_Emails.Email_Splints_EmailSections_Index0_Email: You'll get a kick out of this. I was talking to Lenora the other day. She fractured her leg 'on the other side', and had no med support, so she made a splint from a bandage, some wood and tape, and just kept working! She's been walking around on it already too - real fast healing. Maybe it's the Anteverse, huh?
DT_Emails.Demo_email_Background_02_EmailSections_I: You're behind the times. Apparently the team on Level 3 has figured out a way to use the differential in their new Power Cell design. Catch Mayfield at lunch sometime, she will talk your ear off about it.
DT_Emails.email_sundisk_EmailSections_Index9_Email: You're gonna have to spell that one out for me.
DT_Emails.Email_MF_MineTunnels_EmailSections_Index: You're kidding me. You've got a monster roaming my tunnels?
DT_Emails.Email_ArmoredExor_EmailSections_Index3_E: You're suggesting something like 'evolution on demand'? How could that even be possible?
DT_Emails.Email_MF_ScienceWriting_EmailSections_In: You're talking about a sub-dimension that is, to all intents and purposes, an infinite collection of notes. So I sent you everything I had.
DT_Emails.Email_Dams_History_EmailSections_Index1_: You're welcome, Sarah. Of course I remember the accident, but we've done a LOT of risk assessment since then, and if something goes wrong in the Dam, four separate systems kick in. In my judgement, we're covered.
DT_Emails.Email_Alps_Manse_EmailSections_Index2_Em: You've had 134 for almost 2 years, and this is everything you've got?
DT_Emails.KeyPad_Hacker_2_EmailSections_Index1_Ema: You've made your feelings clear. FYI, Frake pushed for upgrades, given some of the equipment her people are working with, and they also supplied the tech.
DT_Emails.email_NightRealm_GK_EmailSections_Index1: intrusion     endless and unholy           reviled for                       night
DT_Emails.email_NightRealm_GK_EmailSections_Index0: this erupted has         contagion               entire     blackness engulf

DT_Emotes.Yawn_EmoteSubtext: A display of boredom or exhaustion.
DT_Emotes.Dance_Gate_EmoteSubtext: A quirky dance of GATE scientists.
DT_Emotes.Cheer_EmoteSubtext: Throw your arms in the air to celebrate!
DT_Emotes.Pager_EmoteSubtext: Use your pager to signal your location to others.

DT_GameplaySettings.MouseSmoothing_DisplayDescription: If enabled, looking and aiming with the mouse will have some smoothing applied to it.
DT_GameplaySettings.ShowHomeWaypoints_DisplayDescription: If true, this option will show the nearest Crafting Bench waypoint. (Quest waypoints can be adjusted in the Player Journal.)
DT_GameplaySettings.AnalyticsEnabled_DisplayDescription: Opt-in to send anonymous (non-identifying) gameplay data to the help the developers improve the game.
DT_GameplaySettings.FieldOfView_DisplayDescription: Set the default horizontal field of view of your camera.
DT_GameplaySettings.DisableThirdPersonEmotes_DisplayDescript: Setting this option to true will result in emotes remaining in the first person camera and may make it more difficult to tell when you're performing an emote.
DT_GameplaySettings.TemperatureCelsius_DisplayDescription: Show temperatures in Celsius instead of the default Fahrenheit.
DT_GameplaySettings.InventoryBlur_DisplayDescription: This slider will adjust how blurry the background is for the inventory. Lowering this may increase performance and improve visibility while in your inventory, but may make text more difficult to read.
DT_GameplaySettings.ShowHardwareCursor_DisplayDescription: Use a hardware cursor instead of software cursor. If you are experiencing sluggish cursor movement, this will change it to be more responsive, but may reduce some visual functionality or effects.
DT_GameplaySettings.Use24Hour_DisplayDescription: When available, clocks (such as the player wristwatch) will appear using 24 hour time instead of 12 hour time.
DT_GameplaySettings.DurabilityCrosshair_DisplayDescription: When low on durability, a bar will temporarily pop up near your crosshair showing your item's low durability state.
DT_GameplaySettings.EnableBloodSplatters_DisplayDescription: When possible, reduce the number of blood splatter in the environment. This will not always remove every case of blood or blood splatter, and is not retroactive.

DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_t3_DisabledItemTooltip: BIO-FUSION LOCK: This weapon seems to have some kind of arcane security system installed. (Requires Biofusion Armwraps)
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_DisabledItemTooltipTex: BIO-METRIC LOCK: This weapon seems to have some kind of basic security system installed. (Requires Biometric Armwraps)
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_t2_DisabledItemTooltip: BIO-MIMIC LOCK: This weapon seems to have some kind of advanced security system installed. (Requires Biomimic Armwraps)
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_heavymeleeweapon_DisabledItemToo: HEAVY WEAPON: You aren't strong enough to use this weapon effectively.
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_milspec_DisabledItemTooltipText: MIL-SPEC: This weapon feels far too dangerous in your scrawny hands. (Requires Accuracy 10)
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_PopupText: Something is preventing the weapon from firing.
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_t2_PopupText: Something is preventing the weapon from firing.
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_biometric_t3_PopupText: Something is preventing the weapon from firing.
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_brokenbone_PopupText_SecondaryUs: Target doesn't have any broken bones.
DT_ItemUseFlags.useflag_milspec_PopupText: You aren't confident enough to use this item.

DT_JournalEntries.Labs_AbeandJanet_Note: Abe and Janet's security clearance has been revoked. They need access to equipment in Containment Block, where they used to work, apparently, although I'm not exactly sure what they're planning ...
DT_JournalEntries.VignettesReset_Note: According to Dr. Arendt, portal destinations reset back to the same moment after a certain period ... temporal tethering?
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Warren_Silos_Note: According to Warren, some scientists ignored him and went to the Silos on Level 3, rather than Manufacturing.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_Blacksmith_00_Note: According to the Blacksmith, I should head for the Surface Tunnel. But first I need to hack through the Security doors near his workshop. He can also trade items if I bring him materials. Could be useful.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Antethermite_Note: According to the researchers, there is a material in Anteverse II B that can burn through the webbing that has overrun the vacuum chamber door.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Tengku_Note: Alice Hong came out of Security Sector, and locked the blast door behind her. Something in there scared the living daylights out of her. There's no way through from this side... Perhaps that's for the best.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_LeyakEssence_Note: Apparently IS-0091 - the Leyak - produces a unique substance when exposed to high energy x-rays ...
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Anvils_Note: Apparently there are anvils in a supply room on Level 3.
DT_JournalEntries.Pens_KH3_Note: Apparently, Pens and the Adjustment Wing both have high tech materials that could be useful. I should search carefully for these.
DT_JournalEntries.LABS_Containment_RT_01_Note: Apparently, portals tend to ground their entries near their exits. I may be able to use them to find "shortcuts" through the facility ... Could be what I need to get to the Control Center? It's certainly worth a shot.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Bridges_Note: Cahn thinks I should explore Helmholtz wing, but first I need to find a way across the chasm, without getting shot by those turrets.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Cahn_02_Note:
Dr. Cahn believes he can get us to the Surface Elevator in Security Sector, but first I need to retrieve a substance from the Mycofields in Anteverse 2, which removes the webbing on the Vacuum Chamber door.

Apparently there may be a portal in Dr. Laciter's test chamber, wherever that is.

It's better than no plan at all, I suppose.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Cahn_Containment_Note:
Dr. Cahn locked himself in a containment cell for protection, and now he's stuck. He's certain he can get through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator, if I can get him out of there.

So I need to find a way to the Control Center, then reset the security system ... How hard could it be?
DT_JournalEntries.Security_Cahn_Entry_Note: Dr. Cahn said something about 'unimaginable creatures', then told me to find a way to the Surface Elevator in the center of this Sector.
DT_JournalEntries.SECURITY_Cahn_02_Note: Dr. Cahn thinks we can access the Hydroplant if we drain the water from the cave. Sounds reasonable.
DT_JournalEntries.Alps_Dupont_Note: Dr. Dupont believes there may be a portal in the Yeti containment zone, wherever that is ... but attempting to reach it would be extremely dangerous.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Neutrino_Detector_Note: Dr. Hoff says there could be a portal inside the neutrino detector ... and a way out of here ... unfortunately the entrance is underwater, and I don't have gills.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Dr_Jager_Craftingbench_Note: Dr. Jager thinks I may need to set up somewhere to get to work, if I want to fix this door for him.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Elanor_DL_Note: Dr. Newman says the invaders removed the Dark Lens, unleashing portal chaos on the facility.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Petra_Tarasque_Note: Dr. Peters is the only survivor of the team that trapped the Tarasque in Containment. She says its fluids are powerful enough to sustain an entire portal network, but getting them ... is another question
DT_JournalEntries.Dam_Quercy_Note: Dr. Quercy is clearly upset ... and speaking French ... She  seems to be saying something about Voussoir facility? I wish I understood her better, it could be important ...
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Dr_Regal_Note: Dr. Regal says his power cells have all been taken to Silo 3.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_DrShepherd_Note: Dr. Shepherd clearly has no interest in walking all the way through Manufacturing to get out of here.
DT_JournalEntries.Dam_Tang_Note: Dr. Tang believes there is equipment in Reactors and myriad connections to other parts of the facility ... technology that could assist us, and secret routes that may offer a way out of here ...
DT_JournalEntries.Dam_Tang_02_Note: Dr. Tang suggested that we could reactivate the Central Transmitter by devising a piece of equipment to shield it from the radiation surge that's interfering with it.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Thule_Vents_Note: Dr. Thule refuses to crawl through vents to let Dr. Jager into the cafeteria.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Thule_Note: Dr. Thule wants to get through the Vacuum Chamber to the Surface Elevator in Security Sector, but the door is covered in some weird alien goo. He thinks there's tools in the Containment Block to help remove it ... but first, we'd have to find a way past the security systems.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_PipeColours_Note: Frake told her people to follow the colored pipes through Manufacturing - red, yellow, green - that lead to the broken electron pumps.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_Frake_01_Note:
Frake's team is working with the Blacksmith to make replacement parts for the electron pumps, so they can overload the synchrotron and blow a hole into the next sector.

Once they've got the parts, Frake told her people to follow the colored pipes through Manufacturing - red, yellow, green - that lead to the broken electron pumps.
DT_JournalEntries.Intro_OrdoContainment_Note: GATE operates several tiers of containment protocols. The lowest is 'Ordo', indicating an item, artefact or entity is deemed benign or low risk and requires only basic precautions. There are several tiers above this, but I'll need a higher security clearance than 'Blue' to learn about them.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_Hank_Note: Hank's trying to stop a chemical meltdown, but he says I should get out of here, and find my way to the Surface Tunnel.
DT_JournalEntries.Flathill_Marion_Note: I don't know whether to trust them, but the freak in Flathill thinks I can 'open a way' out by removing power cells from three 'devices' ...
DT_JournalEntries.Dam_Witch_Note: I encountered the Gatekeeper again, speaking in riddles. It seems I can go no further for now, beyond this 'boundary of dust' ...
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Witch_Note: I just met a Gatekeeper. She told me that beyond lay darkness ... and depths where we 'could not co-exist' ... What on earth is she trying to warn me about ... ?
DT_JournalEntries.SecurityBots_Note: I need to be careful of the security bots. Apparently, damaging their pods can activate them.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Dr_Roberts_Note: If Dr. Roberts is right, there are power cells in the Silos on Level 3.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_NetworkTransmitter_Note:
If I want to bring the Central Network Transmitter back online, it's on top of H Building somewhere, according to Isaiah. Something is interfering with the signal. I need to find a way to restore it.

Apparently the flow control module's up there too ...

Alright.
DT_JournalEntries.GoToLevel2Security2_Note: If I want to get out of here, I need to get help from the Security staff
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_SpillwayComputer_Note: If I want to reboot the Spillway Computer, it's somewhere in the Waterfall Apartments, over the bridge past ... the waterfall.
DT_JournalEntries.Bed_Note: If I'm going to be here much longer, I need somewhere to sleep. Perhaps I should make a bed?
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Elanor_Note:
If I'm going to open the Spillway's flow control and get out of here, I need to reactivate three devices:

> Reboot Spillway Computer
> Unlock the Flow Valves
> Bring the Central Network Transmitter back online
DT_JournalEntries.BuildCraftingBench_Note: If I'm going to survive this, I need a place to work.
DT_JournalEntries.Crucible_Note: If the crucible were to accidentally spill, it could do huge damage to the Foundry
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_PowerSystem_Note: Isaiah says the first thing we should do is reset the Dam power system after the quakes triggered a shutdown.
DT_JournalEntries.Thule_Note: It doesn't seem like Dr. Thule is going to help Dr. Jager, who's waiting at the cafeteria door.
DT_JournalEntries.Assaults_Note: It seems as though my base isn't quite as secure as I thought, as though I could be attacked at any time. Probably best to put up some proper defenses.
DT_JournalEntries.Labs_Tarasque_Ichor_Note: It sounds like Dr. Laciter, whoever that is, was looking for a way to open portals using Tarasque blood? I wonder if he succeeded ...
DT_JournalEntries.Sec_REaperEssence_Note: It sounds like IS-0059 produces an unusual material when struck with certain kinds of high energy EM radiation.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Megalight_Note: It sounds like there's an aquatic subject, IS-0023, that REALLY doesn't like x-ray radiation ...
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Abe_Containment_Note: It's possible that when we escaped Flathill, we let the Composers out too. Not ideal.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_Janet_Guns_Note: Janet may have lost the plot, but she's right about one thing: we need GUNS to get out of here.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Jonas_Gatekeepers_Note:
Jonas, a member of the Defense Team, says that the Gatekeepers abandoned his team to defend the Dam alone, and pushed on towards Reactors.

He's not sure what's so important for them down in Reactors, but they don't sound like the types to answer questions.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Kylie_Note:
Kylie, whoever she was, seems to have had her brain installed into a machine, and now that Wakeman is gone, she's trapped in there.

She believes that if I can repair the neural-bridge, she may be able to 'upload' into some kind of hardware.

How hard could it be?
DT_JournalEntries.KeyPadHacker2_Note: Looks like security doors in this sector could be vulnerable to hacking. Apparently the CPUs from Security Bots contain security data ...
DT_JournalEntries.MF_MinionRadRoom_Note: Looks like the engineer in the materials processing plant is going down with the ship, but he was clear: I need to head through the mines for the surface tunnel.
DT_JournalEntries.Intro_GATEPal_Note: My GATEPal stores useful data and communications. Assuming it works like the ones at Springer Facility, it'll be locked to my security clearance, so it only provides data for sectors I've got access to.
DT_JournalEntries.BuildCraftingBench2_Note: Not much I can do without setting up a crafting area of some kind.
DT_JournalEntries.Sec_SurfaceElevator_Note: Now the Surface Elevator is out of action, Dr. Ahmed wants to search for equipment that could get us through the Security Doors ...
DT_JournalEntries.Intro_PowerSockets_Note: One of the first things GATE did when it bought this ex-Lithium mine in 1977 was install a completely new power and electrical system. Due to safety regulations, it only operates during daylight hours.
DT_JournalEntries.IntrO_Security_Note: Sounds like someone in the Research Division is conducting an investigation into security at Cascade.
DT_JournalEntries.NATOProblems_Note: Sounds like someone powerful has wanted to shut the Cascade Facility down for quite some time.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_Blacksmith_01_Note:
The Blacksmith can make the parts we need to fix the electron pumps, but he wants to trade some materials:

-- DIODE -- trade for GREASE
-- FIBREOPTIC CABLE -- trade for SOLDER (melt SILVER and METAL SCRAP in a soup pot with water)
-- OPTIC LENS -- trade for REINFORCED HOSE

The Blacksmith also heard that a portal has opened in the Tram station. He gave me specs for a 'Tram Key' to open the station, so I can investigate the portal, which may lead to useful materials.
DT_JournalEntries.Dams_Jonas_Note:
The Defense Team officer, Jonas, thinks there could be survivors of the Order attack in the Electrical Station.

If anyone knows this sector, it's going to be them.
DT_JournalEntries.FindFrake_Note: The Engineer holed up in the crane said the soldiers have set up a beachhead at the Crossroads. Maybe I should find a way around them ... through the Garages?
DT_JournalEntries.MF_CraneGuy_Note: The Engineer holed up in the crane said the soldiers have set up a beachhead at the Crossroads. Maybe I should find a way around them ... through the Garages?
DT_JournalEntries.GruntOutsideFlathill_Note: The dying soldier said opening portals is a bad idea. Then he died.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_VentMinionJulia_Note: The engineer, Julia, says that someone called 'Frake' has a plan to get out of here, and it involves ... the Blacksmith, apparently.
DT_JournalEntries.GetThroughMines_Note: The engineer, Kovak, talked about spies and sects?! I don't know what to believe, but he said the Surface Tunnel is the way out - if I can disable the security doors somehow.
DT_JournalEntries.MF_Frake_Minion_2_Note: The engineer, Kovak, talked about spies and sects?! I don't know what to believe, but he said the Surface Tunnel is the way out - if I can disable the security doors somehow.
DT_JournalEntries.GoToLevel2Security_Note: The facility PA told me to evacuate, but first I need to get out of the Cafeteria.
DT_JournalEntries.Office_No_Power_At_Night_Note: The facility's power and lights turn off at night. I'm going to need to find a way to deal with that.
DT_JournalEntries.MetWarren_Note: The plaza security guard, Warren, says we have to evacuate via the main tunnel in Manufacturing Sector, on Level 2.
