ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_e_ItemDescription: It vaguely tastes like berry, and you're not really sure which kind.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemDescription: It's a pizza, probably better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_split_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it, and something else.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pea_ItemDescription: It's a soup with peas in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_burnt_ItemFlavorText: It's enough to make a GATE scientist cry.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_ItemFlavorText: It's more than a cookie, it's a monument to humanity's refusal to perish in the darkness without a murmur.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemFlavorText: Like a bearhug in your mouth.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_raw_ItemFlavorText: Like so many chowders before it, a dish that hopefully tastes better than it looks.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_heartystew_ItemDescription: Many ingredients were cooked together, qualifying this as a stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_mre_ItemDescription: Military standard-issue meal ready to eat.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_burnt_ItemDescription: More char than there is pizza.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesewheel_raw_ItemFlavorText: Now you just gotta brie patient.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_veggiestew_raw_ItemDescription: Once cooked, this should be a healthful veggie stew.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_pasta_homey_raw_ItemDescription: Pasta from beyond tastes better cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemFlavorText: Peas, pests, potatoes - who could resist this most nourishing of pies?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_burnt_ItemDescription: Pekkie Brekkie Hash that is very, very burnt.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_PestPotPie_ItemDescription: Pest pie packed with potato and peas - perfection.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.tentacle98_ItemDescription: Pseudopodia that tastes as good as it smells.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_hash_raw_ItemDescription: Raw eggs, cheese, sausage and potato, kinda.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_englishbreakfast_ItemDescription: Sausage and eggs are a classic, no matter their origin.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_rotten_ItemDescription: Some very expired food, probably left uneaten for too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheese_ItemFlavorText: Someone had time to make cheese, but not ask certain ontological questions.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.coffee_cold_ItemFlavorText: Someone left it alone a bit too long.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_random_ItemDescription: Soup is a strong word for this mixture of water and... whatever else someone threw in here.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemFlavorText: Still has a bit of hoof in it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_candy_ItemFlavorText: Sugar is a major food group, right?
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pizza_carb_raw_ItemFlavorText: Thankfully, the standards for what counts as a pizza have been widened lately.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exor_arm_ItemDescription: The arm of an extraordinary Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_radfish_burnt_ItemDescription: The burnt filet of an extremely hardy fish.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_sandwich_toastie_burnt_ItemDescript: The charred remains of an Antecheese Toastie.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_cooked_ItemDescription: The cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_sniper_skull_ItemDescription: The cowled head of a fanatic.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cake_ItemFlavorText: The fact that someone managed to bake this is an achievement that ennobles the entire human race.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_greyeb_ItemDescription: The fruit seems to emit trace amounts of electromagnetic radiation. It’s not enough to be harmful, but might attract unwanted attention.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_symph_skull_ItemDescription: The head of a menacing fog entity.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_peccmush_ItemFlavorText: The most shocking thing about this is how bad it isn't.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_yeti_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a defeated Yeti.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_red_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Peccary Alpha.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_tarasque_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a felled Tarasque.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_sow_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary Sow.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pecmushroom_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary with a peculiar fungal affliction.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_skull_ItemDescription: The skull of a slain Peccary.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_exorheart_cooked_ItemDescription: The slightly cooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_greyebchowder_ItemFlavorText: The taste better be worth it.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pest_tail_burnt_ItemDescription: The torched rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_body_ItemDescription: The uncooked head of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_exorheart_ItemDescription: The uncooked heart of an Exor.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_peccary_leg_ItemDescription: The uncooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_pest_tail_ItemDescription: The uncooked rump of a Pest.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_peccary_leg_burnt_ItemDescription: The way over-cooked leg of an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_d_ItemDescription: There's nothing funny about the Fizz.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cookies_gum_raw_ItemDescription: These cookies show promise, even uncooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.gib_human_skull_ItemFlavorText: They probably don't need it anymore.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_creamyfish_raw_ItemDescription: This combo of fish and fungi may well be passingly edible when cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_antefish_burnt_ItemDescription: This filet of Antefish is post-cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.filet_radfish_raw_ItemDescription: This fish may glow less when cooked.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_uncooked_toxic_ItemDescription: This is an uncooked mess of things that ought not be eaten.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soda_c_ItemDescription: This soda tastes like licorice, or something worse.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.icecream_melted_ItemDescription: This was once a happy treat, and is now a sad slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_cheesepuffs_ItemFlavorText: Those farm-to-table cheese puffs, just like Mama used to make.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_mashedpotatoes_raw_ItemDescription: Uncooked, but promising a taste of home.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_potatosausage_raw_ItemDescription: What it says on the can.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_poop_ItemDescription: What on earth are you thinking?!
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_fishglue_raw_ItemDescription: When cooked this will make a serviceable adhesive.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_carbdumplings_raw_ItemDescription: When cooked, this may actually be edible.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_meatpie_slice_ItemFlavorText: Whoever concocted this pie felt the need to feed their friends, and was willing to stop at nothing.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_sugarslop_raw_ItemDescription: Wih care this may turn into barely acceptable slop.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_risotto_ItemDescription: Xanterium Rice, Peccary, and IS-0098, together at last.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_lethal_ItemDescription: You do NOT want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.soup_toxic_ItemDescription: You do not want to drink this.
ItemTable_FoodAndGibs.food_pestpotato_raw_ItemFlavorText: You're the one who made it.

ItemTable_Gear.trinket_nightpass_ItemDescription: A GATE-authorized pass, handy for safely traveling the halls of the Facility during after-hours.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_jetpack_ItemDescription: A backpack that allows for increased flight by jumping twice.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_security_ItemDescription: A backpack worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_beret_ItemDescription: A beret worn by what appear to be the squad leaders. It features some sort of rune on the front.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_forge_ItemDescription: A better-than-basic pair of protective arm wraps.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_cushions_ItemDescription: A big chestplate made from cloth, tape and stuffing.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_puffycoat_ItemDescription: A big puffy coat with the warmth and figure of a campfire marshmallow. Made from natural insulating fibers and a little dash of science by way of thermal insulation.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_labs_ItemDescription: A chitinous set of arm protectors, built from slain beasts and bit of scientific engineering.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_rook_ItemFlavorText: A close, but not quite perfect imitation of iconic Groupe armor, also offering some warmth.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medmask_ItemDescription: A cloth medical mask usually worn by doctors.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_geigercounter_ItemDescription: A compact device that detects radiation in the immediate area.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_forge_ItemDescription: A decent attempt at actual head protection.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_rebreather_ItemDescription: A diving suit with a rebreather for extended underwater journeys.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hardhat_ItemDescription: A durable helmet to protect warehouse workers.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_goggles_swim_ItemDescription: A facial apparatus for seeing clearly underwater, but not useful for much else.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemDescription: A fancy hat cobbled accordingly from the carcass of a contemptible carbuncle.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_santahat_ItemDescription: A festive hat from a jolly man who has no respect for the laws of physics.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_hydrohat_ItemDescription: A hardy helmet to protect hydroplant workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_makeshift_ItemDescription: A hastily constructed piece of body armor.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemDescription: A hazardous environment suit adorned with odd markings. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_bunnyears_ItemDescription: A headband for a time of year whose celebration is completely optional at all GATE facilities except for Springer.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_t2_ItemDescription: A heavy laboratory vest used to block harmful radiation.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemDescription: A heavy lead vest typically used to block harmful x-rays.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_night_ItemDescription: A helmet bearing the Sigil of the Night.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_peccary_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a cantankerous creature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_pecc_alpha_ItemDescription: A helmet made from a rare, red Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_yeti_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head an abominable creature.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mushroom_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a fungal fiend.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_sow_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of a purple Peccary.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemDescription: A helmet made from the head of an enormous microbe.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings and iron bars laid across the face shield.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_military_ItemDescription: A helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_composer_ItemDescription: A helmet sewn together from paper and padding, with the melodious qualities of a cardboard box.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_mountaineer_ItemDescription: A helmet worn by alps-ascending assailants.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_foglantern_ItemDescription: A humming lantern that seems to react when in the presence of lingering water vapor.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_hikingpack_ItemDescription: A large hiking backpack with special attributes.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_large_ItemDescription: A large research pack, for transporting samples from other worlds.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemDescription: A large, heavy pack that does absolutely nothing for its wearer's spine or posture.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_medic_ItemDescription: A medic helmet of military make, adorned with strange markings.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_radio_ItemDescription: A military backpack with some electronics attached.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_default_ItemDescription: A mounted headlamp capable of deftly replacing any handheld flashlight.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_petrock_ItemDescription: A painted rock with googly eyes.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_snowgloves_ItemDescription: A pair of gloves sure to keep anyone warm in the most frigid conditions, when paired with other warm clothing, that is.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_makeshift_ItemDescription: A passable excuse for a helmet.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_composer_ItemDescription: A scrappy leg armor made from pieces of much taller beings.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_white_ItemDescription: A small anomalous gem that constantly emits a white light.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_purple_ItemDescription: A small crystalline shard that emits an odd purple light.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_red_ItemDescription: A small device that emits a red glow.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_yellow_ItemDescription: A small photon emitter converted into a warm lantern.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_spuddy_ItemDescription: A small potato with a chain on it.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_light_orange_ItemDescription: A small tube that emits a comfy orange glow.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_floppy_ItemDescription: A snug hat to keep even the coldest scientist toasty and warm.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_huge_ItemDescription: A strange backpack with huge storage capacity.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_labs_ItemDescription: A strong chestplate built from the shells of insects and a few other things.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_weldingmask_ItemDescription: A strong helmet to prevent welders from receiving injuries.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tech_ItemDescription: A strong high-tech helm with a premium visor, provided there's enough of the system present.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_labs_ItemDescription: A sturdy helmet built from some lab equipment and alien carapace.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemDescription: A sturdy porcelain clads these arm wrappings.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_order_ItemDescription: A symbol worn by the most fanatical members of The Order, keepers of the oldest traditions. Activates in combat.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemDescriptio: A very heavy apron used by blacksmiths.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_makeshift_ItemDescription: A very small backpack made from cloth scraps.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_gasmask_ItemDescription: An airtight mask often used by those working with dangerous chemicals.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_snow_ItemDescription: An arctic pack with a spicy splash of camo.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_security_ItemDescription: An armored vest worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_security_starter_ItemDescrip: An armored vest worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_ItemDescription: An extremely dense data storage device, allegedly containing the translated digital consciousness of Kylie Muir.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cowl_ItemDescription: An ornate hood with a pointed crest, worn by marksmen of old, devoted traditions.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemDescription: An oval hat no doubt created by a scientist who has truly lost their marbles.
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_gravitycube_ItemDescription: An unusual cube that makes people feel a little lighter than normal...
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_leather_ItemFlavorText: Apparently blacksmiths still exist. Who knew?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_luckyhat_ItemDescription: As lucky as it is quirky.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_groupe_ItemDescription: As warm as they are heavy, these padded leggings are sure to keep you toasty.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_composer_ItemDescription: Chest protection made to mimic the inhabitants of Anteverse I, with a few creative liberties.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemDescription: Cobbled together by ingenuity, and a bit of hope, these legs will allow the wearer to move faster and land harder.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_highvisvest_ItemDescription: For those who like being seen.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_yeti_ItemFlavorText: GATE researchers at the Voussoir Facility had been studying this rare cryptid for almost half a decade. It's even rarer now.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cqc_ItemDescription: Heavy duty head protection for combat and coldness.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_rook_ItemDescription: Heavy-duty head protection from a highly aggressive attacker.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_huge_ItemFlavorText: It's probably safe to reach in there.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_crystal_ItemDescription: Jagged and reflective armor created from curious dust.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_tech_ItemDescription: Leg armor made from strong metal alloys and a heap of science.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_labs_ItemDescription: Leg protection built from the backs of many foes with some laboratory scrap holding it all together.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_apron_ItemFlavorText: Let's shed some light on the subject.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_crystal_ItemDescription: Light but protective crystalline arm protection.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_crystal_ItemDescription: Lightweight head armor crafted from the crystalline remains of IS-0139.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_crystal_ItemFlavorText: Little is known about IS-0139, but this body armor created from its remains has some unique optical properties.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_purple_ItemDescription: Long purple gloves, typically worn by those handling precious objects.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_karate_ItemDescription: Makes getting punched in the head suck slightly less.
ItemTable_Gear.headlamp_NVG_ItemDescription: Monocular night vision made from various scientific gadgetry. Not the highest quality, but it'll light up even the darkest corners.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_tarasque_ItemFlavorText: Nothing that small should ever be this big.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_rat_ItemFlavorText: Once stuffed with scrap and supplies pilfered from the Facility, returning it to its former state is the goal of any good Rat.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_night_ItemFlavorText: One of them was said to have placed the sigil across their eyes. A curse against the enemy? A boon against the dark of Night? Regrettably, it was neither.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_ratsuit_ItemFlavorText: Ostensibly, these "Lab Rats" are known to be as meticulous as they are unhinged. Combining deep science with utter devotion to the cause, this path has led the Rats to a field of science that may not even exist.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_groupe_ItemDescription: Padded and gloved, these arm guards are ready for snow - and bullets.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_groupe_ItemDescription: Padded for protection in cold climes and combat, the cozyness of this jacket-vest combination is only rivaled by its sheer weight.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cqc_ItemFlavorText: Regardless of its authenticity, a solid piece of frontline armor.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_garden_ItemDescription: Rough green gloves, typically worn by gardeners and those working with thorny plants.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_tech_ItemDescription: Science combines with ingenuity to create a chestplate that's effective, light and just a little bit comfy.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_lab_ItemDescription: Sleek white gloves, typically worn by lab workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue arm protection worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue armored helmet worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_securitycap_ItemDescription: Standard-issue cap worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_security_ItemDescription: Standard-issue leg protection worn by the GATE Defense Team.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_tech_ItemDescription: Strong arm covers to keep threats at bay.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_bionic_ItemFlavorText: Stronger. Faster. Eh, you know the rest.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_gloves_work_ItemDescription: Sturdy gloves typically worn by construction workers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_breacher_ItemFlavorText: The Breachers are paying penance, deployed on the front lines with a constant reminder of their guilt.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemDescription: The hallmark of a true chef.
ItemTable_Gear.backpack_jetpack_ItemFlavorText: The potential danger almost outweighs the fun. Almost.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate certain weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_biometric_t2_ItemDescription: These armwraps don't provide much armor, but they do allow the wearer to operate special weapons.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_chest_leadvest_ItemFlavorText: This could work as armor... For now.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_cowl_ItemFlavorText: To the Sagittarii of The Order, the hood represents protection from the evils of the world, and the narrow focus required to cleanse it.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_blacksmithinggloves_ItemDescr: Very heavy gloves, typically worn by metalworkers.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_chefhat_ItemFlavorText: Well, you LOOK like you can cook, anyway.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_legs_snowpants_ItemDescription: When these pants are worn, warmth no longer becomes a need, but an entire state of being.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_hazmat_ItemDescription: Worn by scientists to study radiation and biohazardous materials. Greatly reduces radiation buildup.
ItemTable_Gear.suit_fire_ItemDescription: Worn by volcano researchers and molten manufacturing workers. Blocks most exposure to high heat and flame.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_carbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are king of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_helmet_scarbuncle_ItemFlavorText: You are queen of the carbuncles. Which... doesn't really mean much.
ItemTable_Gear.armor_hat_egg_ItemFlavorText: You know what you are, why not embrace it?
ItemTable_Gear.trinket_kylie_ItemFlavorText: You made her a promise, remember?
ItemTable_Gear.armor_arms_composer_ItemFlavorText: Your arms feel lighter, almost as if they're being suspended by strings.

ItemTable_Pickups.soilbag_ItemDescription: A bag of healthy, fertile soil.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_plastic_ItemDescription: A bag of plastic odds and ends.
ItemTable_Pickups.rubberbands_ItemDescription: A ball of rubber bands. Someone spent a lot of time making this.
ItemTable_Pickups.bandage_ItemDescription: A basic bandage that will stop one instance of bleeding. Does NOT restore health.
ItemTable_Pickups.stapler_ItemDescription: A basic office stapler. Contains springs.
ItemTable_Pickups.woodplank_ItemDescription: A basic piece of wood, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.gravitycube_ItemDescription: A blue, anomalous cube. It appears to affect the gravity of anyone holding it.
ItemTable_Pickups.screws_ItemDescription: A box of screws, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.salt_ItemDescription: A bunch of sodium, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.pens_ItemDescription: A bundle of office pens. You can think of a few clever ways to utilize these.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_military_ItemDescription: A bundle of random military-grade electronics. Nothing too helpful by itself.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_ItemDescription: A can of petroleum-based oil. Used for repair and crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.batterycharger_ItemDescription: A charging kit for regular car batteries. Perhaps it can be repurposed...
ItemTable_Pickups.gigaglue_ItemDescription: A common adhesive used to bind things together.
ItemTable_Pickups.casefan_ItemDescription: A computer case fan, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.circuitboard_ItemDescription: A computer circuit board, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.harddrive_ItemDescription: A computer hard drive, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.powersupply_ItemDescription: A computer power supply unit, used in crafting advanced electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.coil_ItemDescription: A copper coiling, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_black_ItemDescription: A dark, oleaginous liquid extracted from IS-0207.
ItemTable_Pickups.neutrinomapper_ItemDescription: A device containing a chart of particle locational data, tuned to a specific frequency. Collected by the astronomers of the GATE Voussoir Facility.
ItemTable_Pickups.burner_ItemDescription: A device used for heating up chemicals. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.ammo_disc_ItemDescription: A disc with a very sharp edge.
ItemTable_Pickups.fireextinguisher_ItemDescription: A fire extinguisher consisting of a compressed air can.
ItemTable_Pickups.gel_ItemDescription: A gel from the Anteverse with extremely unstable properties.
ItemTable_Pickups.beaker_ItemDescription: A glass tube used for experiments.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_gold_ItemDescription: A gold-plated CPU, recovered from a mobile artillery unit.
ItemTable_Pickups.geigercounter_ItemDescription: A hand-held radiation detector. Point it at yourself to check your own radiation level.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_tech_ItemDescription: A handful of random technological junk.
ItemTable_Pickups.lcd_screen_ItemDescription: A handy display for electronic devices.
ItemTable_Pickups.organ_ItemDescription: A hard-shelled gas apparatus that can produce noises audible far beyond its size and shape would imply.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_bio_ItemDescription: A heap of biological scrap. Might come in handy.
ItemTable_Pickups.capacitor_ItemDescription: A heavy device used for storing or discharging energy.
ItemTable_Pickups.anvil_ItemDescription: A heavy object, useful for acting as a giant paperweight. Might also be helpful in repairing stuff too, with the right additions.
ItemTable_Pickups.aircompressor_ItemDescription: A high pressure air transfer unit, might be useful for things that require copious amounts of air power.
ItemTable_Pickups.receptor_ItemDescription: A high-end optical detector for registering photon emission.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_ItemDescription: A high-tech CPU, recovered from something extraordinary.
ItemTable_Pickups.cable_fibre_ItemDescription: A high-tech fibre optic cable, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.diode_ItemDescription: A high-tech laser diode, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_security_ItemDescription: A high-tech security key clearly used to keep important things locked up tight.
ItemTable_Pickups.anomaly_ItemDescription: A indecipherable entity that appears to respond to glass and has a peculiar attraction to plant life.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_porcelain_ItemDescription: A large ceramic key of misty origin.
ItemTable_Pickups.saltrock_ItemDescription: A large lump of salt, perhaps salvageable into a useable product.
ItemTable_Pickups.organ_partial_ItemDescription: A lump of structured tissue and something reminiscent of pottery, harmoniously intertwined.
ItemTable_Pickups.cpu_purple_ItemDescription: A modified CPU, recovered from an automoton that is as incredible as it is aggressive.
ItemTable_Pickups.powderedcrystal_ItemDescription: A mysterious powdered crystal residue. Tiny arachnids crawl through the sandy substance.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_metal_ItemDescription: A pile of metal. Definitely useful for crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.emptymug_ItemDescription: A porcelain mug, bereft of any sustenance.
ItemTable_Pickups.pressuregauge_ItemDescription: A pressure gauge, used for crafting things of SCIENCE.
ItemTable_Pickups.brick_cpu_ItemDescription: A purpose-made CPU housing, used for crafting electronics that need a little brain inside them.
ItemTable_Pickups.brick_memory_ItemDescription: A purpose-made data housing, used for crafting electronics that require memory.
ItemTable_Pickups.brick_power_ItemDescription: A purpose-made power housing, used for crafting electronics that require power.
ItemTable_Pickups.pipe_hydro_ItemDescription: A reinforced pipe capable of withstanding massive pressure, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.exorquill_ItemDescription: A sharp biological quill with strange properties. Might be a useful ingredient.
ItemTable_Pickups.gloweye_ItemDescription: A single, still-glowing eye from a Darkwater denizen.
ItemTable_Pickups.feces_ItemDescription: A small bag of feces. Might make good fertilizer.
ItemTable_Pickups.motor_ItemDescription: A small electrical motor. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.controller_ItemDescription: A small electronic device for controlling electronics.
ItemTable_Pickups.book_journal_ItemDescription: A small field journal inscribed with a tight, meticulous script.
ItemTable_Pickups.gunrepairkit_t1_ItemDescription: A small gun repair kit, capable of fixing light firearms.
ItemTable_Pickups.silverchain_ItemDescription: A small sterling chain in need of a good polishing.
ItemTable_Pickups.lens_ItemDescription: A smooth glass lens, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.steelcable_ItemDescription: A spool of a strong steel cable.
ItemTable_Pickups.gem_ItemDescription: A strange gem from somewhere else.
ItemTable_Pickups.essence_reaper_ItemDescription: A strange orb from the evernight realm.
ItemTable_Pickups.alienwheat_ItemDescription: A strange wheat from another, even stranger place. Possible healing properties.
ItemTable_Pickups.acid_ItemDescription: A strong acidic chemical, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.enethiol_ItemDescription: A strong chemical, used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.hose_reinforced_ItemDescription: A strong hose, sufficient to withstand large amounts of pressure.
ItemTable_Pickups.woodplank_reinforced_ItemDescription: A strong piece of wood, should be sufficient to create barricades and more.
ItemTable_Pickups.pipe_metal_ItemDescription: A sturdy metal pipe. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_ropeplant_ItemDescription: A tenacious seed from a hanging plant with a traveling vine.
ItemTable_Pickups.ichor_ItemDescription: A thick blue liquid with transdimensional tendencies.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_composer_ItemDescription: A thick remnant of shell, with a resonance similar to heated clay.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_kevlar_ItemDescription: A tight stack of extremely strong, heat-resistant textiles.
ItemTable_Pickups.cog_ItemDescription: A toothed cog for engaging spinning objects. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.crackedlight_ItemDescription: A useful collection of components from a military-grade shoulder-lamp, but none of them intact.
ItemTable_Pickups.hose_ItemDescription: A very basic hose, useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.liquidcrystal_ItemDescription: A vial containing some sort of liquid crystal.
ItemTable_Pickups.oil_fish_ItemDescription: A viscous oil derived from fish flesh.
ItemTable_Pickups.composer_tablet_ItemDescription: A worn ceramic-like artefact, engraved with what appear to be words and symbols.
ItemTable_Pickups.book_journal_ItemFlavorText: Although not general orthodoxy, it is a foundational tenet of the Sagittari code that they perform a divine act by releasing the spirit from the flesh.
ItemTable_Pickups.bandage_t2_ItemDescription: An advanced bandage that will completely stop heavy bleeding.
ItemTable_Pickups.quantumglass_ItemDescription: An alien crystal refined into an extraordinary glass material.
ItemTable_Pickups.glowshard_ItemDescription: An anomalous glowing shard. Its surface seems to emit a white light with no discernible origin.
ItemTable_Pickups.key_ornate_ItemDescription: An elegant key, typically held by The Order's higher-ranked operatives.
ItemTable_Pickups.projectionmatrix_ItemDescription: An exceedingly powerful beam projector. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.carbonplating_ItemDescription: An extra-strong composite built from a mix of earthly and alien materials.
ItemTable_Pickups.storagechip_ItemDescription: An extremely dense storage device with a built-in neural bridge. Almost anything could fit inside here.
ItemTable_Pickups.slushie_ItemDescription: An ice cold beverage with a kick of flavor. May cause a slight chill.
ItemTable_Pickups.refinedcarbon_ItemDescription: An immaculate and peculiar carbon spheroid.
ItemTable_Pickups.gunrepairkit_t2_ItemDescription: An intermediate gun repair kit, capable of fixing medium-sized firearms.
ItemTable_Pickups.pocketwatch_ItemDescription: An old time-telling device, full of useful little components.
ItemTable_Pickups.FULLWATERPOT_ItemDescription: Any sort of pot of water, filled to the brim with clean water.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_glass_ItemDescription: Bits and pieces of collected glass.
ItemTable_Pickups.fishbones_ItemDescription: Bones from a fish of some kind.
ItemTable_Pickups.alienwheat_ItemFlavorText: Calling this a grain is stretching the definition.
ItemTable_Pickups.bucket_metal_ItemDescription: Can be filled with many types of liquids, including molten material.
ItemTable_Pickups.bucket_plastic_ItemDescription: Can be filled with many types of liquids.
ItemTable_Pickups.waterbottle_ItemDescription: Can be filled with water and used in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_rice_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow Xanterium Rice.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_antelight_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a glowy Antelight.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_antelight_blue_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a glowy blue Antelight.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_antelight_GRN_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a glowy green Antelight.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_antelight_pink_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a glowy pink Antelight.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_antelight_red_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a glowy red Antelight.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_supertomato_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a plant with large, tomato-like fruit.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_vine_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow a protective Snag Vine plant.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_greyeb_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow an attractive Greyeb plant.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_eggplant_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow an interesting and edible "egg" plant.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_tomato_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow hearty tomatoes.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_wheat_ItemDescription: Can be planted in a Garden Plot to grow rejuvenating Anteverse Wheat.
ItemTable_Pickups.composer_tablet_ItemFlavorText: Gazing at this tablet, you sense meanings embedded in the inscriptions on its surface, but cannot quite grasp them. Images of light and shadow come to mind, of bodies connected by immaterial threads, mist and distress, and behind or perhaps beneath it all, a sense of intention and desire, and of anger suppressed. For some reason, in spite of it all, two words appear clearly in your mind: The Puppeteer.
ItemTable_Pickups.powercell_ItemDescription: High tech nonsense. Probably very useful.
ItemTable_Pickups.crackedlight_ItemFlavorText: If only you had new lenses...
ItemTable_Pickups.iodinetablets_ItemDescription: Iodine tablets that can reduce radiation someone receives, as well as reduce radiation they currently have.
ItemTable_Pickups.seed_nyxshade_ItemDescription: It feels strangely inert for the time being.
ItemTable_Pickups.essence_reaper_ItemFlavorText: It's cold to the touch, like a stone left out in the autumn dark.
ItemTable_Pickups.feces_donotspawn_ItemDescription: It's pretty much what you think it is.
ItemTable_Pickups.refinedcarbon_ItemFlavorText: It's quite heavy for its size.
ItemTable_Pickups.bandage_ItemFlavorText: Just some rags, but it'll do.
ItemTable_Pickups.chains_ItemDescription: Links of metal. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.yetifur_ItemDescription: Natural fibers with an exceedingly high insulation value.
ItemTable_Pickups.infrared_emitter_ItemFlavorText: Not just your average TV remote.
ItemTable_Pickups.receptor_ItemFlavorText: Not that different to the human eye, really.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_bio_ItemFlavorText: Not to be confused for actual food.
ItemTable_Pickups.coil_v2_ItemDescription: Often used for conducting high amounts of electricial energy, this coiled enamel wire greatly increases the output of electrical devices. Useable in crafting.
ItemTable_Pickups.canteen_ItemFlavorText: Sagittari training has ancient roots, but their true founding traces to the aftermath of the Albigenisan Crusade in the 12th Century.
ItemTable_Pickups.flashlight_basic_ItemDescription: Shed some light on the subject.
ItemTable_Pickups.grease_ItemDescription: Slippery grease for things that need to slip.
ItemTable_Pickups.tinygears_ItemDescription: Small gears for itsy bitsy machines.
ItemTable_Pickups.essence_leyak_ItemDescription: Some kind of discharge recovered from IS-0091 after it's exposed to high-intensity X-Rays.
ItemTable_Pickups.growth_ItemDescription: Some sort of nano-mechanical storage system.
ItemTable_Pickups.carapace_ItemDescription: Some tough insectoid shell from an insect in Anteverse II.
ItemTable_Pickups.rebar_ItemDescription: Strong steel bars used in crafting and other things.
ItemTable_Pickups.anomaly_ItemFlavorText: Surely there's something in the GATE Compendium about this...
ItemTable_Pickups.ichor_ItemFlavorText: The internal fluids of a titan.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_kevlar_ItemFlavorText: The mother of all synthetic aramids.
ItemTable_Pickups.neutrinomapper_ItemFlavorText: Theoretically, this is a device containing all of the neutrinos in the known universe, past, present, and future, but that would be impossible, so it's probably not that.
ItemTable_Pickups.ITEM_MISSING_ItemDescription: This recipe's item is not set up yet. If you see this, something is missing.
ItemTable_Pickups.rotary_pump_ItemDescription: Useable in crafting a range of devices.
ItemTable_Pickups.fryingpan_ItemDescription: Used for frying up food, mostly.
ItemTable_Pickups.ducttape_ItemDescription: Used in crafting recipes and can repair items in a pinch.
ItemTable_Pickups.transformer_round_ItemDescription: Useful for crafting electrical and other equipment.
ItemTable_Pickups.scrap_cloth_ItemDescription: Various cloth bits from clothing and the like.
ItemTable_Pickups.feces_donotspawn_ItemFlavorText: We don't talk about that dimension.
ItemTable_Pickups.ducttape_ItemFlavorText: You know exactly what this is.
ItemTable_Pickups.solder_ItemDescription: Your basic solder material, created from melting silver and metal in a cooking pot.

ItemTable_Plants.Plant_Dead_ItemDescription: A dead plant. Whatever it was, it was left unattended for too long.

ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.BigOfficeCouches_ItemTypeDescription: Any basic medium-to-large couches. Must be packaged version.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyCookedPest_ItemTypeDescription: Any cooked portion of a Pest.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyStandardRawFilet_ItemTypeDescription: Any kind of standard-sized fish filet. Must be uncooked.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyFilingCabinet_ItemTypeDescription: Any of the many available filing cabinets. Must be packaged version.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyDesk_ItemTypeDescription: Any of the many available office desks. Must be packaged version.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyOfficeCouch_ItemTypeDescription: Any office couches. Must be packaged version.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyTomato_ItemTypeDescription: Any sort of Tomato, super or otherwise.
ItemTable_RecipeSubstitutes.AnyBarrel_ItemTypeDescription: Any sort of drum or barrel that can hold liquid.

ItemTable_Weapons.laserkatana_ItemDescription: A blade that unleashes deadly laser energy when swung.
ItemTable_Weapons.shotgun_doublebarrel_ItemDescription: A break-action double barrel shotgun of a rather old make.
ItemTable_Weapons.rifle_groupe_ItemDescription: A burst-fire assault rifle designed to deliver exceptional damage to anything down range.
ItemTable_Weapons.canesword_ItemDescription: A cane containing a hidden blade
ItemTable_Weapons.net_launcher_ItemDescription: A compact cannon that launches electrified nets at high velocity and over greater distances. Stuns larger beasts than thrown nets and deals some electrical damage.
ItemTable_Weapons.magnum_military_ItemFlavorText: A few shots from this should put down most things on Earth. However...
ItemTable_Weapons.keresphere_ItemDescription: A grenade that causes those within its yield to flee in terror.
ItemTable_Weapons.handdrill_ItemDescription: A hand-made power tool for construction. Can be used to package like a screwdriver.
ItemTable_Weapons.powerdrill_ItemDescription: A hand-made power tool for construction. Can be used to package like a screwdriver.
ItemTable_Weapons.screwdriver_ItemDescription: A handy tool for building furniture and a few other things. Required for construction and packaging of certain objects.
ItemTable_Weapons.cafeteriatray_ItemDescription: A hard, durable plastic food tray. Could be used to create some defensive items.
ItemTable_Weapons.shiv_ItemDescription: A hastily-made blade for stabbing things. Don't expect it to last.
ItemTable_Weapons.riotshield_ItemDescription: A heavy-duty shield originally designed for crowd-control.
ItemTable_Weapons.heavy_laser_ItemDescription: A hefty laser cannon for sustained firing and an alternate mode for massive output.
ItemTable_Weapons.weapon_pipe_ItemDescription: A hefty pipe with a gauge on the end for added weight.
ItemTable_Weapons.magnum_military_ItemDescription: A high-powered handcannon capable of neutralizing large foes and completely obliterating smaller ones.
ItemTable_Weapons.rifle_sniper_ItemDescription: A high-powered, bolt-action, military-grade sniper rifle.
ItemTable_Weapons.scrapshot_ItemFlavorText: A high-tech way to fling a bunch of screws in something's face.
ItemTable_Weapons.scrapshot_flashlight_ItemFlavorText: A high-tech way to fling a bunch of screws in something's face.
ItemTable_Weapons.teethclub_ItemDescription: A huge, heavy club armed with sharp teeth from an alien lifeform.
ItemTable_Weapons.hammer_impact_ItemDescription: A hydraulic sledgehammer with a secondary blow on weakened targets.
ItemTable_Weapons.knife_groupe_ItemDescription: A knife with only one purpose.
ItemTable_Weapons.disc_launcher_ItemDescription: A launcher that propels grinder discs at high velocity.
ItemTable_Weapons.pickaxe_ItemDescription: A massive digging tool, albeit a touch out of date for the circumstances.
ItemTable_Weapons.crowbar_advanced_ItemDescription: A powerful close-quarters weapon that drags enemies towards you.
ItemTable_Weapons.rifle_assault_ItemDescription: A powerful rapid-fire assault rifle with perplexing runes etched into the metal.
ItemTable_Weapons.smg_military_ItemDescription: A rapid-fire sub-machine gun of an unusual make, brought here by a paramilitary force.
ItemTable_Weapons.quillrifle_ItemDescription: A re-engineered bioweapon, turning Exor quills into deadly homing bolts.
ItemTable_Weapons.oar_ItemDescription: A rickety old oar, somehow heavier than it looks.
ItemTable_Weapons.crossbow_ItemDescription: A scrappy crossbow made from office supplies.
ItemTable_Weapons.plasticshield_ItemDescription: A shield made from a plastic tray, reinforced with some duct tape.
ItemTable_Weapons.techshield_ItemDescription: A shield that delivers an electric discharge when struck.
ItemTable_Weapons.crowbar_ItemDescription: A solid piece of steel, but not something you could just swing about with one hand.
ItemTable_Weapons.spear_makeshift_ItemDescription: A spear assembled from office and kitchen supplies.
ItemTable_Weapons.spear_harpoon_ItemDescription: A spear capable of dragging targets towards you.
ItemTable_Weapons.spear_tech_ItemDescription: A spear with high electrical discharge, capable of sending bolts of lightning towards additional targets.
ItemTable_Weapons.weapon_pipe_t2_ItemDescription: A strong, sturdy pipe, but nothing you haven't seen before.
ItemTable_Weapons.club_fire_ItemDescription: A sturdy hammer capable of leaving scorching fire at the location it hits.
ItemTable_Weapons.hammer_ItemDescription: A sturdy hammer. Can be used to repair constructed objects and furniture.
ItemTable_Weapons.spear_fire_ItemDescription: A superheated spear capable of dealing explosive fire damage to targets.
ItemTable_Weapons.fishingrod_t1_ItemDescription: A surprisingly effective device for collecting fish.
ItemTable_Weapons.quantum_pick_ItemDescription: A throwable pick that returns automatically to the hand.
ItemTable_Weapons.keresphere_ItemFlavorText: Although the properties of entities and items from Anteverse 39 are still poorly understood, their effects are obvious.
ItemTable_Weapons.shotgun_military_ItemDescription: An assault shotgun, coated in black.
ItemTable_Weapons.sword_ItemDescription: An edged, bladed weapon intended for cutting
ItemTable_Weapons.sceptre_tech_ItemDescription: An electrically charged mace. Requires a charge to deal electrical damage and knock back enemies.
ItemTable_Weapons.pistol_pipe_ItemDescription: An electromagnetically charged projectile launcher. It's sort of like a pistol.
ItemTable_Weapons.sledgehammer_ItemDescription: An exceptionally heavy hammer for pounding things into the ground.
ItemTable_Weapons.kiteshield_ItemDescription: An old shield from a bygone age.
ItemTable_Weapons.ratscanner_ItemDescription: An ornamented device built for scanning something in the environment that isn't immediately clear. Should make a decent whacking stick, though.
ItemTable_Weapons.scrapshot_flashlight_ItemDescription: Break action electromagnetic scrap shotgun with a flashlight attached to it.
ItemTable_Weapons.explosive_sledgehammer_ItemDescription: Incredible tech meets incredible heft, with this large sledgehammer that uses Explosive Cartridges as ammunition.
ItemTable_Weapons.baton_starter_ItemFlavorText: It's a bit worse for wear.
ItemTable_Weapons.pickaxe_carbon_ItemDescription: Lighter than a normal pickaxe, consuming less stamina when swung.
ItemTable_Weapons.screwdriver_makeshift_ItemDescription: Makeshift screwdriver for assembling furniture and other deployable structures. Can be used to package like a screwdriver.
ItemTable_Weapons.slushiebomb_ItemDescription: Once an ice cold drink, now turned into an ice bomb of sorts. Can really put a chill on any encounter.
ItemTable_Weapons.crossbow_science_ItemFlavorText: Part bow, part railgun, just watch where you point it.
ItemTable_Weapons.heatershield_ItemDescription: Portable protection that brings the heat.
ItemTable_Weapons.laserkatana_ItemFlavorText: Sometimes the only answer is: 'Why not?'
ItemTable_Weapons.vacuum_ItemDescription: Super powerful makeshift vacuum. Good for sucking up items and maybe even small critters.
ItemTable_Weapons.pickaxe_carbon_ItemFlavorText: These facts are largely irrelevant for the creature on the receiving end.
ItemTable_Weapons.spear_harpoon_ItemFlavorText: While it may lack inherent efficiency, it more than makes up for it in brutal pragmatism.
ItemTable_Weapons.pistol_security_flashlight_ItemDescripti: Your standard-issue firearm for facility security, with a flashlight duct taped to it.
ItemTable_Weapons.pistol_security_ItemDescription: Your standard-issue firearm for facility security.
ItemTable_Weapons.umbrella_ItemDescription: portable protection from rain or sun

StringTable_MenuText.menu_demonotice_fulltext:
Abiotic Factor is undergoing active development.

We hope you enjoy what we’re creating, and please leave feedback if you’d like by using the feedback or bug report buttons available in the menus.

We’re also collecting some anonymous gameplay data, such as what players craft and kill, and how long it takes to reach certain areas, in order to help us improve the game.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_host_advanced_warningtext: Advanced sandbox settings are not recommended for beginners. These rules can create a very unbalanced and unintended experience. Proceed at your own risk.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this world save? This cannot be undone.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_quittutorial_description: Are you sure you want to skip the Introduction? You will learn many important things, but you can also play the Introduction again at any time.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_quit_description: Are you sure you wish to abandon your colleagues?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_quit_subtext: Are you sure you wish to abandon your colleagues?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_quit_host_description:
Are you sure you wish to abandon your colleagues?

You are the host of this game and anyone connected will be removed from the game as well.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_serverbrowser_modified_2_desc: BIG warning! You are joining a server using some very non-standard rules for gameplay. This could result in unbalanced gameplay or a very wild experience. This is not recommended for first-time players or players who want to experience the game as intended by the developers. Are you sure you want to join this server?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_traitselect_blankslate: BLANK SLATE: This job does not give any extra skill points.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_notice_deletesave:
Do you wish to delete the facility save file "{1}"?

This will delete ALL progress and save data within the facility save, INCLUDING ALL CHARACTER SAVE FILES associated with the facility save. This action is PERMANENT and can not be undone.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_compendium_exploration: Exploring the Facility is probably the best way to find more information about this topic.

FEAR OF VIOLENCE
You're too afraid to learn this skill.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_notice_savecorrupt: Failed to load World Save. Would you like to restore from backup?

StringTable_MenuText.menu_serverbrowser_modified_3_desc: HUGE warning! You are joining a server that is operating using modified game files that have not been verified by any third party or the developers. This could cause extreme changes to the gameplay experience, cause crashes or result in your profile saves being modified. The developers can not guarantee ANYTHING about the experience you're about to have. Join at your own risk and only if you are sure you understand what you're doing.

StringTable_MenuText.menu_serverbrowser_modified_1_desc: Warning! You are joining a server using non-standard rules for gameplay. This could result in unbalanced gameplay. This is not recommended for first-time players or players who want to experience the game as intended by the developers. Are you sure you want to join this server?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_youtubebutton_popup: Watch our trailers and shorts on YouTube!
StringTable_MenuText.menu_serverbrowser_newscientist_desc:
We have detected that your profile is new to Abiotic Factor. Please consider carefully before joining random public servers as your first-time experience may differ wildly. We recommend new players play singleplayer or with friends for the first time, from the beginning of the game, in order to experience the story and progression as intended without spoilers or confusing unexplained mechanics.

That said, we trust you to make the right decision. That's why you work at GATE, after all.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_tutorial_replaynotice:
Would you like to re-experience your introduction to the GATE Cascade Research Facility?

Don't worry, this will not affect your world or character save data in other worlds.
StringTable_MenuText.os_email_notice:
YOU ARE ACCESSING A GATE INTRANET E-MAIL SERVER. 

FOR EMPLOYEE EYES ONLY.
StringTable_MenuText.Menu_popup_nopassword_confirm: Yes, I want to host a public server.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_unstick_warning:
You are about to perform a force respawn. This will count as a death, and your corpse will remain at this location. This will allow you to respawn at your last viable spawn point.

This is not recommended unless you're REALLY stuck! Please report stuck locations to the developers so they can be fixed.

Are you sure you want to perform a force respawn?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_popup_nopassword_subtext: You are hosting a public server without a password. Abiotic Factor is a co-operative game. Did you intend to start a sever that anyone can join?
StringTable_MenuText.menu_compendium_nosoup: You don't know any soup recipes. Experiment with cooking to learn new soup recipes.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_kickedreason_default: You were kicked by an admin.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_servername_playername: Your player name will be the server name.
StringTable_MenuText.menu_jobselect: Your science skills will grow over time, but your chosen profession gives you an immediate skill advantage. Ask yourself: What kind of scientist are you? Hover over a job to learn more.

StringTable_Notices.newgame_positivenegativetraits_note:
Character Traits are what make you special and set you apart from your colleagues.

You can select POSITIVE and NEGATIVE traits. If you select NEGATIVE traits, you have more points to select on POSITIVE ones.

You have a limited number of points, so choose wisely!
StringTable_Notices.newgame_charactersaves_note:
In Abiotic Factor, your character is saved on a per-world basis. This means your character’s Traits, Skills, Items, Equipment and progress are tied to a given server.

Visual customization is stored locally and carried between servers.

You need to select a Job and starting Traits for your character with each new world, which you’ll do now.

StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_throwing: Each level increases how far you can throw objects of all kinds. XP is primarily gained by throwing weapons, grenades, throwable devices and even miscellaneous objects.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_agriculture: Each level increases how fast plants planted by you regrow once they're harvested. XP is primarily gained by planting, tending to and harvesting plants.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_construction: Each level increases how fast you construct with screwdrivers and how likely you are to keep furniture intact when packaging it. XP is primarily gained by constructing and deconstructing furniture.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sneaking: Each level increases how long it takes enemies to detect your presence. XP is primarily gained by sneaking around dangerous, active enemies.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_firstaid: Each level increases how much extra health is regained when using medical items. XP is primarily gained by using and crafting medical items.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_fishing: Each level increases your ability to pull against a catch without breaking your fishing line as quickly. XP is primarily earned from catching fish and other junk.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_crafting: Each level increases your crafting speed and gives you access to Bench Upgrades. XP is primarily gained by crafting and repairing items.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_bluntmelee: Each level increases your damage with blunt weaponry. XP is primarily gained by bashing enemies with blunt weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sharpmelee: Each level increases your damage with sharp weapons. XP is primarily gained by slicing enemies with sharp weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_accuracy: Each level increases your overall accuracy, reduces recoil, and ranged weapon sway. XP is primarily gained by firing ranged weaponry.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_fortitude: Each level increases your overall health points, particularly that of your head, as well as reduces the damage you take. XP is primarily gained by taking damage from enemies, unfortunately.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_reloading: Each level increases your reload speed by a decent percentage and will eventually reduce how clumsy you are at reloading in general. XP is primarily gained by reloading weapons of all kinds.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_strength: Each level increases your total carrying capacity and eventually unlocks proper access to heavy weapons. XP is primarily gained by traveling with a heavy inventory.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_sprinting: Each level increases your total stamina by a small amount. XP is primarily gained by sprinting over long distances.
StringTable_Skills.skill_tooltip_cooking: Every 5 levels increases your total competence in cooking and ranking up gives you access to new recipes. XP is primarily gained by cooking food, baking and making soups.

StringTable_Traits.PhD_NutritonalSci: A deep understanding of nutrition, physiology and biochemistry means you know how to look after yourself. There's no question: you get out what you put in. You gain extra Cooking XP when crafting cooking items. (Suggested role: Chef)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_HumanBio: For someone with two PhDs, you're surprisingly robust. You're quick and kinetically resilient, decently fit, and can take a few knocks. Your autonomic system is under control. (Suggested role: Defensive Combat)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_MechEng: It wasn't your looks or sparkling conversation that got you here, it was your impressive facility with fabrication and tooling. You gain extra Construction XP when crafting furniture and other construction objects. (Suggested role: Builder)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_Medicine: Research on live subjects has taught you everything about the human body, especially injuries, harm and ailments. Your medical abilities are considerably more advanced than your colleagues. You gain extra First Aid XP when crafting medical items. (Suggested Role: Medic)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_Agriculture: You chose the lab over the farm, but never lost your touch with plants. You know biosciences, genetics, and how things grow - even GATE's most exotic specimens. You gain extra Agriculture XP when crafting farming items. (Suggested role: Gardener)
StringTable_Traits.PHDDesc_Intern: You haven't quite earned your PhD yet, and judging by the state of things, you're not going to any time soon. (Suggested Role: Blank Slate)
StringTable_Traits.PhDDesc_NoPhD: You're fresh, you're green, and probably in way over your head. But what you lack in skill, you make up for in sheer ambition, speed and staying out of everyone's crosshairs. (Suggested Role: Stealth)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_DefenseSecurity: You're one of the brightest officers on the Defense Team, and could've been a scientist yourself. There's a small rift between you and your egghead colleagues, but they respect your strategy. (Suggested Role: Offensive Combat)
StringTable_Traits.PhD_TheoreticalPhys: Your knowledge may be theoretical, but you know everything about how objects move through space, and spend a lot of time planning new gadgets and inventions. You gain extra Crafting XP when inventing item recipes. (Suggested Role: Throwing / Utility)
